loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “ESMERALDA”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es El Sr. Vidal;   él tiene 26 años de edad, El socio es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7, 4 años de edad, El socio es chofer y repartidor de agua, Nuestro socio trabaja dando este servicio de la distribución de agua a diferentes empresas en la ciudad del Cusco y en provincias, El socio necesita comprar una motobomba para mejorar su servicio. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una motobomba.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Vidal belongs to the Esmerelda community bank; he lives in the district of San Sebastian, in the province and department of Cusco. Vidal is 26, lives with his partner and has 3 children ages 9, 7, and 4. He is a driver and a water delivery man. He offers this water distribution service to various companies in the city of Cusco and the provinces. He needs to buy a pump to improve his service; he is requesting this loan to buy a pump. He values and appreciates this support exceedingly and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a pump

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es soltera y vive con sus padres, estudia educación en la Universidad, Nelida vende ropa de mujeres hace 4 años, actividad que realiza 2 días de la semana en las ferias de Americas y Nazarenas, cuenta con la ayuda de su mama, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Nelida es socia Banco Comunal Solidaridad y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones y el incentivo al ahorro. Nelida solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, buzos, blusas.
Los sueños de Nelida son ampliar su negocio, tener una tienda grande y estudiar la carrera de psicología.
texts.en:
Nelida is single and lives with her parents. She is studying education at the University. Nelida has sold women's clothing for 4 years, an activity that she carries out 2 days a week at the Americas and Nazarenas markets. Her mother helps her with the business, and she acquires her products in the city of Lima. Nelida is a member of the communal bank "Solidaridad." What she appreciates most is the training she receives, and the incentives she is given to save. Nelida requests a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of T-shirts, sweatshirts and blouses. Nelida dreams of expanding her business, having a large store and studying for a degree in psychology.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, sweatshirts and blouses

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia A. is from the village of Dadda, Tuguegarao City. She is 66 years old. Cornelia is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Cornelia owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cornelia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Cornelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Cornelia is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Cornelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie F. is from the town of Trento. She is 40 years old. Rosemarie is married and has two infants. To make a living, Rosemarie runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for more than four years. She also helps her husband at their farm. She helps plant and harvest rice crops. Rosemarie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and for farm inputs. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosemarie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster-group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and for farm inputs

loans.name: Yann

texts.en:
Mrs. C. is 47 years of age and the widowed mother of four children, two of whom are already married and live separately and the other two are single and live at home. C. is a good homemaker who either takes care of her children or arranges a daily routine from home.

C. relies on the income from her single kids who work at various jobs: one is a vegetable seller and the other is a sewing laborer in industry.

C. has an old house that often needs repairs, so she would like to request a loan to mend it.

loans.use: To mend her old house

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg T. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband tends to his one hundred head of livestock and Narantsetseg operates a dress-making business in a rented place where she produces various kinds of traditional clothes. She started her business in her home in 2002 after her family moved to the capital town  in the province. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and have her own workshop. She is a very friendly and kind person who says "I am planning to grow my sewing business and one day I will have my own work place." Narantsetseg is requesting a 520,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a new electric sewing machine for her business which will help her to produce her garments faster and of higher quality.

loans.use: To purchase a new electric sewing machine

loans.name: Abra Délali

texts.fr: A. est une femme de 34 ans très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits génériques, elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 8 ans ce qui a fait qu'elle maîtrise tous les contours de ce commerce. elle a constaté une baisse de son stock et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  10 cartons de produits génériques pour se réapprovisionner. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
A., 34, is a very dynamic lady who has been earning income selling generic products for more than 8 years. Over that period, she has learned a lot about selling this sort of merchandise. She has noticed that her inventory is low so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 10 cases of generic products for resale. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of generic products

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 62 years old. Margarita is married. She is engaged in farming. She has been planting and harvesting rice crops for many years now. At her age, she can still manage to perform farming activities. She says she still wants to help provide for her family.

Margarita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yeredon sont toutes mariées, la moyenne d’âge de ces femmes se situe autour de 37 ans et elles en moyenne 4 enfants. Les  femmes du groupe Yeredon vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles de la ville de Yangasso (région de Ségou, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des relation de  voisinage et  de parenté. 
Elles exercent les activités de restauration, de vente de condiments, de bijoux et diverses marchandises.  Ces femmes sont à leur premier le prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Minata K. est une restauratrice en plein cœur de Yangasso, au bord du goudron et MINATA  prépare et vend presque tous les plats Malien. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières à la foire de Bla et de KOUTIALA.
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter, 250 kg de riz, 15 litres d’huile alimentaire, 10kg d’oignons, 1 paquet de cube maggi et le reste pour les petits condiments. 
Elle espère sur un bénéfice de 24500FCFA, somme  qui permettra de rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The members of the Yeredon group are all married women, averaging around 37 years of age and four children. The group members live in large traditional families in the town of Yangasso (Segou Region of Mali).

They know each other as neighbors and relatives. They prepare food for sale as well as sell condiments, jewelry and miscellaneous merchandise. This is their first solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

Minata K. is a food vendor working in the  middle of Yangasso, by the “goudron” [tarmac road]. Minata cooks and sells almost all traditional Malinese plates. She stocks up on her provisions at the markets of Bla and Koutiala. With this loan she plans to purchase 250 kg [550 lbs] of rice, 15 liters [4 gal] of vegetable oil, 10 kg [22 lbs] of onions, 1 pack of “Maggi” bouillon cubes and some condiments. She hopes to achieve an income of 24,500 West African Francs, which will allow her to repay the loan and provide for the family needs.

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for food production

loans.name: Marina Concepcion

texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Communal Bank "Santiago the Patron Saint", located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, province of Azángaro, department of Puno. She is 36 years old and in a common-law marriage with one child. She has a higher education degree. 

Marina has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, and she used the money to increase the capital for her business selling cheese.  She is now asking for a new loan of 300 PEN, money that will be used to buy consumables for her cheese business. Her dream is to have more capital for her business. 

Marina's favorite things about the Communal Bank are the transparency, punctuality, and responsibility.

loans.use: The purchase of consumables for her business selling cheese

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
En el mercado 22 D. enero ubicado en los olivos lima Perú se encuentra el puesto D. abarrotes “DORITA”  la propietaria es la Sra. Dora D. 38 años casada y con 2 hijos ella se siente feliz D. saber que todo su esfuerzo y lucha por salir adelante no fue en vano su historia D. trabajo empieza cuando una amiga le encargo su  puesto D. abarrotes para que ella lo trabaje mientras ella hacia un viaje es así que ella aprendió a trabajar en ese tipo D. negocio durante todo este tiempo le fue muy bien ahora tiene  su propio puesto  donD. venD. todo tipo D. productos como azúcar,leche,arroz, fideos y todo lo necesario para la canasta familiar. Ella no quiere quedarse en el mismo lugar por eso esta buscando trasladar su negocio a un lugar mas granD. para ampliarlo ya que su meta es ser mayorista y abastecer D. productos a las bodegas, Dora es la secretaria del grupo “LA BUENA AMISTAD” ella esta feliz porque en todo este tiempo ha visto su negocio crecer y los prestamos que ha obtenido D. EDAPROSPO fueron D. gran ayuda desD. sus inicios ahora usara su préstamo para seguir comprando productos D. abarrotes  para su negocio.

•	La Sra. Dora esta con polo morado es la séptima.
texts.en:
In the “22 D. enero” (22nd of January) market in Los Olivos, Lima, Peru is the “Dorita” grocery stall.  The stall's owner is Dora who is 38 years old, married and has 2 children.  She feels happy to know that all her effort and fighting to get ahead have not been in vain.  Her work story began when a friend put her in charge of her grocery stall so that she could make a journey. This is how Dora learned to work in the business.  The business went very well and now she has her own stall where she sells all types of products such as sugar, milk, rice, noodles and everything necessary for the family shopping basket.  She does not want to stay in the same spot so she is looking to move her business to a bigger place so that she can expand it since her goal is to be a wholesaler and stock stores with products.  Dora is the secretary of the “La Buena Amistad” (Good Friendship) group.  She is happy because over time she has seen her business grow and the loans which she has received from EDAPROSPO have been a great help from the beginning.  She will use this loan to continue buying grocery products for her business.

* Dora is the seventh lady from the left wearing the purple top

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Calal

texts.ru:
Calal H. 24 qoda. On ne jenat i jivet v Asbheron regione. On jivet odin v obshejitie kvartirantom. Svoyey rabotay on pomoqayet i svoyey semye tak kak yeqo otec ochen bolen i ne mojet rabotat. Tak kak yeqo otec bolen on po etoy prichine brosil uchebu i  nachal rabotat chtobi pomoch semye , v budushem on xochet  opat uchitsya  yesli konechno je pozvolyat vozmojnosti.

Calal uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji odejdi. Ranshe on ne imel pomesheniya dlya prodaji i poetomu prodoval na rukax . Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye zimniye tovari dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en:
Calal H. is 24 years old.  He is single and lives in the Absheron region.  He lives alone in a dormitory.  He helps his family by working.  His father is very ill and cannot work.  Because his father is so ill, Calal gave up his studies to work and help his family.  In the future, he would like to start studying again if it ever becomes possible.

Calal has been in the business of selling clothes for four years.  Earlier, he did not have a shop, so he sold clothes he carried by hand.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy new winter clothes for resale.

loans.use: buy goods resale.

loans.name: Nandiwè

texts.fr: Nandiwè est mariée et a 2 enfants. Elle a 32 ans. Pour contribuer au ménage, elle exerce comme activité la vente des épices. Elle est née à Sotouboua au nord du pays et vit à adidogomé où elle exerce son activité. Elle cumule 8 ans dans cette activité et achète au grand marché de Lomé. Pour accroitre son commerce, elle demande un crédit.
texts.en:
Nandiwè is married and has 2 children. She is 32 years old. To contributive to the household, she sell spices. 

She was born in Sotouboua and lives in  Adidogomé, where she carries out her activity. She has been selling spices for 8 years and buys them at the grand market in Lomé. In order to expand her business, she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: To buy spices

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 34-year-old married man with three children.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and has gained knowledge of business record keeping. These skills have helped him run his Jes Engineering business for seven years, selling motor vehicle spare parts. He hopes to fully establish his business in the future. He plans to use this 50,000 KES loan to buy a valve grinding machine.

loans.use: to buy a valve grinding machine

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is from the town of Plaridel. She is 44 years old. Wilma is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Wilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her  family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic items.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala es una madre D. familia D. 39 años D. edad, que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en la zona rural del caserío Sinchi Roca del distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta D. alimentos desD. hace cuatro años, ella prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta al público en general en un puesto que está ubicado al frente D. una Entidad Financiera. El negocio goza D. muy buena acogida por parte D. sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara su comida. Pascuala se vale D. los ingresos que recibe D. esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía D. su familia.

Pascuala desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. insumos D. modo que pueda ampliar su producción, ofreciendo variedad D. platos y aumentar sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a 39 year old mother who lives with her husband and two children in the rural village of Sinchi Roca in the District of TambogranD.. This farming area is situated in Piura region and located more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Pascuala has been preparing and selling food for four years. She prepares her dishes at home and later offers them for sale to the general public from a stand located in front of a financial establishment. Her business has earned a good reception because her customers have discovered the good flavor of the food she prepares. Pascuala uses the earnings from her business to help her husband cover the family expenses.

She wants to expand her business by purchasing supplies so that she can increase production, offer a variety of dishes, and increase her sales. For this reason, Pascuala is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her business

loans.name: José Adrian

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 53 años de edad, que reside junto a su familia en el caserío La Pilca ubicado en el distrito de Olmos. Un distrito agrícola conocido como la capital del Limón que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo

José se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. Él cría desde hace 8 años ganado ovino y caprino, especialmente ovejas, en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

José desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is father to a family and is 53-years-old. He lives with his family in the village La Pilca located in the Olmos district. It is an agricultural district known as the Lemon Capital and is in the Lambayeque province, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

José works in agriculture. He has raised sheep and goats, especially ewes, in a pen near his home for 8 years. He feeds them natural grains and grasses and when they have grown to a good size he offers them for sale to the dealers who regularly visit the area in which he lives.

José would like to buy more animals and balanced feedstock to grow his business and to receive a higher income. For this reason he saw fit to request a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his objective.

José is a suitably earnest and hard working man, his biggest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so as to be able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy livestock and balanced feedstock

loans.name: Las Mujeres Para El Desarrollo De Villa Madrid Group

texts.es:
El comité “Las mujeres para el desarrollo D. Villa Madrid” se formó con la unión D. varias vecinas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso.
Las integrantes son muy unidas y cuentan con personas guías con gran potencial D. liderazgo que las ayudan a seguir adelante, así también tienen integrantes muy humildes pero con ganas D. crecer como personas y como equipo aún sabiendo que la convivencia es difícil.
La sra. Gladys C. es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y sacrificada, ella posee un pequeño negocio, una tienda donD. venD. desD. frutas y verduras hasta materiales D. limpieza del hogar. Abrió su pequeña tienda general decidida a conseguir mayores ingresos familiares, pues comenta que antes D. poder poseer el negocio, pasaron días en que no tenía ni para alimentarse ella misma, por eso procura progresar para que ninguno D. sus hijos pase por lo mismo, para que no sufran, y que por el contrario, puedan estudiar y ganar un salario digno que les facilite la vida.
Ella desea poder conseguir el crédito para prosperar tanto ella como su familia.
texts.en:
The “Las mujeres para el desarrollo D. Villa Madrid” (Women for the Development of Villa Madrid) village bank started when a number of neighborhood women came together in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.
It's a tight-knit group, with some members who are strong leaders who help the others move forward, and some who are more timid but who want to grow as people and as a team, even though it can be challenging.
Mrs. Gladys C. is very dedicated to her family and makes a lot of sacrifices for them. She has a small business selling everything from fruits and vegetables to household cleaning products. She decided to open her small store to increase her income for her family. Before opening the store, days would go by when she didn't even have enough food to feed herself. It is for this reason that she wants to progress, so that none of her children have to suffer, can study, and make a decent salary. She'd like to receive this loan so she and her family can prosper.

loans.use: Ampliamiento de sus negocios o tiendas generales.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is 55 years old and married to K., who operates a sweetmeat selling business. His shop is located in the market and he sells variety of sweets at reasonable rates. He has been operating this business for the past 40 years. He has a good clientele base in his area who buy sweetmeat from him due to its good taste. 

Zubaida is a very supportive woman. She assists her husband financially by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. She receives regular orders from ladies in her community and fulfills them on time to earn an income. 

She lives in a small city called Borewala, in a two-room brick house with her family. Borewala is located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its wood works, like furniture. She has been living there for the past 50 years. 
She is the mother of a daughter and two sons. Her eldest son sells bread (by operating a tandoor, a kind of oven made of sand, and uses fire in it to make bread) while the others are studying at a local school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her son’s bread-selling business. With the loan, he will purchase flour and wood in larger quantities to prepare more bread and make more money. 

He has a number of years of experience in his business and Zubaida hopes that an investment will be a productive one for him. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zubaida.

loans.use: to buy flour and firewood for bread-making

loans.name: Daniel Sankale

texts.en:
Daniel Sankale O. K. is 34 years old, married and a father of  three children. For the past eight years, he has worked as a livestock trader and also a farmer. He earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Daniel has applied for a second loan from KADET LTD to expand his livestock business by buying two sheeps and four goats to rear and sell later at a profit,and also to buy farm inputs.e.g fertilizers,seedlings. 

He dreams of becoming a prominent farmer. Daniel is an industrious man who works hard to attain more despite his limited resources. With the profits generated from this loan, he plans to re-invest in his business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs,sheeps and goats to rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 46  años de edad. Es casada y tiene dos hijos. Reside en casa de hermana junto a su familia en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito más grande de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Gana la vida brindando el servicio de transporte en su taxi. Cuenta con experiencia de 10 años en este rubro. Desea realizar algunos arreglos a su unidad para efectuar eficientemente su labor diaria. También tramitará documentos de su unidad como su seguro y licencia que fueron tomados durante un robo que sufrió. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión, podrá seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes y generando ingresos que usa para el sostenimiento económico de su familia.
texts.en: Manuel is 46 years old. He is married and has two children.  He and his family live with his sister in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, the largest district of the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.  He makes a living providing transportation services in his taxi.  He has been doing this for 10 years.  He wants to make some repairs to his car in order to make his daily work more efficient.  He will also get documents fro his car such as the license and insurance, which were taken during a recent robbery.  For these reasons he is asking for a loan of 2000 new soles.  With this investment he will be able to continue giving good service to his customers and generate income which he uses for the support of his family.

loans.use: to repair his taxi so that he can offer better service to his customers.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José se dedica al transporte publico trabaja en el radio móvil hace 2 años tiene un auto que ahora se encuentra en el mecánico  parado por que su motor se fundió por el uso que le da el señor,  el crédito que se le otorgó es para el cambio de motor para su vehículo y algunas refacciones mas el señor José se hizo cargo de sus dos hijos cuando su esposa lo abandonó  el señor se fue a vivir con su papa quien tiene una casa en la zona de angostura A 15 kilómetros distante de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  También le ayuda a su papa en la atención de su restaurant y con la amplificación de su local, es una persona muy trabajadora siempre velando por sus dos hijos ya que su deseo del Sr. José es el ver algún día profesional a su hijos y personas de bien, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José provides public transportation services.  He’s had a radio dispatched taxi for two years.  It’s currently immobilized at the mechanics because the engine froze due to the use he puts it to. 

The loan granted is to replace the vehicle’s engine and for a few other parts that are needed.  José took charge of his two children when his wife left him.  He went to live with his father who has a house in Angostura, 15 kilometers away from the city of Cochabamba.  He also helps his father tend to his restaurant and to enlarge his locale.

He is a very hard working person who is always watching over his two children because José’s wish is to someday see his children become professionals and upstanding citizens.  

He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to replace his vehicle's engine.

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.es:
María de 24 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Ferreñafe a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Acá sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

María tiene un puesto en el mercado Santa Lucia desde hace unos 4 años, donde vende carne de cerdo, actividad que le permite tener ingresos diarios y cuenta con su propia clientela.  Al ver que su negocio día  a día va creciendo más a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de carne de cerdo y también para cubrir algunos gastos personales, cada vez su clientela se ha ido incrementando en su negocio, lo que le permitirá poder pagar su préstamo y poder ayudar a solventar algunos  gastos de la  casa de sus padres.

María es conocido por ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es más adelante pueda realizar unos estudios para seguir ayudando a sus padres a tenr una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 24, is single living in her parents’ house located in an urban part of Ferreñafe District about 15 minutes from Chiclayo Province.  Residents here are in farming, cattle raising and tourism.

María has had a stand in the Santa Lucia market for about four years where she sells pork, an activity that allows her to earn daily income; she has her own clientele.  Seeing that her business is growing more day by day she thought it necessary to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy larger amounts of pork as well as to cover some personal expenses.  Her clientele in her business has been growing and this will make it possible for her to repay the loan and help cover some of the expenses in her parents’ house.

María is known for being a hard working, responsible person.  The only thing she wants is to later on undertake some schooling to continue to help her parents to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more pork and cover personal expenses.

loans.name: Albert Antonio

texts.es: Albert es un joven de 27 años que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias y tiene un negocio en el cual se dedica a la venta,  decoración y a la provisión de artículos para fiestas en diversos eventos. Su negocio fue primero de un  familiar y su hermana y él estaban allí empleados, hasta que el propietario de esta microempresa decidió dedicarse a otra actividad en la cual tenía mayor experiencia y dio a Albert y a su hermana la primera opción de compra y hasta el momento han logrado sacarlo adelante, pero quieren hacerlo crecer. Este es justamente la meta que en la actualidad tiene Albert porque necesita  comprar una maquinaria para adicionarle a su negocio la decoración de vasos que también sirven como regalos y pueden también venderlos a otros negocios; proyectan que esta sea una  inversión exitosa pues ya han revisado esta alternativa en el mercado y a sus clientes les gusta la idea, además no tener competencia  cercana. Su sueño es lograr el reconocimiento en la ciudad y convertir su negocio en una casa de evento,  avanzar profesionalmente y programar una familia a la cual pueda ofrecerle oportunidades de prosperar.  Albert e un joven persistente y gracias al apoyo de su hermana ha logrado avanzar en el tema de calidad de sus productos y servicios, por eso su propuesta inmediata es fortalecer su unidad de negocios.
texts.en:
Albert is a 27 year old living in the city of Cartagena de Indias and he has a business which sells decorations and party goods for various events. His business was first owned by a family member and Albert and his sister were employed there until the owner of this small business decided to pursue other activities in which he had more experience and gave Albert and his sister first bids on buying the place.  So far they have managed to pull it off, but they want to grow the business. This is precisely Albert's goal now because he needs to buy a machine for adding decorative glasses to his business.  The glasses double as gifts and can also be sold to other businesses.  Albert projected that this will be a successful investment so they have already reviewed this alternative in the market and their customers like the idea; plus there is no nearby competition. 

Albert's dream is to achieve recognition in the city and turn his business into a house event, advance professionally and to have a family that he can offer opportunities to succeed. Albert is a persistent young man, and with the support of his sister, he has made progress on the issue of providing quality products and services.  His immediate proposal is to strengthen his business unit.

loans.use: to purchase machinery to add decorative glasses to his business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann, 31, a resident of Silang, Cavite in the Philippines. She is single but works hard to sustain herself. At this time, she is working hard to continually make enough for her everyday expenses. 

Mary Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, where groceries, toiletries and beverages are sold piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five Philippine pesos' (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. 

Mary Ann earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also earns money through an electronic cellular phone loading station. What she does is to buy electronic cellular phone loads (minutes) in bulk, then resell them at retail. Her profit depends on the network's dealership policy. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 610 PHP in sales every day. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest some of the loan to buy electronic loads from different local networks. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Ann hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to support her sister up to college level. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Phillip is a 41-year-old married man. He runs a food café at Holland, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last five years and has been a success.
 
He has been a KADET client and this marks his third loan to finance his business. With this loan he plans to add more food stock and to refurnish his café. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. Phillip's dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to add more food stock and to refurnish his café

loans.name: Jaime Bolivar

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Jaime desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de Tambogrande, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene,con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar una vaca de raza que va ayudar a mejorar la producción de leche, lo que le permitirá podrá ofrecerlo a un mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Jaime es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca para que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades de estudio en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Jaime is 53 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own home which has water and electricity.  His home is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  The main business activities in this area are farming, livestock raising and making handicrafts.

Jaime has been raising and selling cattle for some years.  His pen is located outside his home.  He feeds his animals balanced feed and natural pasture so that they provide him with a good milk production.  He then sells the milk to the people in his area or takes it to sell in Tambogrande market.  He has regular customers because of the good quality of his milk.  He uses his income to cover his family's financial needs.

Jaime has requested a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a good breed of cow.  This will help him to improve his milk production which will enable him to sell his milk for a better price.  This will allow Jaime to repay his loan and improve his family's quality of life.  Jaime is a hard-working and responsible person.  The only thing he wants is for his business to grow so that his children have other educational opportunities in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a good breed of cow to improve his milk production

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos de 31 años de edad, hace menos de dos años empezó a trabajar como ayudante de una microempresa de artesanías y manualidades y unos meses después de haber iniciado, el propietario de este negocio se fue a Bogotá, la capital de Colombia, dejándolo encargado de este negocio. Carlos aprovecho para disciplinarse y ahorrar, así como para adquirir herramientas de trabajo y construir su propia clientela. Gradualmente continuó especializándose en este aprendizaje, mientras estudia para ser el futuro abogado con el que sueña. Como en la actualidad maneja líneas de productos dirigidos a jóvenes,   almacenes cristianos y distribuidores nacionales, tambien ha construido un mercado en la universidad donde estudia, así como también en el sector donde vive, pues es usual que los jóvenes usen escapularios, rosarios y que las amas de casa celebren sus fiestas entregando en ella souvenires como estampas, botones etc. 
En la actualidad su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo, que no lo deja expandirse y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales como productos resinados, cueros, ganchos, argollas para producir artesanías pues tiene un importante pedido y debe comprar en volumen y de contado, para obtener un buen descuento y responder a su nuevo cliente, con el fin de fidelizarlo y que regrese a comprarle. Su meta más adelante es finalizar su carrera de derecho, y ayudar con su negocio a su familia. Mientras esto ocurre, Carlos trabaja con un empleado a quien le paga diariamente, en su sector no tiene competencia, maneja su microempresa con un margen de contribución del 44.22% y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas promedia de 28,36%.
texts.en:
Carlos, 31, started working as an assistant at a crafts and manual arts micro business a little less than two years ago.  A few months after starting, the owner of this business moved to Bogotá, the capital of Colombia, leaving him in charge of the business.  Carlos took advantage of this to become disciplined and to save up as well as to acquire work tools and establish his own clientele.  Gradually, he continued to specialize in these skills while studying Law to become a lawyer in the future, which is his dream.  He currently handles lines of merchandise directed to young people, Christian stores and national distributors, he’s also built up a market at the university he attends as well as in his neighborhood because it’s common for the young people to wear scapulars and rosaries and it’s also customary for housewives to give away souvenirs at their parties like religious prints, buttons, etc.

His main challenge right now is insufficient working capital which keeps him from expanding and this is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy materials like resinated products, leather, hooks and hoops to make crafts because he has an important pending order and he must buy in quantity and pay cash to receive a good discount and be able to keep his commitment to his new customer to win him over and make him a regular, repeat customer.  His goal for later on is to finish getting his Law degree and help his family with his business.  While this occurs, Carlos works with one employee that he pays daily.  He has no competition in his sector and is handling a contribution margin of 44.22% and a profit margin on sales averaging 28.36%.

loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 42 years old and married with three children.  He sells timber and plywood to earn a living.  He has been in the business for more than 10 years. He has managed to employ two people in his business.  He also owns a car, which he uses for his transport business.  In addition, he earns extra income from his rental houses.

Moses is grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has been able to boost his business.  He hopes to expand his business further.  He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a hardworking 50-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with five children. Four of the children are in school. For the last five years, he has been engaged in the transport business to make a living. He supplements income from this venture with the earnings he makes from dairy farming. He wants in the next five years to own a 'matatu' (a bus). His dream is to be financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy a tuk tuk (a rickshaw). Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now able to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk (rickshaw)

loans.name: Edina

texts.es: La señora Edina trabaja como recepcionista y también se dedica a la venta de carteras y perfumes. El crédito lo requiere para el aumento de capital, el cual lo invertirá en la adquisición de perfumes para varón. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Alto Chijini en la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene un  hijo. Esta es la segunda vez que su préstamo es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Edina works as a receptionist and also sells handbags and perfumes. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital since she plans to invest in the acquisition of men’s colognes. She lives at her parents’ house which is located in the District of Alto Chijini in the city of La Paz. Edina is married and has one child.

This is the second time that her loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy colognes for men.

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr:
Née il y’a 50 ans à Diankabou,  Anta est mariée, mère 4 enfants, et réside avec son époux et ses enfants, dans la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Anta après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée il y a vingt ans, à cette activité d’achat et de vente d’habillements et de vêtements. Elle mène son activité dans son quartier et dans d’autres villes, où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ un an. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Elle compte acheter avec ce présent prêt, 15 pièces de pagnes wax, 5 complets de tissus brodés. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso) avant de les coudre chez les tailleurs brodeurs pour les revendre, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement d’hommes et des femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Anta was born in Diankabou 50 years ago and is married with 4 children. She lives with her husband and their children in the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Anta started trading in clothing 20 years ago, after several failed business ventures. She sells clothes in her local district and surrounding towns, and is much in demand due to the high quality of her products. She decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution about a year ago in order to be able to satisfy increasing customer demand. She is now requesting a second loan from the institution, having fully repaid the previous one. She will use the money to buy 15 Pagnes Wax (traditional, sarong-like clothing) and 5 suits of embroidered fabric. She normally buys her merchandise in the town of Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso), before getting it tailored and ready for resale. She sells the clothes for cash or credit to a mixed clientele of men and women.

Anta thinks she will achieve a monthly profit of around 100 000 FCFA, which will mainly be used to increase her business, contribute to her family's expenses and pay off the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy Wax pagnes and embroidered fabrics.

loans.name: Eternel Plus Group

texts.en:
Mudilawe is the leader of the “Eternel Plus” group consisting of up of 10 members.  They are firmly united to request loans from the MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE RDC so they can develop their businesses.

Mudilawe’s main business is selling foam rubber mattresses.  He has years of experience and works hard with good management skills.  His goal is to open a mattress shop. 

He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business.  Mudilawe earns $50 per week. 

Mudilawe is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having eight previous correctly repaid loans.  He will increase his stock of products with his next loan by buying more mattresses and reselling them at a profit.   

Mudilawe, age 41, is married and has five children, ages 18 months to 14 years old.  Four attend school.

loans.use: to increase his stock of mattresses and to resell them at a profit.

loans.name: Glendy Karen

texts.es:
La señora Glendy es socia del banco comunal Las Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad.
Hace dos años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas, inició su negocio con los S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que le prestó Manuela Ramos.
Tiene dos hijos menores en edad escolar, su negocio lo tiene instalado en su misma casa y no tiene que salir de ella para poder trabajar, no es un negocio que le deja grandes ganancias pero le permite estar con sus hijos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 6 paquetes de gaseosas de varios sabores, 3 paquetes de agua mineral, 3 jabas de gaseosa en botellas retornables, 3 paquetes de sorbetes, 2 paquetes de bolsitas.
Su esposo es administrador de profesión y es el que se encarga de mantener el hogar, los ingresos extras son por parte de Glendy para apoyar con algunos gastos pequeños que a veces necesitan.
texts.en:
Glendy is a member of the Ucayali Department of the Las Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria Communal Bank.  She is 30 years of age, married and has two children under age.  She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for the past two years, selling fizzy drinks.  She started her business with a loan of  S/. 300.00 new soles, given to her by Manuela Ramos.  

She has two children under school age and runs her business from home so she doesn't have to leave the house to be able to work.  The business does make her large profits but it enables her to be with her children. 

With her new loan of S/. 1,500.00 new soles she will buy:  6 packs of fizzy drinks in a variety of flavours, 3 packs of mineral water, 3 crates of fizzy drinks in returnable bottles, 3 packs of sorbets and 2 bags of sweets.

Her husband is a manager by profession and he takes care of running the family home.  Glendy 's additional income helps to cover certain other small costs that sometimes arise.

loans.use: to purchase fizzy drinks

loans.name: Nicasio Arcenio

texts.es: Nicasio Arcenio inicio este negocio hace 7 años, su mayor desafío es el no tener el capital suficiente para la compra de madera y realizar sus trabajos. El empieza su actividad desde las siete de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde algunas veces le realizan una gran variedad de pedidos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra madera, pega, clavos, maque, junco, herramientas entre otros.
texts.en: Nicasio Arsenio started this business seven years ago.  His greatest challenge is not having sufficient capital to buy lumber to do his jobs.  His activity starts at 7am and continues until 6pm.  Sometimes he has quite a number of pending orders.  The reason for the loan is to buy lumber, glue, nails, varnish, reeds and tools, among others.

loans.use: to buy lumber, glue, nails, varnish, reeds and tools, among others.

loans.name: Raykhan

texts.ru:
Райхан 40 лет, замужем, имеет троих детей -  школьников. Муж работает в паспортном столе с. Кадамжай.   В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2008 году Райхан начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Райхан сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  12,000 сом (KGS) и оборотными средствами в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS).  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Райхан обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Райхан планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места.
texts.en: Raykhan is 40 years old, married and has three school-age children.  Her husband works at a passport office in the Kadamjay village.  In order to find an additional source of income for her family, Raykhan started her own business of selling food products in 2008.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, she was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of 12,000 som (KGS) and a revolving capital of 30,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Raykhan requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to broaden her product assortment.  She plans to invest the profits from the loan into expanding her retail space.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of products

loans.name: Maliki

texts.en: Maliki is acquiring a loan to buy more new phones and accessories for resale during the holiday season. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is 33 years old and married with three children. He dreams of building a permanent house and moving his business to a more permanent location.

loans.use: to buy new phones and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Zilper

texts.en:
Zilper is a single mother of one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

Zilper has operated a café for the past year. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a refrigerator for her café. She decided to join Yehu because they offer quality financial services to their clients.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for her café.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is 45 years old, married and has one child. For the last six years, she has earned a living by working hard in her sari sari (or variety) store in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 through NWTF and Kiva to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell to her customers. She supplements her income by working as a farmer and hopes to earn enough money to expand her sari sari business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr:
Emmanuel est né au Rwanda et a 43 ans. Il est marie avec 4 enfants de 4 à 14  ans, dont 3 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire.

Emmanuel est éleveur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va acheter une vache. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire l’élevage des vaches de race améliore. Emmanuel voudrait être le fournisseur du lait dans sa région. Avec le profit  Emmanuel voudrait  assure le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel was born in Rwanda and is forty-three years old. He is married with four children between the ages of four and fourteen, three of whom are in school. His eduction level is eight years of primary school. 

Emmanuel is a breeder. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to buy a cow.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to raise cows of a better breed. Emmanuel would like to be the milk supplier in his area. With the profits, Emmanuel would like to ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Urania

texts.es:
Urania Jalina es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora la cual tiene una pequeña venta. Este negocio lo inicio hace 11 años con pocos productos actualmente tiene un negocio mas grande el cual sueña en que sea una gran distribuidora. 
Ella con el crédito anterior logro mejorar su negocio y realizar un anexo en la casa. Este crédito lo necesita para invertir en granos básicos, carne…etc.
texts.en:
Urania Jalina is an enterprising and hardworking woman who owns a small grocery store. She started this business 11 years ago with few products on the shelves. Currently she has a bigger business and she dreams of becoming a large distributor.

With the previous loan, she succeeded in expanding her business and adding an extension to her house. She needs this loan to invest in bulk grains, meat…etc.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, meat...etc.

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.es:
La señora Silvestra es una mujer de 28 años que tiene una pequeña de 5 años, actualmente ella sola se dedica a su hija debido a que es separada, esta situación no la ha detenido, al contrario se ha inspirado en su pequeña hija y sueña con salir adelante para lograr convertir a su hijita en una buena profesional y brindarle seguridad en todo momento. Esta pequeña y humilde familia vive en la ciudad de Pisco, en una casa hecha de madera y triplay, uno de sus sueños es poder construir de otro material su hogar para sentir seguridad para ella y su pequeña.

Su gran sueño es poder convertirse en una gran empresaria pero sabe que lo logrará a base de esfuerzo y dedicación, es por eso que en estos momentos tiene la idea de comprar muchos y nuevos productos (abarrotes) para ofrecer, sabe que si son comprados al por mayor podrá tener un mayor margen de ganancias, gracias al apoyo de los prestatarios Kiva, Silvestra y su pequeña cumplirán sus metas a futuro.
texts.en:
Silvestra is a 28 year old woman who has a young 5 year old daughter. Right now she is the only one caring for her daughter since she is separated. This situation has not stopped her. On the contrary, she has been inspired by her young daughter, and she dreams of getting ahead to be able to raise her daughter to become a professional and to provide her with security now. This young daughter and humble family live in the city of Pisco, in a house made of wood and plywood. One of her dreams is to be able to build their home using another material in order for her and her young daughter to feel safer. 

Her great dream is to be able to become a successful entrepreneur, and she knows that she will be able to do it with effort and dedication. It’s for that reason that now she’s decided to buy more and new products (groceries) to offer. She knows that if they are purchased in bulk she will be able to get a larger profit margin. Thanks to the help of the Kiva lenders, Silvestra and her young daughter will be able to reach their goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy new products for her store.

loans.name: Yegon

texts.en:
Yegon is a resident and a farmer in Litein. His farm produces mainly milk, onions, and tea. He earns additional income by working occasionally in a local tea factory. He is married and has five children between the ages of 15 and 1.

Yegon has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and a chuff cutter to help in feeding his dairy animals. He says this will improve his milk production, as well as help him find a new venture into poultry farming.

He states the lack of funds as the challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry and a chuff cutter

loans.name: Blessed Hands Group

texts.en:
Paul is a member of Blessed Hands group. He turns 61 this year and is happily married with 6 children. His eldest child is working, while the rest are still in school. Paul lives with his family in Abrakrampa, which is in the Central Region of Ghana.

Paul grows lime, oranges and oil palm plantations on 50 acres. However his current source of income is from the lime and oranges.  His crops are growing well, and though his oil palm is young, they will mature and be ready for harvest in 2 years' time.  He also has his future plan of increasing the oil palm plantation. Paul is also the chairman of a local farmers’ association and is highly respected in the farming community and by development partners because of his dedicated leadership. He has undergone several trainer of trainers training from GIZ Germany (Ghana office) and Ministry of Agriculture (MOFA Ghana).

Paul finds it difficult to pay for the financial costs of maintaining his farms. He needs micro loan support to be able to maintain  his farm to maximise crop yield. He needed GHC4,000   to pay for the cost of fertilizer and insect traps together with labour cost of weeding and pruning the farm.  Without the financial support, his efforts cannot be rewarding. The income from the farming activities  will also help Paul pay for the school fees for his children. Paul thanks all his micro-lenders for their generous assistance.

loans.use: to purchase inputs such as fertilizer and insect traps, as well as to pay wages for laborers to work on the farm.

loans.name: Florinda Yaneth

texts.en:
I have had a bread making business for a few years now. It is grown little by little. I have been able to support my family and have a bread store in the first floor of the house. I sell bread in nearby neighborhoods. My children have finished their studies and help me with the business. I have several people that sell bread for me. This is a way to help others and sell my product. During the Christmas season, people look for more bread for their Christmas dinners.

Loan Use: Purchase of flour, butter, food coloring, soda, water, firewood and others. Me dedico a elaborar pan casero, mi negocio lo instale hace algunos años, el que paso a paso ha crecido y me genero ingresos para contruir mi casa y la panaderia en la planta baja, distribuyo pan a pulperias de colonias cercanas, ahora mis hijos que ya finalizaron sus estudios me ayudan administrar el negocio, tengo varias personas que distribuyen el pan en consignacion y luego me pagan, esto me da la oportunidad de ayudar a otros y vender mas mi producto. Ahora que viene la epoca navideña las personas buscan mas pan para acompañar sus cenas navideñas.

loans.use: Compra de harina, manteca, colorantes, soda, leña y otros.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Madam C. lives in Pantang, Accra, Ghana and sells "kenkey" a local meal made from maize. She sells to schools in her community. She is seeking a loan of $500.00 so she can produce more food and sell to more school children.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia would like to buy a pig

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es:
Uriel is a very responsible and entreprenurial young man. Nine years ago, he started as a mechanic assistant at a shop. Thanks to the knowledge gained in this trade, he had started his own shop. Uriel comes from a low-income family. Improving his situation as well as his parents has been his main drive and makes an effort towards it everyday.

The family union and the support that he receives from his parents had motivated him all of this time and wishes that his business continues to grow.To be able to fulfill his dreams, Uriel asks for a $475 dollars loan. He will invest it in buying the tools that will allow him to offer a better service to his clients by reducing the time needed to complete the repair work.

He commits himself to return the loan in 6 months. Please help who needs it most. Uriel needs your support now and he sincerely thanks you for trusting him.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Uriel es un joven emprendedor y muy responsable. Desde hace nueve años inició como ayudante en un taller mecánico y gracias al conocimiento que ha adquirido de este oficio ahora ha iniciado su propio taller. Uriel viene de una familia de bajos recursos, mejorar su situación y la de sus padres ha sido uno de los impulsos más importantes que tiene para esforzarse cada día más.

La unión familiar y el apoyo que recibe de sus padres lo han motivado todo este tiempo y desea que su negocio continúe creciendo. Para poder lograr sus sueños, Uriel solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de herramienta, esto le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes reduciendo el tiempo que utiliza para hacer su trabajo.

El se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a quien más lo necesita, ahora Uriel necesita de tu apoyo y agradece sinceramente tu confianza en él.

loans.use: Buying tools for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Cecilia Armida

texts.es:
Srta. Cecilia Armida H. Rodriguez is a 54-year old language instructor. She used to work as a public school teacher but had to give up her job when she found a tumor on her throat, for which she had an operation. To keep herself afloat, she began to sell food from her house in the Victor Larco district in the department of La Libertad (in northern Peru). She sold little of her "caldo de gallina" (chicken stock/broth) before she was invited by a neighbor to join the "Las Palmeras" group. With her first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian nuevo soles or around US$96), she bought food in bulk--rice, oil, potatoes, etc.--to get the best prices and was able, as a consequence, to vary her menu.

Now she sells caldos in the morning and "criolla comida" (common Peruvian meals) in the evening. She also takes special orders during the week and on weekends for parties. With the S/.800 (around US$255) loan, she will continue buying wholesale food products: rice, oil, sugar, potatoes, "menestras" (a vegetable soup).

Srta. Cecilia is the secretary of her community bank and, in light of her career as a teacher, was chosen as the president of the management committee of the Atencion Integral del Nino de Pobreza y en Riesgo (Joint Attention to Poor & At-Risk Children) for the Victor Larco district. She is responsible for 12 Wawa Wasi daycare centers--a government program for low-income children--with a total of 96 children ranging in age from 6 months to 4 years. She dreams of improving her house for her nieces and nephews, some of whom she's raising, and saving for a time when she might not be able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Cecilia Armida H. R. tiene 54 años de edad, ella es profesora de idiomas, trabajaba como docente pero tuvo que abandonar el trabajo debido a padecer de un tumor en la garganta, del cual fue operada. Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a vender comida en su casa en el Distrito de Víctor Larco en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Vendía pocos platos de caldo de gallina al día hasta que una vecina la invitó a participar del B.C. “Las Palmeras” y con el primer préstamo de S/.300 ($96 aproximadamente) que recibió compró alimentos como arroz, aceite, papa, etc. al por mayor para obtener mejor precio y pudo así vender un menú variado.

Actualmente vende caldos por las mañanas y comida criolla por las noches, pero además los fines de semana y otros días atiende pedidos para celebraciones. Con el préstamo de S/.800 ($255 aproximadamente) que recibirá seguirá comprando alimentos al por mayor (arroz, aceite, azúcar, papa, menestras, etc.)

La señorita Cecilia es Secretaria en su banco comunal y además debido a la vocación de docente que tiene aceptó la Presidencia del Comité de Gestión de la Atención Integral del Niño de Pobreza y en Riesgo del Distrito de Víctor Larco, tiene a su cargo 12 wa wa huasi (Programa del Gobierno para el cuidado de niños) con un total de 96 niños de 6 meses a 4 años de edad. Ella sueña con mejorar su casa para que sus sobrinos, a los que crió, se sientan a gusto además quiere tener ahorros para usarlos cuando ya no pueda trabajar.

loans.use: Compra de alimentos al por mayor. Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: A 35 years old woman, Mrs. Happiness E. is married with 3 children and lives in Benin City Edo State.  She is requesting a loan of $625 to purchase food items, provisions, baby items and ladies clothing for re-sale. She has been in this business for 12 years.

loans.use: To buy more food items, provision, baby items & ladies clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en: Seymur A. is a taxi cab driver in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He has been working in this business for the last six years. He is one of Azerbaijan’s many entrepreneurs that have come about after the breakup of the Soviet Union. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $600 so that he can make repairs to his taxi cab.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxi cab

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
8 years ago Angélica started to sell second-hand clothing to her relatives and friends and little by little increased her stock of products so that now she sells new clothing that goes to stuck León Guanajuato México. Angélica began her business because her husband's earnings were not enough to cover the expenses of her 5 children who were then students. Now four of her children are married and only one is still a student.

For this reason Angélica wanted to expand her business so that she could pay the expenses of her youngest child whose school bills were very high. Angélica is requesting a loan of $925 that she is prepared to repay in 1 month. With this money she will be able to buy more products so that she has new articles to offer to her customers. With you help Angélica will be able to help her son to succeed so that he can finish his studies.

Tranlsated from Spanish by a Kiva volutnteer.

Angélica comenzó hace 8 años a vender una paca de ropa de segunda para vender entre sus familiares y amigos y poco a poco fue modificando el repertorio de sus productos hasta lo que hoy vende que es ropa nueva que va a surtir a León Guanajuato México. Angélica comenzó debido a que con lo que gana su esposo no le alcanzaba para pagar los gastos de sus 5 hijos a quienes tenía estudiando. Actualmente cuatro de ellos ya están casados y sólo uno sigue estudiando.

Es por eso que Angélica desea crecer su negocio para poder pagar los gastos de su hijo más pequeño quien tiene muchos gastos en la escuela. Angélica está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 1 mes y con este dinero Angélica podrá comprar más productos para poder tener artículos nuevos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Angélica podrá sacar adelante a su hijo para que termine la carrera.

loans.use: To purchase products to meet her orders

loans.name: Kabojja A1(B) Group

texts.en:
Margret is a 30 year old widow with three children, all attend school. Margret is a tailor and mainly sews school uniforms. With the KIVA loan, she intends to buy a Baby Lock sewing machine. Agnes has a brick laying business and wants to use the loan to expand it. Rose offers catering services and wants to buy food warmers. Scovia sells African craft for a living and would like to expand her inventory of raw materials.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for making school uniforms.

loans.name: Butebe A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Goretti N.. She has a local brewing business and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Goretti is 38 years old and is single. She has 2 children, ages 3 and 6 who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Goretti hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Goretti is joined in her small group by Hadija B., Annet N., Patricia Y., and Alice Z.. Hadija B. has a craft business and wants to boost her business. Annet N. is currently operating a beauty salon and wants a loan to purchase more hair oils and chemicals. Patricia Y. operates a local brewery and wants to add more working capital. Alice Z. has beauty salon and is requesting a loan to purchase a hair dryer.

loans.use: To purchase more jerrycans of local brew to sell

loans.name: Kos Prak I Group

texts.en: Most of Kandal Province consists of large swaths of farmland, and most of the people are subsistence farmers. Twenty-one people make up the Kos Prak I Village Bank. Mrs. Chantho A., Village Bank President, is a farmer who cultivates many different kinds of vegetables such as maize, cabbage, etc. She is 51 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are enrolled in school, while the others  work. She cA. earn about $2.50 per day, and Mr. Samon ChA., her husband, a hard-working farmer, usually works on the field with his wife. Due to A. insufficient amount of vegetable seeds, Mrs. Chantho and her group have decided to request a loA. to buy more.  They thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman K. sells plastic sandals and t-shirts in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone. With his previous loan from SMT, he diversified his business.

He is now requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 ($350 USD) to increase his stock of shoes and shirts so that he can meet his customers demand and provide a steady income for his family. Osman is 40 years old and married with 5 children.

loans.use: To increase his stock of shoes and shirts for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a small business selling beauty products

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 27 years old, single and lives in Saida, in south Lebanon. He is an ambitious young man who supports himself making various products out of wood. He has applied for a loan of $1,000 to buy more inventory, which he will use to expand his business and guarantee its sustainability. This is the first time that Ahmad has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a woodworking shop

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Mrs. Ung S., 36, is married with two little daughters who are students. She and her husband are employed at a health centre near her town. In their extra time, this couple works growing crops in order to generate another source of income. This couple can typically make collectively around $6 per day of income. Mrs. Ung S. and her husband would like to buy fresh black pepper seeds in bulk to increase her yield.

loans.use: To purchase pepper seeds to increase her outputs

loans.name: Farhad

texts.en:
Farhad is a single man who lives with his own family and began working just after he graduated from school. He has a clothes shop in district 10 of Kabul where  he sells imported women's clothing.  Farhad has been involved in this business for more than 5 years and has a good number of Afghani and foreign clients.

Farhad has asked for a loan of loan of 50,000 Afghani ($US1,075) over 18 months so that he can increase his Afghani clothing inventory in time for the days of Eid, the 3-day holiday that Muslims around the world celebrate after the long fasting of Ramadan. Farhad's clients like to purchase new designs of clothing for Eid and they have requested that he be ready for them.

Farhad would like to thank all the world's lenders who would help to further his business with this loan.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of Afghani clothes

loans.name: Sokheiy

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheiy C., 31, sells groceries, earning around 8,000 Riel ($2 USD) per day. She lives in Domrei Choankla Commune, Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. She has two young children at home. Her husband, Mr. Soeun Vong, 33, is a motorcycle taxi driver, who earns around 16,000 Riel ($4 USD) per day. Sokheiy needs a loan of 400,000 Riel ($100 USD) to purchase more groceries to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Señor De La Picota Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Señor D. la Picota es un Banco Nuevo que recién inicia con 14 socias, quienes después D. semanas D. capacitación inician con mucha alegría. Muchas D. ellas fueron invitadas por socias D. otros Banco Comunales grandes y por la promotora. Las socias viven en el Barrio del Cerro la Picota que se ubica en los falderios del cerro del mismo nombre.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. leña, abarrotes, cereales, ropa, quesos, comida, artesanías, vinos, fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales, tejido D. chompas y reciclaje.

Cada socia tiene una historia diferente como es el caso D. Lucy que se dedica a brindar el servicio D. preparación D. comida para eventos, compromisos familiares, además teje chompas a mano dependiendo D. los pedidos que tenga.

Por otro lado, Zoila venD. vinos y tamales que adquiere en la ciudad D. Cañete D. donD. es natural, pero vive en la ciudad D. Ayacucho hace muchos años, sus ventas los realiza D. casa en casa.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 7,650 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. lanas, polos, quesos, trigo, cebada, maiz, arrroz, mantas, materiales D. reciclaje, lanas y leña. Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia, ampliar sus negocios, tener otros negocios mas y local propio.
texts.en:
The Community Banking Group, Señor D. la Picota, is a new bank that recently initiated 14 members, and who after weeks of training, is very happy to be starting out. Many of them were invited by members of other large Community Banking Groups and by the organizer. The members live in the Cerro la Picota neighborhood which is located at the base of the hill of the same name.

The members have different businesses like; selling kindling, general merchandise, grains, clothes, cheese, food, native arts & crafts, wines, bricks maD. by craftsmen, knitted sweaters, and recycling.

Each member has a different story. Like the case of Lucy - who offers food-preparation services for events and family engagements. In addition, she knits sweaters by hand, depending upon the requests that she has.

On the other hand, Zoila sells wines and tamales that she gets from the city of Cañete; which is where she's from, but she's lived in the city of Ayacucho for many years. She sells door to door.

Members need different amounts of loans; amounts such as 300, 450 and 600 soles for a total of 7,650 soles of loans for the Banking Community Group. They will invest the money in the purchase of wool, shirts, cheeses, wheat, barley, corn, rice, blankets, recycled material, and kindling.
