Ella  pide una  cuotas inicial correspondiente al 20%,  tiene  5 años de experiencia e inició su alternativa mercantil con el fin de apoyar   la gestión de  hogar-, pues su esposo como trabajador independiente   tenía todo el gasto a su cargo;  también Marve Luz genera otros ingresos adicionales a través del Instituto Colombiano de Bienestar social en su programa  de “madrés comunitarias”  iniciativa de grupos de mujeres que a finales de la década de 1970, empezaron a atender a niños y niñas de barrios populares buscando compensar la ausencia obligada de los padres y las madres, que salían a trabajar  y que el Instituto Colombiano de Bienestar Familiar (ICBF) aprovechara   para organizar el programa   como estrategia para ampliar la atención a los menores de las familias más pobres, a bajo costo  y  en contraprestación reciben una “beca” en dinero, por su labor de cuidado, realizada en su propia casa. Marve Luz le gusta su trabajo y tiene 2 hijos con los que tiene grandes propósitos, ellos son su motor y está empeñada en hacer crecer su negocio con tal de lograr este reto. La  clientela  de Marve Luz ha crecido ampliamente con los créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su credikiva  es el tercer financiamiento que hace a esta organización para comprar nuevas diseños de accesorios de plata que están muy de moda y tiene encargados. Marve Luz trabaja en su negocio conservando una rentabilidad no menor del 35% y una rotación de cartera  en un plazo no mayor de 60 días y así mismo recupera su inversión. Con su credikiva trabajará para que su capital de trabajo continúe creciendo porque es insuficiente para responderles a sus nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Marve Luz is an enterprising woman who lives in the town of Baranoa with her husband and their two young daughters.  There she has a business selling jewelry made of crystal and silver.  In addition, Marve sells lingerie.  Her primary customer base is composed of local teachers to whom she offers financing and monthly installment plans.  She asks for a down payment of 20%.  Marve has five years of experience and started this commercial venture as a way to help manage her household.  Her husband is self-employed and assumes responsibility for all of the expenses.  Marve earns additional income working for the Colombian Institute of Social Welfare in the “Community Mothers” Program that was started by groups of women in the 1970s.  This initiative was started in order to look after children living in crowded neighborhoods by seeking child support from their absent fathers and mothers who have left to find work.  The Colombian Institute of Family Welfare (ICBF) took advantage of this initiative and started its own program with the strategy of providing low-cost child care to the poorest families.  Caretakers who look after these children in their own homes receive grant money for their work.  

Marve Luz enjoys her job and has two young daughters who she dreams of seeing become successful professionals.  They serve as her motivation, so she is committed to growing her business in order to see her dream come true.  Her customer base has grown tremendously as a result of the loans she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  This Kiva loan is her third instance of financing with the organization.  She will use the money to buy new designs of silver accessories that are in style and have been ordered.  In her business, Marve Luz is able to maintain a profitability rate of no less than 35% and an inventory turnover period of no more than 60 days so that she can recoup her investment.  Her Kiva loan will help her continue growing because her operating capital at the moment is insufficient in helping her respond to new customers.

loans.use: to purchase silver accessories in the latest designs.

loans.name: Runyenge Gamba Nokora Group

texts.en: Crizensio is a Ugandan male aged 46 years who needs a loan to buy beans for planting. He hails from Kyenjojo district. He is a father of four children between 8 and 18 years old. He dreams of educating his children and becoming a large-scale farmer. He has been in the agricultural sector for 20 years and this has enabled him to provide the basics for his family. He is a member of Runyege Gamba Nokora group where each member guarantees the other to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy beans to plant

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en:
Leopoldo is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with seven children. 

Leopoldo has a computer shop that provides computer games. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for electricity for the computer services.

Leopoldo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leopoldo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for electricity for computer services

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 35 años, es mujer alegre. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a Marcial, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Alianza. Como mujer del campo, luchadora y trabajadora, ella se dedica a varias actividades. Su tienda es una de las más visitadas en la comunidad, desde muy temprano abre sus puertas en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Además de dedicarse a la siembra de café y plátanos en su terreno agrícola de poca extensión, donde trabaja los fines de semana para mantenerlos muy fuertes. Además comenta que trabaja en una hacienda de gran producción, donde recoge los frutos maduros y le pagan un dinero extra por ello. Lo que más le gusta a Carmen, es poder pasar su tiempo ocupada y trabajando para el futuro de su familia, pues gasto la mayor parte de sus ganancias en cuidarlos, alimentarlos y educarlos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Alianza al progreso” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde pagará todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, además de estar agradecida por el apoyo brindado. Carmen de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de maíz híbrido y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales que le servirán para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Carmen, 35, is a happy woman. She lives in a rented house with Marcial, her husband of twenty years. Together they have five children, only four of whom live with them in their house in the rural community of Alianza. As a country woman, hard-working and a fighter, she makes her living in a number of ways. Her store is one of the most-visited in the community. She opens her doors early in the morning in the hope that her neighbors will come buy the things they need.  Carmen is a happy and thoughtful shopkeeper, always greeting her customers with a smile and is disposed to help them out with their selections. 

Carmen also plants coffee and bananas on a small plot of farmland, which she works hard on the weekends to maintain. She tells us she also works on a big plantation, where she makes extra money picking ripe fruit.  What she likes best is to be able to pass her time busy and working for her family's future. She spends most of her income on their care, feeding, and education.

Carmen belongs to the "Alianza al Progreso" [Alliance for Progress] Village Bank and is on her fifth loan with MFP, where she'll make all of her payments on time because she does not want to cause the bank problems, and she's grateful for their support. When she gets her loan, Carmen will invest in the purchase of hybrid corn seed and some sacks of natural fertilizer that she'll use for the next planting season.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 34,  is married and has one child.  She sells charcoal to earn a living.  She has been in the business for seven years.  She has experienced a lot of growth in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. This is because she has been trained in business management and she has been able to access business loans.

Eunice hopes to open other outlets of her business so that she can generate more income.  With 50,000 Kenya shillings, she will add stock of charcoal.

loans.use: To add stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Lydie

texts.fr:
Cliente de 42 ans,celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge, elle s'est lancée dans le commerce il y'a 3 ans . Elle est a son quatrième cycle de prêt, mais elle n'avait jamais été client Kiva, mais pour ce cycle, elle est très motivée, a l'octroi de son prêt, elle s'est acheté un congélateur,des cartons de viandes, cartons de poissons, de la volaille et des cuisses de poulets, et de la tomate fraiche, de l'oignon ..
Ses ventes sont considérables, elle a des revenus de 40.000 frs a 90.000frs par jour, 

Tres exemplaire, elle a rembourse avec succès ses différents prêts et a eu a faire des épargnes énormes.

Avec ce dernier prêt , elle a renforce le stock de ses vivres frais en achetant 5 cartons de viande, 5 cartons de cuisse de poulets, 5 cartons de différents poissons de mer, de la tomate fraiche, de la ciboule.
Elle réserve un bon accueil a ses clients et sait gérer la concurrence dans le marche.
Elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir plusieurs boucheries dans les différents quartiers de la ville, elle s'occupe de la scolarité de ses enfants et assiste plusieurs personnes en difficultés
texts.en:
This client is aged 42, single and raising two children. She got into business three years ago. She is on her fourth loan, but she was never a Kiva client. For this loan she is very motivated and on being granted her loan she bought a freezer, cartons of meat, fish, poultry and chicken thighs, fresh tomatoes, onions, etc. Her sales are considerable with income of between 40,000 and 90,000 francs per day. 

An exemplary client, she has successfully reimbursed her various loans and was able to put aside an enormous amount in savings. With this last loan she added to her stock of foodstuffs by buying five cartons of meat, five cartons of chicken thighs, five cartons of various kinds of sea fish, fresh tomatoes and onions. She is very welcoming to her customers and knows how to deal with competition in the marketplace. 

Her ambition is to open several butcher shops in various neighborhoods of the town. She makes sure her children are enrolled in school and helps several persons in need.

loans.use: to buy five cartons of beef, five cartons of chicken thighs, and five cartons of fish.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”IMASUMAC II”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Eliana; La socia tiene 40 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 21, 19, 7 años de edad, la socia se dedica  a la preparación del tradicional plato peruano el ceviche, la socia elabora el ceviche a base de pescado, ella mezcla diversos ingredientes como cebollas, limón, ajo, canchitas, camote, rocoto y otros ingredientes, la socia tiene su stand y ya es muy conocida en el centro comercial en el cual ella trabaja, la socia en esta oportunidad desea invertir el crédito en la compra de ingredientes como arroz para acompañar el palto con arroz chaufa y ceviche, la socia comprara dos sacos de arroz, pescado, sal al por mayor y otros productos menores que le dejan sus caseros en dos partes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de arroz dos sacos grandes, sal un saco y el pago del pescado que le traen a la socia en avioneta.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the ”IMASUMAC II” communal bank. This communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Her name is Eliana, and she is 40 years old. She is single and has 3 children, aged 21, 19, and 7. Her work is preparing the traditional Peruvian dish ceviche. She prepares her ceviche using fish, and she mixes in various ingredients such as onions, lime, garlic, canchitas [corn kernels], sweet potato, rocoto peppers, and other ingredients. She has her own stand, and she is very well-known in the shopping center where she works. On this occasion, the borrower wants to invest in buying ingredients such as rice to prepare plates of avocado with fried rice and ceviche. She will buy two sacks of rice, fish, and salt on a wholesale basis, and she will also buy some retail products that her suppliers will give her in two parts. The borrower is requesting the loan to invest in buying two large sacks of rice, one sack of salt, and paying for the fish which is brought in to her by small airplane. 

The borrower is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying two large sacks of rice, one sack of salt, and fish flown in by small plane, among other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish construction of some rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob wants a loan to buy films and pay rent. He runs a video library and has been in business for three years. His desire is build a permanent home and expand his business into new areas. However, inconsistency in electricity supply hinders his business.

loans.use: to buy films and pay rent

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Satupaitea Vaega.  She is married and has 2 infant children.  To make a living, Sa owns and operates a business making and selling cooked food to local communities.  Sa has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Sa is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase an oven, mutton flaps (mutton or lamb belly meat), sausages, plastic plates and tissues.  This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Sa from SPBD.

Sa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase an oven, mutton flaps, sausages, plastic plates and tissues

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 29 years old and married with two children.

Annaliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Annaliza has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Annaliza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr:
Emmanuel est né au Rwanda et a 50 ans. Il est marie avec 4 enfants de 5 à 15  ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans de secondaire.

Emmanuel est chauffeur d’un taxi voiture. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va acheter des matériels pour faire la réparation de sa voiture. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter une autre voiture. Emmanuel voudrait acheter d’autres véhicules utiliser pour le taxi voiture. Avec le profit  Emmanuel voudrait  assure le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Emmanuel was born in Rwanda and is fifty years old. He is married with four children between the ages of five and fifteen, of whom four are in school. His education level is two years of secondary school.

Emmanuel is a taxi driver. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to buy materials to repair his car.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to buy another car. Emmanuel would like to buy other vehicles used as taxis. With the profit, Emmanuel would like to ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his car.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is 30 years old, married, and has a seven-year-old daughter. He describes himself as an honest man. He has been running a poultry activity for the last two years.  He sells eggs and chickens. He has one employee and his business challenge is inadequate funds. He will use the loan of 10,000 KES to buy more chickens. Bernard hopes and dreams to build a permanent coop for his poultry in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy unroasted coffee beans wholesale.

loans.name: Celine

texts.en:
Celine is 26 years old.  She is a widow with 3 children who are between the ages of five years and 6 months old.  None of her children attend school yet. She has been running the business of selling shoes for the past 4 years.  She wants the loan to buy more shoes to sell. 

Saving money and providing food for the family will be the primary activity from the profit Celine expects from her business.  She would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity  is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes, shoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of funds for business expansion. 

Purity will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes and shoes. Her business goal is to be a successful businesswoman  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, Elodie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Albert. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Elodie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Elodie assure avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Elodie vend divers produits (conserves, maïs, etc.) à son domicile. Elodie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Elodie et les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des conserves et du maïs.

loans.name: Javlon

texts.ru: Чавлон молодой начинающий предприниматель. Ему 27 лет. Он живет вместе с братом и мамой пенсионеркой. Брат сейчас находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Чавлон работает таксистом. Он хочет сменить работу и по этой причине обратился за кредитом. Чавлон намерен заниматься животноводческой деятельностью. Он построил коровник и запася кормом. Теперь ему необходимо купить пару телят. Единственным ограничением для этого джентльмена является нехватка денежных средств на реализацию покупки. Чавлон надеется на получения займа и помощь с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Javlon is a young aspiring entrepreneur.  He is 27 years old.  He lives with his brother and his mom who is retired.  His brother is currently making a living in the Russian Federation.  Javlon himself works as a taxi driver.  He wants to change jobs and, for this reason, he has turned to us for a loan.  Javlon intends to start a business in animal husbandry.  He has already built a barn and gathered some livestock feed.  All he has to do now is to buy a couple of calves.  The only limitation this gentleman is facing is a lack of financial means to make this purchase.  He is hoping to receive a loan and some help from you.

loans.use: to buy two calves and start a new business.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Don Gustavo sells fruit and other items in the large outdoor markets of Guayaquil. He owns a small parcel of land in his hometown, Rocafuerte Manabi. He pays two of is nephews to maintain the land and grow a small variety fruits. Once a week Don Gustavo travels to his hometown with his two sons in order to pick up the fruit from his farm and buy more from other farms. His wife also sells fruits from their home in Guayaquil. Don Gustavo will use this loan to be able to buy larger amounts of fruits when he travels to Manabi. He also hopes to invest in new products such as cheese and meats.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in fruits and other products to sell in his market

loans.name: Digna  Emerita

texts.en:
My name is Digna Emerita and I am a merchant, I have a business in which I sell new clothing, in the manner of a traveling saleswoman. I have several years experience, and my business creates enough income to cover family expenses. I currently am in need of a wider variety of products because the demand has increased and I do not have the capital readily available to satisfy my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Digna Emerita, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con negocio de venta de ropa nueve la distribuyo de manera ambulante por encargo, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente necesito mas variedad de producto ya que la demanda a crecido y no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la clientela.

loans.use: To purchase men's shirts, women's blouses, socks, girl's and women's underwear.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas S. is a farmer from a rural town outside of the big city of Guayaquil named Salitre. Tomas and his wife Hortencia have lived on these lands for over 30 years. There they have raised three children who are all on their own now. Tomas is seeking to receive a loan so that hey may invest in rice farming. The rainy season is just coming to an end and this is a particularly good time to plant the rice seeds and prepare the lands. The loan will help Tomas avoid borrowing from the loan sharks common to the area. Although he knows they charge exuberant interest rates, Tomas has been forced to borrow from these lenders several times due to his shortage of capital.

He is the latest addition to the first Communal Bank in the new Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Resistencia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named Resistencia. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Resistencia Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There is not a single financial institution that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The only access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Farm Rice

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. Rano has a high education, but she had no permanent work. The work which is available in their location does not give the opportunity to earn money enough to support the family.

Rano started trading some years ago. At that time, her business was small and took little space. Today she has rented a place in the shop and her goods occupy some meters. Two years ago, Rano received her first loan from Microinvest. This loan gave her an opportunity to increase the assortment of her goods. Today she hopes to receive a new loan for further extension of her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Norma is married and has three daughters. Eighteen years ago, she and her husband decided to fix up their house, something that they would have found impossible to do with only her husband's income. Faced with this situation, Norma decided to start her own business selling used clothing. Soon afterwards, at the request of her customers, she began selling new clothing and her sales increased considerably. Her hard work has allowed her to build a steady business and to improve her family's quality of life.

To buy merchandise for the coming season and to have a broader selection for her customers, Norma is now asking for a $1,200 loan that she promises to repay in 6 months. You can be a part of the growth of this business and help Norma and her family. They sincerely thank you for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es casada y tiene tres hijas, hace 18 años ella y su esposo decidieron mejorar las condiciones en las que se encontraba su vivienda, pero solo con el salario de su esposo hubiera sido imposible, ante esta situación Norma decidió emprender su propio negocio vendiendo ropa usada, poco después, a petición de sus clientes, incorporó la venta de ropa nueva y sus ventas mejoraron considerablemente. El buen trabajo que ella realiza le ha permitido permanecer tanto tiempo con su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Para comprar mercancía de esta nueva temporada y tener una mejor variedad para sus clientes, ahora Norma está solicitando un préstamo de $1,200 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Tú puedes formar parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayudar a Norma y su familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Rachdiye

texts.en:
Rachdiye has an impressive business history. She started with loans of $200 for more than 5 years with Al Majmoua. Today she needs $900 to buy merchandise to increase and diversify the home products she sells from her shop.
Rachdiye developed her business progressively and is now the owner of the shop.
Rachdiye is a successful entrepreneur, with an excellent history of on time  repayments within the Institution. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in Saida, South Lebanon.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to increase the inventory in her shop

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
This is Mrs. Muslima S., affectionately known by most people as Mama Mwanjaa, which in her native tribe, the Mdigo, means that she is the mother of a girl. She runs a cosmetics shop in Mwananyamala, a busy commercial sector of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. With your help, Mama Mwanjaa will receive her first loan of TSH 200,000 from Kiva, which she plans to use to purchase additional stock such as moisturizing cream, soap, shampoo and weird and wonderful hair pieces!

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the S. client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics and hair pieces for her shop.

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mr. In S., 60, is married with three children and lives with his wife and three nephews in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is employed as a security guard and typically earns around US$ 2 each day, while his wife runs a laundry shop making about US$ 3 each day in revenue. One of his children works as a security guard with him; another one is a student, and the other is married and lives separately.

Mr. In S. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for his family’s transportation. His family members spend a lot of money every day using public transportation especially motor-taxis, so he expects the loan will help him reduce this expense and can raise his savings.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for his family’s transportation

loans.name: Ilduza

texts.en:
Ilduza was born in 1956 and she is married. She is a housewife, lives in Zenica and has 3 sons who are from 25-30 years old. One son lives with them and he is employed. Ilduza's husband works as a taxi driver and his monthly income is 400 KM.

This is her first loan at MCO WWI in the amount of 600 KM and her wish is to invest the money in the current business and improve it. She wants to buy vehicles parts for the taxi in order to improve the quality of service that her husband offers to his clients.

loans.use: To buy vehicle parts.

loans.name: Nsamba's Group

texts.en:
A teacher by profession, Joseph N. is also a businessman. He teaches mathematics and science in Lugasa Primary School in Kitimbwa. Though he loves his job, he saw that the income from it was not enough to meet all his needs. So he opened a retail shop, which his wife manages during the day and he takes over at night.

Joseph has been our client for one and a half years, and his previous loans helped him to buy goods for the shop. With this loan, he plans to buy a popcorn machine so he can sell popcorn to his customers. He will station the popcorn machine outside his shop.

loans.use: To buy a popcorn machine for his shop

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline O. is 54 years old. She lives in Benin City, and is married with 7 children. She sells yams and plantains. She needs the loan of $875 to buy more yams, plantains, and maize to then sell. She has been in business since 1987, and she thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more yams and plantains for sale

loans.name: Comite Esperanza Del Este Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring women is a program run by the Fundación Paraguaya that targets groups of enterprising women. These women create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities that enable them to live with dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. Moreover, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women committee members the energy and motivation to reach success.

Ida R., member of the committee called “Rosa Blanca” in Asuncion told her sister Gladys R. who lives in San Jose in Ciudad del Este about the program Fundacion Paraguaya offers. Gladys, excited with the idea, contacted her fiends and neighbors and told them about the committee. She shared with these women her desire to change their world for the better by working very hard. Ida’s hopeful words stimulated optimism among these women and they decided to form a committee.

The group includes 16 women from different neighborhoods in the city. Their businesses include: despensas, (grocery stores, a very profitable market in Paraguay, since we consider it a tradition to buy from a Despensa), confectionaries, sewing shops, as well as sales of natural medicines, clothing, bijouterie, and jewelry. Some of the women offer services such as housekeeping.

The money provided by the credit will be used for the purchase of products such as: clothing, fabrics, thread, elastic bands, sugar, oil, pasta, cereals, milk, sugar and natural medicines

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like clothing, fabrics, thread, elastic bands, sugar, oil, pasta, cereals, milk, sugar and natural medicines

loans.name: Burigul

texts.ru:
Burigul H. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 47 years old, married, and has 8 children. She has completed secondary education. Burigul has been practicing animal husbandry for over 10 years. She buys young bull calves at the market, raises them for 45 days, and then sells them at the market for a profit. This provides supplementary income for her large family. Her husband works, but has a very small salary which is not enough to support the family. Burigul wants to buy three bull calves and feed, but she does not have the financial resources to do so. That is why she decided to take out a loan, to be paid back in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Холова Буригул жительница района Вахдат .Возраст 47 лет, замужем , имеет 8 детей.Образование среднее. Буригул более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она покупает на рынке молодых бычков, откармливает их в течение 45 дней .После чего продает на рынке по выгодной ей цене. Эта деятельность явялется дополнительным источником дохода ее большой семьи. Муж клиентки работает, но заработная плата очень маленькая и ее не хватает для содержаниии семьи. Буригул хочет купить 3 бычков и корм.Но денежных средств у нее нет .Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of three bull calves and feed

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
Zunilda is a 45-year-old active woman, she has been married to Domingo for 26 years. She has 6 children, they are 26, 23, 20, 18, 8 and 6 year old respectively. The oldest of her children is already working independently because he has a refrigeration workshop at home. The second one is already married and has her own family, whereas the others still live with her and are still in school. She mentions that she studied cooking and baking to help her husband with the family income, since he sells furniture but they needed an extra revenue. She started selling cakes upon request as well as savory and sweet snacks for special events like celebrations, holidays, birthday among others. Her main clients were teachers of a school of her area who were always placing orders to Zunilda. Since her meals are really good they asked her to be in charge of the school’s canteen. Since then 5 years have gone by and she tells us that she has work for a long time because the directors of the school are very happy with her work due to the quality of the food she prepares. Her biggest dream is to be able to construct a room in her house one day, where she might set up a small grocery store and this way to be able to stay more time at home with her children. Now, she is requesting a loan to buy goods as: candies, sodas, French fries, and ingredients to prepare her fast food like meat, egg, lettuce, tomato, flour, oil, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Zunilda es una activa mujer de 45 años de edad, está casada con Domingo hace 26 años. Tiene 6 hijos de 26 , 23, 20, 18, 8 y 6 años respectivamente. El mayor de sus hijos ya cuenta con un trabajo independiente debido a que posee un taller de refrigeración que funciona en su casa. La segunda ya está casada y ha formado su propio hogar, mientras que los demás aún viven con ella y continúan estudiando. Ella comenta que estudió cocina y repostería para ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos del hogar, ya que el mismo se dedica a la venta de muebles pero necesitaban de un ingreso extra. Fue así que ella empezó a vender tortas (pasteles) bajo pedido al igual que bocaditos salados y dulces para eventos especiales como festejos, fiestas, cumpleaños entre otros. Sus principales clientas eran profesoras de un colegio de la zona que siempre le hacían pedidos a Zunilda y como su comida era muy rica le pidieron que se encargue de la cantina de la escuela del barrio. Desde aquel entonces ya han transcurrido 5 años y cuenta de que tiene trabajo para rato debido a que los directores de la escuela están muy conformes con su trabajo debido a la calidad de los alimentos que prepara. Su mayor sueño es el de construir algún día un salón frente a su casa en donde podría montar una pequeña despensa y así quedarse más tiempo en su casa para compartirlo con sus hijos. En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: golosinas, gaseosas, papas fritas, e ingredientes para elaborar sus comidas rápidas como carne, huevo, lechuga, tomate, harina, aceite, entre otros.

loans.use: Buy candies, sodas, French fries, and ingredients to prepare her fast food like meat, egg, lettuce, tomato, flour, oil, among others.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 27-year-old woman from the small village of Kralupi, which is located near the town of Visoko. She is married, with three children, ages one, five and nine years. Her husband works in a poultry factory, and they receive a small child welfare allowance monthly to supplement their income.

Alma is requesting this 4th loan with Žene za Žene to buy food for her cows. She has one cow, and earns income now by selling milk to one of the large dairy factories in a nearby town. She wants to purchase some high quality food for her cow, so that it will produce better milk.

Since costs for food are at an all time high, Alma believes this will be a good investment right now. If she earns enough from these milk sales, she hopes to save enough to buy another cow.

loans.use: To buy food for her cow

loans.name: Tekojoja Group

texts.es:
The Tecojoja committee is now in their seventh loan cycle of the Enterprising Women Committee program and includes 15 members of which 3 are new.

This group is found in one of the poorest neighborhoods of the city of Assumption known as Pelopincho. The members are dedicated to several activities; notable among these, the sale of foods, beverages, and clothes, running a pantry, and recycling, among other things.

An example is that of Señora Viviana F., who is dedicated to recycling and tells us that in this cycle she will put her work tools in condition; that is, she will fix her cart to carry a greater quantity of recyclable materials.

The committee maintains good communications among its members that facilitates internal relations and respect among its members.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité Tecojoja se encuentra actualmente en su séptimo ciclo del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y cuenta con 15 integrantes de las cuales 3 son nuevas.

Este grupo se encuentra en una de las barrios más pobres de la ciudad de Asunción conocida como Pelopincho. Las integrantes se dedican a actividades varias entre las que se pueden destacar la venta de comidas, bebidas, despensa, además de venta de ropas, reciclaje entre otras cosas.

Un ejemplo es el de la señora Viviana F. se dedica al reciclaje y nos comento que en este ciclo pondrá en condiciones su herramienta de trabajo, que es un carrito recolector de modo a juntar mayor cantidad de material reciclable.

El comité presenta buena comunicación entre sus miembros lo que facilita la relación interna y el respeto entre sus integrantes.

loans.use: To buy various merchandise such as clothes (T-shirts, pants, shirts, footwear), fruits, vegetables, meat, milk products, baked goods, sugar, etc. for resale or making goods for sale.

loans.name: Metanet

texts.en:
Metanet Z. is 52 years old. She and her husband have raised seven children. 

For 18 years Metanet has run her own business. In the largest local market, she has a store selling women's clothing. The store is located in the center of the market. She is very nice and polite, which allows her to easily expand her client base. She is trying to diversify the range of goods that she sells so she can satisfy the tastes of clients with various levels of income. For this purpose she applied for a 1200 USD loan in order to buy women's clothing for the winter season. 

Metanet thanks everyone who supports her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: To increase her clothing inventory

loans.name: Papa Gueye

texts.fr:
C'est un jeune commerçant demeurant à Thiadiaye. il a adhéré à la caisse depuis fevrier 2004 et il n'a jamais bénéficié de crédit. c'est un grand travailleur et il s'active dans la vente des produits cosmétique et dans la vente des chaussures comme activité acessoire.

il va utiliser l'argent pour renforcer le niveau de ses marchandises et praparer ainsi les prochaines fetes.
texts.en:
This young merchant lives in Thiadiaye. He has belonged to the bank since February 2004 and he has never taken out a small loan. He's a hard worker, selling cosmetics and secondarily, shoes.

He is going to use the loan to bolster his inventory so as to be prepared for the coming holiday season.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering his working capital

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Trúc năm nay 36 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và nấu rượu. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ chị đã vay vốn để đầu tư cho chồng mua máy khoan cắt bê tông  phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con trong xã. Hiện nay ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và nấu rượu gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu ổn định 2.000.000đ từ công việc khoan cắt bê tông của chồng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ để đầu tư mua 2 tấn lúa dự trữ phụcvụ cho việc nấu rượu tăng thu nhập cho gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Trần Thị Trúc is 36 years old. She participates in TYM fund since 2005. Before joining TYM fund she and her family's income came from raising livestock and brewing rice wine. With the loan from TYM, she bought a concrete cutting machine for her husband so he could offer his service to cut concrete to people in the region. Thanks to this loan, today her family has a third source of income of 2.000.000 VND a month from the concrete cutting service ran by her husband. This round of loan, Mrs Trúc is requesting 9.000.000 VND to buy stock up on rice for her rice wine brewing business thus to increase her family's income in the long run.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stock up on rice for rice wine brewing

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Khoeun K., 55, and his wife, Mrs. Heng Sok, 50, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1978 during the Pol Pot regime and have four children: one son and three daughters. Three of their children have full-time employment and the youngest daughter studies in a local school. 

Khoeun and his wife have been growing jasmine flowers for ten years. In addition to farming jasmine, he is also a fisherman. The couple grow jasmine on their farmland near the house and sell the flowers in the Phnom Penh market. Khoeun is requesting a loan of $700. He will use some of it to purchase a water pump and pipe for farming. With the remainder, he will buy more jasmine trees to plant on his new plot of farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, pipe, and jasmine saplings for their farm.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas L. is 57 years old and is a widow with four children. She sells foodstuffs such as beans, melon, and onions. She is a LAPO client. Dorcas is requesting a loan of N100,000 (US $700) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Tamara Liseth

texts.es: La joven Tamara tiene 20 años de edad, reside en el barrio Isaías Gómez, madre soltera con una niña de 2 meses, pues para poder darle los alimentos a su hija y subsistir independientemente de su mama, trabaja con ella en el negocio de fritanga, que inicio desde hace cuatro años, lo cual ahora son socias, y con esta solicitud que esta haciendo es para comprar mesa, sillas y una cocina industrial para elaborar los ricos platillos, y poder dar un mejor servicios a su clientela, gracias a Afodenic va a poder lograr esta inversión que espera en un futuro crecer mas en su negocio para poder obtener mejores ganancias para ayudar a su bebe que no le falte nada. Ya que su papa no le brinda ni el amor ni el cuidado alimenticio pero espera demostrar ser una madre honorable y trabajadora para su hija, ya que también tiene el apoyo de su mama.
texts.en:
Ms. Tamara C., a 20-year-old single mother with a 2-month-old daughter, lives in the Isaías Gómez neighborhood. In order to provide for her child and not depend on her mother, she works alongside her mother selling fried food. Her mother started the business four years ago, and now they are partners. She will use this loan to buy tables, chairs and an industrial stove in order to prepare delicious dishes and provide better customer service. Thanks to Afodenic, she will be able to make this investment, which she hopes will make her business grow in the future so that she can earn bigger profits. She wants to give her baby what she needs since her baby’s father gives her neither love nor support. She hopes to be able to demonstrate to her daughter what an honorable and hard-working mother she is. Thankfully, she also has her mother’s support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic tables and chairs

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean G. is a rice farmer. She is 40 years old and has 3 children. Her husband, Aladin G., is a farmer as well. Her husband is the one managing their 1 hectare land. Previously, Mary Jean worked as an office clerk. She was not happy with her former job because she received little compensation. So, she went back to their village to help manage their small farm.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy the fertilizer that she needs. She believes that she will then make more of a profit and will thus be able to support her children, who are in school. She is also interested in looking for some other money making ventures. Aside from farming, she wishes to establish a small store. The loan will help her do so.

CEVI is helping people start and sustain their businesses. In addition to providing credit assistance, they give their members training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and starting up a small store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Phấn, 41 tuổi ở Thanh Hóa. Gia đình chị có 3 con nhỏ và đang đi học, chồng chị lái xe tải với thu nhập 3.000.000/tháng. Chị tham Quỹ từ năm 2005, với công việc chính là làm máy sát thu bình quân 500.000/tháng và chăn nuôi lợn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 10.000.000 để đầu tư cho công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Phấn, 41 years old, lives in Thanh Hóa province. She has three young children who attend school. Her husband earns 3,000,000 VND (172 USD) per month as a truck driver. She joined the TYM Fund in 2005 and used her loan mainly to operate a rice-husking machine that earned her about 500,000 VND (29 USD) per month, and also to raise pigs. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD) to invest in the family business raising animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Khudoiberdi

texts.en:
H. Khudoiberdi is 54 years old. He is married and has 6 children. He is a very hard-working man who has experienced a great deal throughout his life. For the past 9 years, he has dedicated himself to providing taxi services. Regardless, Khudoiberdi is not regretful and is instead very proud of being a taxi driver. It is work where he can be free and make good friends, seeing as he is very charismatic. He always has a smile at the ready, and manages to bring out the same from those who ride in his taxi.

Happily for Khudoiberdi, business is good. It allows him to live comfortably, and support all of his children with education. Currently his car needs thorough repair and with this purpose he wants to borrow 500 USD for a term of 12 months that he will spend purchasing spare parts. He sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders who make this help possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for thoroughly repairing his taxi

loans.name: Gaybullo

texts.ru: Гайбулло 41 год. Он женат и отец 6-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Гайбулло занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление весны для Гайбулло – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Гайбулло экономит на корме скота. С наступлением осени Гайбулло продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота. На снимке Гайбулло стоит около кассы на время выдачи кредита.
texts.en:
Gaybullo, 41, is married and has 6 children. His spouse is a housewife. She takes care of the house and feeds cattle. Gaybullo raises and sells cattle. In the spring the cattle prices are low and it is the time to buy cattle. When fall comes, Gaybullo will sell the animals he raises. This loan Gaybullo will use to purchase food to feed his cattle.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle farming

loans.name: Kamala Group

texts.en:
Kamala, the leader of this group, wants to take a loan for a tailoring business. Anar Gul requests a loan for her husband who has a fruit and vegetable shop. Gul Makui wants a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver. Ma Gul also wants a loan for a tailoring business.

These are the four members of this group. Together they are requesting a loan of 56,000 afghani with a term of 10 months to expand their businesses. These women are appreciative of the loan process.

loans.use: To expand a tailoring business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna T. is a charcoal and snack vendor. She is 40 years old and married to Romeo T.. She would like additional capital for her to buy more sacks of charcoal to retail.

Myrna is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 as additional working capital for the business so that she will be able to generate higher profit. Myrna is from the rural village of Liwayway Diffun, Quirino province, a place that is mountainous and where upland farming is the major sources of income. 

Myrna is blessed with three children who are all currently in school and require a lot of money. Her eldest, Ronnie Mae, is 14 years old and in his second year high school. Rovie Mher is 12 years old and in grade school. The youngest, Rona Angelina, is 9 years old and in grade four.

Myrna and Romeo hope to support the schooling of their children through college by exerting more effort in their business, which should allow them to expand and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to retail

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr:
S.  Pascaline est née vers les années 1970. Pascaline est mariée à S. Toussaint. Pascaline est mère d’enfants tous scolarisés. Pascaline vit avec sa famille à la zone industrielle d’AKPAKPA, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. 

Pascaline vend depuis 1995 des beignets faits à base de haricot, de farine de blé et de banane. N’ayant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers, Pascaline achetait une partie du nécessaire dont elle a besoin pour son activité à crédit. Mais depuis que Pascaline a connu ALIDé, elle a cessé d’acheter à crédit ; ce qui lui permet de faire plus de bénéfices sur ses ventes. En effet, Pascaline a eu déjà six prêts de ALIDé ; prêts qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener son activité à un stade supérieur. Pascaline sollicite un septième prêt de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
S. Pascaline was born around 1970. She is married to S. Toussaint and is the mother of several children, all enrolled in school. She lives with her family in the industrial zone Akpakpa, a district of Cotonou, economic capital of the Republic of Bénin.

Since 1995, Pascaline has been selling fritters made out of beans, wheat flour, and bananas. Not having sufficient financial means, Pascaline was buying part of the raw ingredients she needs for her business on credit. However, since Pascaline found out about ALIDé, she has ceased to buy on credit. This has allowed her to make more profit on her sales.

In fact, Pascaline has already received 6 loans from ALIDé, loans which she reimbursed correctly and with which she was able to take her business to a higher level. Pascaline is requesting her 7th loan from ALIDé to further bolster her business so as to better respond to the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sack of 50 kg of granulated sugar, 4 sacks of 50 kg of wheat flour, a jerrycan of 25 liters of peanut oil, and 5 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Vương Thị Hải

texts.en:
X. Vương Thị Hải (326030733) is a 54-year-old female living in the town of Phúc Yên. She is married and has two adult children.

X. owns and operates a business providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month.

In 1999 X. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

X. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one son. She sells women's underwear at one of the markets in Zaporozhye city. It was her mother who helped her to start this business. Her mother sells same type of goods at the same market in a different kiosk. Little by little, Svetlana began to gain her own customers. Now, after 10 years of being in the sales business, Svetlana has a large kiosk and good assortment her customers can choose from.

Svetlana is a very outgoing and open person and enjoys offering her customers good quality underwear. She would like to borrow 10,900 UAH to purchase new inventory.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
There are four low-income people who are jointly requesting this group loan. Their leader, Mr. Mao S., 24, is a single man who drives a motor taxi to earn a living. He currently lives with his elderly mother who sells a few grocery items for income. Mao S. will be using his loan to add to his meager savings to replace his old taxi that is not attractive to customers.

The other borrowers are:

Mr. V., a fisherman, who is requesting a loan to buy nets for fishing;

Mrs. C. who will be using the loan to decorate and repair her old house; and

Mrs. T. who makes a living fishing and is looking for a loan to add more fishing gear.

loans.use: To replace his old taxi that is not attractive to customers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 45-year-old trader. She is married with six children who are currently in school.

Margaret sells used clothes but, with low capital, she is not able to buy larger bale quantities of used clothes to sell. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes with more variety to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel S., a technician at his own electronic shop, has many customers who rely on him to repair their old damaged televisions, air conditioners, and home appliances. The father of a one-year-old child, he hopes one day to have a bigger shop. He is just looking for an opportunity to get started expanding his business.

Joel now needs a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy materials and tools for his shop. Hopefully this loan will help him improve his services to attract more customers in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials for his electronics shop

loans.name: Sammy Kimutai Kipkemoi

texts.en:
Sammy Kimutai is 26 years old and single. His retail kiosk is located in Chembulet centre and his clients are villagers within Chembulet.

He was introduced to KADET by his mother who is already a client with the MFI. With the loan kimutai is expecting from KADET he intends to apply for the Electricity to his Kiosk and also add more stock to the Kiosk.

In future he intends to improve his living standards by borrowing loans repeatedly.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To bring electricity to his Kiosk and add more stock which includes sugar and rice.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi sells second hand clothes in retail. She is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She is hoping for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase second hand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothes

loans.name: Domeciano

texts.en:
Domiciano S., is a rice farmer from Bunawan Agusan Del Sur, Mindanao. He is 53 years old and has been married for nearly 27 years now. He likes being a farmer because aside from enjoying working all day under the sun, he earns enough income to support the daily needs of his family.

He is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan for farm financing to be able to achieve maximum yield in his farm. In that way he can better support his entire family's needs.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Realiza

texts.en: Realiza G. is a 38 year old businesswoman. She lives in Tala, Caloocan City with her husband Romeo, 44, a painter, and their four children. Realiza has been a hog-meat and dressed-chicken vendor for years and has a stall in the nearby public market. Her net income is P8,000 a month. Realiza came from a poor family but she believes that there is always a way to get out of poverty. In the latter part of 2007, she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative and has carefully invested the proceeds of her previous loans in her business. It went well and brought her enough additional income to cover her family’s daily needs including her children’s education. However, she laments that unstable farm-gate prices of livestock and poultry, due to the recent typhoons and floods, affects her business so much. Now on her 7th loan, Realiza is requesting P12,000 and will use the funds as additional capital for her dressed chicken and hog meat stand. She is optimistic that she can bring her family out of poverty as she slowly feels the progress of her business. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her hog-meat and dressed-chicken business

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres La Palmeras Group

texts.es: El grupo de mujeres las Las palmeras son originaria de la  comunidad de chimente del municipio de Totonicapán ellas viene trabajando hace mas de diez años en la crianza y venta de pollos pero cada año necesita de mas capital  porque el negocio prospera actualmente tiene tres granjas de pollos aproximadamente cinco mil quinientos pollos hoy necesitan compras tres mil quinientos nuevos pollos  y como la alimentación, y aprovechar la época de verano y como de navidad en poder vender algunos pollos, con este negocio han podido sostener las necesidades de las familias,
texts.en:
The women’s group “los pollitos” (little chickens) are originally from the community of Chimente in the town of Totonicapan. They have been working for more than ten years raising chickens to sell, and each year they need more capital since the business has been prospering. Currently they have three chicken farms with approximately five thousand five hundred chickens. Now they need to buy three thousand five hundred new chickens and their food, to take advantage of the summer season. Also with Christmas coming, they would like to sell some chickens. They have been able to provide for their families’ needs with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get more capital

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 41-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Hussein has owned a men's clothing shop since 2006. He decided on this business because he wanted to have independent work and he likes trading. He sells jogging clothes, shirts, t-shirts, pants and men's accessories. Hussein is good at his work because he knows how to treat his customers, and knows how to advise them. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase the new winter collection for his shop. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan.

When Hussein first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to increase his inventory. This loan will help him to diversify his merchandise and expand his stock. In the future, he plans to build up his business.

loans.use: To purchase the new winter collection for his shop.

loans.name: H. Dohoué Yvonne

texts.fr: D. H. Dohoué Yvonne est née le 02 Avril 1969 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique au Bénin. Dohoué Yvonne vit à Dogoudo à Allada, depuis sa naissance. Mariée à GOUNOU Taïrou, Dohoué Yvonne est mère de cinq enfants. Certains de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Dohoué Yvonne n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Dohoué Yvonne vend du maïs et de la farine de cossette d'igname à Allada. Dohoué Yvonne s'approvisionne à Allada et au Nord du Bénin. Il y a environs deux ans que Dohoué Yvonne mène cette activité. Dohoué Yvonne a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Dohoué Yvonne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d'augmenter son capital et de renforcer son activité, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. H. Dohoué Yvonne was born on April 2, 1969 in Allada, in Atlantique state in Bénin. Dohoué Yvonne has been living in Dogoudo in Allada ever since her birth. She is married to GOUNOU Taïrou and the mother of 5 children. Some of her children are enrolled in school. The couple shares the responsibility for supporting the family. Dohoué Yvonne was only able to go to primary school. To support herself and her children, she sells maize and couscous made of yams in Allada. She buys her merchandise in Allada and in the north of Bénin. She has been in this business for about 2 years and has already received 2 loans from ALIDé and has reimbursed them correctly. She is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to increase her working capital and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 sacks of maize and 5 sacks of coucous made of yams

loans.name: Dieng

texts.en:
Mr. Dieng S. is a new client at the Moda Kone branch of UIMCEC in Thies, a city located about seventy kilometers from buS. Dakar. Mr. S., aged 41, is married and the father of three children between the ages of three and eleven. This is his first loan.
Mr. S. works as a carpenter and will use his loan of 100,000 FCFA to purchase wood, glue and other materials for his work. He chose carpentry because of his passion for woodwork, he says.

loans.use: To purchase wood, glue and other materials

loans.name: Lener Alexander

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, el joven Lener R. se dedica a laborar en el servicio de transporte por medio de su triciclo que posee con el cuál realiza diferentes traslados de personas de un lugar a otro en las cercanías al mercado El Bisne. Es un joven  de 24 años pero con muchos deseos de trabajar y llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.
Solicita el crédito para ser invertido en el mantenimiento del triciclo y en la compra de una cocina de gas para uso domestico. Con el crédito logrará mejorar su nivel de vida y así suplirá las necesidades de su hogar y una vez realizado esto, continuará en su actividad de transporte en su localidad.
texts.en:
Lener R. provides tranportation with his three-wheel vehicle in Chinandega. He takes people from one place to another around the El Bisne market. He is a 24-year-old young man who is anxious to work and earn funds to support his household. He is asking for a loan to service his vehicle and to buy a gas stove for domestic use. The loan will permit him to attain a better standard of living and will help him meet his household's needs. Once he attains this, he will continue with his transportation work in his location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Selu T. is 35 and married with 5 children (ages 6 - 17).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Maria has 2 years of experience in this business.  Maria needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Maria joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Maria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Maria Selu T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Kagiatu

texts.en:
Kagiatu G. is 48 years old. She is married and has three boys and two girls all of whom are currently at school. She has been in business for 15 years. Through hard work and dedication her business has thrived.

Kagiatu G. has obtained loans four times from LAPO, Sierra Leone. With profit from her last loan, she opened a savings account. With this loan, she will purchase more gallons of palm oil and bags of garri (tapioca) for sale. Her desire to be a major distributor in Freetown has led her to pursue this expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil and garri (tapioca) for sale

loans.name: Rosa Ticona

texts.es:
La Sra.  Rosa Es una cliente antigua ha trabajado antes en grupo solidario, es muy cumplida ha mostrando su responsabilidad,  ella esta casada con el Sr.  clemente, su esposo es contratista para una fabrica en Cochabamba, ellos tienen tres hijos, su puesto D. la Sra. Se encuentra en la calle René Vargas en la populosa zona D. la 16 D. julio, la venta D. sus enaguas la realiza los días jueves y domingo, días D. la gran feria 16 D. julio (La feria 16 D. Julio es mucho más que comercio. Asomarse a ella es adentrarse en la cosmovisión andina, donD. se vive la ritualidad D. las actividades comerciales del mundo Aymara. Por las calles, es común escuchar el “rebájame, auméntame”, formas centenarias D. entrar en este espacio particular y que D. ninguna manera se manejan en un supermercado u otros espacios. La feria 16 D. Julio es una recreación D. los “Colqa” o tambos D. la época colonial, que eran una especie D. almacenes D. alimentos por donD. circulaban gran cantidad D. productos. ), la Sra. Rosa se queda hasta largar horas D. la noche  para poder vender sus productos. La Sra. Rosa  Produce las enaguas por menor, junto a sus hijas, su mayor anhelo D. la Sra.  Rosa junto a sus hijas  es ampliar su negocio mejorando así su  calidad D. vida.
Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Rosa is a long-term client who has worked with a group in the past. She is very polite and has demonstrated great responsibility. She is married to Clemente, who is a contractor at a factory in Cochabamba; they have three children. Her booth is located on Calle René Vargas in the populous 16 D. Julio zone. She sells enaguas (traditional underskirts) on Thursdays and Sundays, which are the days of the great 16 D. Julio street market. The 16 D. Julio street market is much more than just a market. To enter the market is to go deep into the Andean worldview, where one can witness the ritual of the Aymará world’s commercial activities. On the streets it is common to hear “lower me, increase me,” centuries-old forms of bargaining that are used in this particular space but which are never used in supermarkets or other places. The 16 D. Julio market is a recreation of the “Colqa” or tambos of the colonial period, which were a kind of grocery store where a large amount of products were in circulation. Rosa works until late at night so that she can sell her products. She and her daughters produce the enaguas and sell them at retail prices. Her biggest wish is that she and her daughters can expand her business and thus improve their quality of life. Rosa is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have given her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric for making traditional underskirts

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Luis de 46 años y sus 2 hijos, quienes son el motor para continuar trabajando. En la ciudad de Tarma, “La Estancia“ es una de las pastelerías mas conocidas y concurridas, negocio que le pertenece a Celia, en donde prepara sus deliciosas tortas y pasteles, por lo que son muy apreciados por sus asiduos compradores, quienes han hecho que su negocio sobre salga de entre los demás. Ella aprendió la repostería de los conocimientos de sus padres, quienes antiguamente tenían un horno, por lo que hacían pan y pasteles para vender. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es decorar las tortas, tiene mucha paciencia para hacerlo y eso se nota en los hermosos decorados que muestra en su panadería, Es así que lleva 6 años en este negocio, siendo lo más difícil de su trabajo trasnocharse para cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen. Mas adelante espera abrir al costado de su pastelería una pizzería, de eso modo le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Este es au cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que siempre ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. Dentro de su banco comunal, es una socia responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida por sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá para arreglar un horno especial para preparar pizzas, herramienta que le ayudará a comenzar con su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Celia is a very cheerful and hard-working 41-year old woman who lives in a rented house with her 46 year old husband Luis and their two children who are the driving force for her to continue working. Their bakery "La Estancia" is one of the best known and popular bakeries in the city of Tarma, where she prepares the delicious cakes and pies that their regulars appreciate and that make their business stand out among the others. Celia learned to bake pastries from her parents who used to make bread and pies in their oven to sell. What she enjoys most is to decorate the cakes. She has the patience and the touch to make the beautiful decorations that typify her bakery. She has been in this business for six years, and the most difficult part is to be up all night to fill the orders that she has. However, to move forward she hopes to open a pizzería to the side of her pastry shop to help improve her income. This is Celia's fourth loan with MFP. She has always demonstrated punctuality in her payments and hopes to do so again now. She is a responsible member of her communal bank, which makes her very dear to her partners. With the 2000 nuevo soles that she asks for, she will repair a special oven to prepare pizzas, a tool that will help her start her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick Clarke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a pizza oven

loans.name: Eudesa

texts.en:
Eudesa P. is from the village of Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 44 years old. Eudesa is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Eudesa owns & operates a manufacturing business.
