She has a leg injury and hates thinking about it. She joined GHAPE in 2004 and has received and repaid Empowerment credit four times.

She plans to invest in her dressmaking and groundnut selling business. She is very sure this business will succeed because she has a good experience in it, and because there is a high demand for groundnut. Her loan will help the community in that it will enable her to make the cloths and groundnuts readily available for local buyers at affordable prices.

She will reinvest some of the proceeds realized from this business venture and use the rest to pay house rent, her children’s school fees and to provide medication for her family.

She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rate, because no collateral security is required, because the money is repaid in installments and also because of the training GHAPE gives its members.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase material, thread, and groundnut

loans.name: Abdullatef

texts.en:
Abdullatef is a 24-year-old man, who is single and lives in Zeita village near Tulkarem city in Palestine. Abdullatef has his own project which is an entertainment store that contains many games, but he wants to expand in this field and purchase a new pool table to increase the options of games to play in the store. 

Abdullatef hasn't enough money to pay for purchasing a new pool table, so he needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN.

When Abdullatef gets his FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase a pool table and have a variety of games in his store that will lead to an increase in customers coming to play and so increase his income. Abdullatef is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase a pool table for the project he has.

loans.name: Victor Rufino

texts.es:
El sr. Victor  es una persona trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante y dar a su familia una vida comoda, Victor se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa para atender su negocio cuando el no esta en casa.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria y asi surtir su negocio.
Los planes de Victor es llegar a tener un mercadito.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su esposa y su hijo.
texts.en:
Victor is a hardworking person who wants very much to make progress and give his family a comfortable life.  He sells groceries and has a small store in his house.  His wife helps him run his business when he is not at home.

He will use the loan to buy groceries to supply his business. Victor’s goal is to have his own small shop outside of his home. He needs the income to provide a better life to his wife and son.

loans.use: to buy white bread, sweet bread, coffee, beans, butter, oil, margarine, rice, milk, soap, toilet paper and churros.

loans.name: Keko

texts.en:
Keko has been a farmer for the last ten years. He is 42 years old, married, and a father of four school-going children.

He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of abode. This is his third loan which he plans to use to buy  farm supplies. 

He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm. His dream is to be the best and a well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth de 26 años de edad, convive con yenil de 32 años, con quien tiene 01 hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Periavente Alta. Ella es una mujer dedicada a los negocios, desde muy joven tiene una tienda de abarrotes, y con las pocas ganancias acumuladas durante años, decidió abrir una distribuidora de bebidas al por mayor. En compañía de su esposo, se dedica a éste negocio que le genera ganancias considerables. Con ello puede mantener la alimentación y educación de su hijo. Sin embargo, las frecuentes lluvias bloquean las  carreteras, perjudicádole en la llegada de su mercadería a su destino y no lograr abastecerse de bebidas suficientes para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, logrará comprar más bebidas para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 26 years old, and she lives with Yenil, aged 32, with whom she has one son.  They live together in a home they own, which is located in the community of Periavente Alta. 

Yaneth is a woman who focuses on business.  She's had a grocery store since she was very young, and with the small earnings that she has accumulated over the years, she decided to open a wholesale drinks distributorship.  She is working in this business together with her husband, and it is generating considerable earnings for her; allowing her to cover food and education for her son.  However, the frequent rains have blocked the streets, making it more difficult for merchandise to get to its destination, and so she couldn't keep sufficient drinks in stock to meet her customers' demand.

This will be her first loan with MFP, and she commits to making her repayments punctually.

With the 3,000 Soles that she is requesting, she will be able to buy more drinks to stock up her business.

loans.use: to buy more drinks.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Yolanda has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Yolanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Yolanda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jose Arnoldo

texts.es: José Arnoldo tiene 57 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de barbería. Tiene más de 40 años de poseer este negocio, además de brindar el servicio él se encarga de abastecer a otras barberías de productos y equipos de barbería. Él es un hombre muy tranquilo que siempre está conversando con sus clientes. Solicita este crédito para la compra de cuchillas, navajas, máquinas para afeitar, talcos, cremas entre otros.
texts.en: José Arnoldo is 57 years old and works as a barber.  He has had this business for more than 40 years.  In addition to providing his service, he also supplies other barber's with haircutting products and equipment.  José Arnoldo is a very calm person who is always chatting with his customers.  He is requesting this loan to buy blades, knives, razors, talcs, creams and other products.

loans.use: to buy blades, knives, razors, talcs, creams, etc.

loans.name: Mak

texts.en:
Mak (pictured here) is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Pao, is a tailor. The couple also raises fish at home. They live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have three children, one son and two daughters. One is a garment-factory worker, another one attends school, and the other assists his parents in fish farming. 

Mak is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike because the old one breaks down often.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has four children.  Abena operates a chop bar (where African dishes are sold) at Eguafo, which she has done forseven years. Her husband is a machine operator. Abena uses her income to assist her husband in caring for their children. Abena will use the loan to purchase foodstuffs for her dishes. With the new profits, Abena plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Soita W Group

texts.en:
Rose joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rose had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Rose was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Rose will invest in livestock rearing and; hence, educate her children.

Rose is the facilitator of the Soita W group. The photograph shows Rose with her group members. The field officer is on the far left. Rose and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Soita W group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Corbanga

texts.en: Corbanga is a 64-year-old widow. She is a very patient and hardworking person. Corbanga is engaged in selling different vegetables to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy a variety of vegetables and fruits that she can offer in the community. Corbanga, at her age, still hopes to find ways to provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy beans, squash, cabbage and tomatoes

loans.name: Muzamilu

texts.en: Muzamilu is a 23-year-old hardworking man who wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for a transport business. He has been doing motorcycle transport locally (known as bodaboda) for four years. He started by working for someone else and accumulated money to buy a motorcycle. Muzamilu is married with one child, and dreams of starting up several businesses to sustain his growing family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Aminata. She is married with 4 children aged 18, 10, 12 and 6 years. She has 4 additional dependents who live with her to attend school. 

In 2006, Aminata established her business, selling clothing and slippers, because she believed she could earn enough profit to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000 to buy more clothing and slippers for her business. 

In the future, Aminata plans to grow her business into a very big shop and to buy a piece of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Ana Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal Sector 3 Marías, vive en una comunidad que  pertenece a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida como el mirador de la Ciudad ya que se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser amables y gentiles.

La Señora Ana esta delicada de salud ya que sufre de la Diabetes, por lo cual debe estar en un tratamiento constante, agradece a Dios por la salud de toda su familia. 

Doña Ana es de profesión costurera y tiene su taller hace varios años, como su trabajo lo realiza desde su casa tiene el tiempo para dedicarse a la cría de pollos, cuyes y cerdos.

Se ha dedicado a laborar en estas actividades porque así puede aportar a la economía de su hogar y lo más importante  es que son trabajos que le gustan y los realiza con mucho agrado, el dinero de su crédito anterior lo ha invertido en la compra de animales, en tela e hilo para continuar con su negocio. En el pago de su crédito no ha tenido ninguna dificultad realizando la cancelación a la fecha.

El banco comunal le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y por la unión y compañerismo que existe en el grupo. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela, hilos, pollos y cuyes para continuar con sus negocios.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the “Sector 3 Marías” communal bank and lives in a community that belongs to Turi Parish in Cuenca.  This parish is known as the City’s Overlook because a great part of the city can be observed from there.  Its residents are merchants, raise animals and farm; they are noted for being nice and kind.

Ana is in precarious health because she has diabetes so must be under constant treatment; she thanks God for her family’s health.

Ana is a seamstress by profession and has had her workshop for several years.  Since her work is home-based, she has time to raise chickens, guinea pigs and pigs.

She has decided to work in these activities because she can contribute to her home’s economy and most importantly because they are jobs that she likes and does with much satisfaction.  The money from her previous loan was used to buy animals, fabric and thread to continue in business.  She has had no problem repaying the loan and has been making her payments on time.

She likes the communal bank because of the ease in getting loans and because of the unity and companionship that exists among the members.  She will use her new loan to buy thread, fabric, chickens and guinea pigs to continue with her businesses.

loans.use: to buy thread, chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Grp Ushirika Group

texts.en:
Tabu, who is in his early 50s, is married with five school-age children. He has been selling farm supplies for seven years now. He works from 06 am to 06 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Tabu's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy the best-selling farm supplies to meet his customers' demand. He dreams of owning a cereal shop.

Tabu will share this loan with his loan group Ushirika which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best-selling farm supplies to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.en:
Madam Dédé D. was born in 1962 at Aneho (Togo). Married and mother of a single child, she also supports two (2) dependant children. She started her activities with a small table along the road with about $45 which today has transformed into a foodstuffs shop. Very devoted, dynamic and imaginative, she has began selling cold water and ice for her area as it is cruelly not provided drinking water. Still not satisfied with her activities, she added a phone box to her shop which is a necessity in her area. With all of these projects, Madame Dédé D. has decdied to leave her current trade place which is situated in the big market of Lomé, for her new area in the suburb of Lomé, which will offer more growth opportunities. The credit of $850 she is requesting will serve to enlarge her shop in order to acquire a financial autonomy and cover her family\'s needs. Madame Dédé D.\'s dynamic personality should be encouraged in order to serve as an example for her young sisters.

Mme D. Dédé est née en 1962 à Aného (Togo). Elle est mariée et mère d’un unique enfant mais a deux (02) autres enfants à sa charge. Elle a commencé ses activités avec un petit commerce de table au bord des rues avec soit $ 45, mais, elle détient aujourd’hui une boutique d’alimentation générale. Très dévouée, dynamique imaginative, elle a associé à sa boutique, la vente d’eau et de glaçon car son quartier n’est pas desservi et manque cruellement d’eau potable. Comme ces activités ne lui suffisaient pas, elle a installé une cabine téléphonique qui est une nécessité dans sa zone. Avec tous ses projets, Mme D. Dédé a préféré quitter sa place qui se trouve au grand marché de Lomé pour assainir sa nouvelle zone dans la banlieue de Lomé, ce qui lui fera développer plus ses activités. Le crédit de $ 850 sollicité va servir à agrandir sa boutique afin d’acquérir une autonomie financière et subvenir aux besoins les plus élémentaires de la famille. Le dynamisme de cette femme mérite d’être encouragé afin de servir d’exemple pour ses jeunes sœurs.

loans.use: To buy one freezer and many other products

loans.name: Akoélévi

texts.en: Born in 1971 in Fongbe Apedome (Zio Province) Mrs. Akoelevi LIASSADJI  left school in elementary school.  Since then she has sold donuts (beignets) along the main autoroutes in her area.  She is married and has two children and cares for two other persons. Her family lives near the absolute poverty level, her husband contributing very little to the family income.  Her exceptional managerial capabilities and the skill level at which she runs her small business will allow her to repay her loan of $750 within the scheduled time frame.  Such an opportunity will enable her to get out of her and her family's dire circumstances.

loans.use: Bulk discount purchase of wheat flour and cooking oil (Achat de sacs de farine de blé et des bidons d’huile)

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and has four children, her husband is retired and also helps her in the store. She began her business because she needed to be able to support her family. As she does not have her own home, she has to pay rent where she lives, which only adds to her financial responsibilities. She needed to earn a little more money than they received from her husband's income, and so with a little bit of savings she was able to purchase many items which she then resold, reinvesting the money earned in more merchandise and thus allowing her business to grow little by little. Now she has been running her business for five years and is very hard-working, she tends her store from Monday to Sunday from 7am-10pm.

Gloria is asking for a loan of $700 in order to purchase merchandise for her business and to have a wider variety in stock to offer to customers and to continue with her business' growth. She proposes to repay the loan in 6-12 months and awaits your help so that she can improve her life along with her family's, who all thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Gloria esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo es jubilado y la ayuda en el negocio. Inició su negocio por la necesidad de aportar en la economía familiar. Como ella no tiene casa propia tiene que pagar renta en el lugar donde vive, eso más los gastos familiares la obligaron a ver que podía hacer para obtener un ingreso extra al de su esposo y ayudarlo, así con un pequeño ahorro compro muy pocas cosas y se puso a vender, reinvirtiendo lo poco que le quedaba en más mercancía y fue creciendo poco a poco, ya tiene más de cinco años con el negocio y es muy trabajadora, ella atiende en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 7:00am hasta las 10:00pm.

Gloria esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 700 para comprar mercancía para su negocio y así tener un mayor surtido de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y continuar creciendo para poder tener un mejor futuro, ofrece pagar este préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses y espera de tu apoyo para que pueda salir adelante junto con su familia, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ahou

texts.en: Ahou B. is a dynamic young lady. She is 24 years old and she has managed her own cosmetics products store since May 2005 in Adjamé open market. She is a single woman and has no children. She lives in Adjame, a commercial township in North Abidjan. She has rapidly developed her business during the last 2 years. Ahou wants to take advantage of the holiday season to offer new fashion products to young ladies. She got her first loan from AE&I in February 2006 and has been a good performer since then.

loans.use: Ahou Brigitte will use the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime lives with her husband in her own home in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz.. She is dedicated to making footwear for children, and her shop is located in her home. She works with one person who assembles the shoes and her husband who cuts and sows. The loan she's requesting is for purchasing materials so she can produce larger quantities, hire another person, and increase her income.

Jaime received a loan in 2006, which she repaid in full incrementally. Her credit history classifies her as an excellent client and worthy of receiving another loan.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Jaime vive en casa propia en la Calle Ascencio Padilla de la zona de Alto San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa. Jaime se dedica a la elaboración de calzados de niños, el taller esta ubicado en su domicilio, trabaja con una persona que arma los calzados y su esposa que corta y cose. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder elaborar calzados en mayor cantidad, contratar otra persona más y mejorar sus ingresos. Jaime obtuvo un crédito de IMPRO en el año 2006 el cual fue pagado íntegramente y en las fechas establecidas. Este antecedente histórico lo califica como un cliente excelente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase materials and hire another worker

loans.name: Alicia Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alicia is a loving mother who dedicates herself to the embroidering of all types of clothing. She has six children, and even though they are grown, she has continued to tend to them with tenderness. With the objective of caring for them, she decided 30 years ago to dedicate herself to embroidery at the advice of an aunt as a method to gain additional income and care for her children in her small home.

This activity has allowed her to raise her family's standard of living and after many years has become the principle economic support of her home. Now she continues working in the company of her husband, and she hopes for the future with great longing that she may be able to open a small general store in her home. To reach this goal, she will continue creating beautiful and quality embroidery.

For this purpose she requests a loan of $375 which will be wisely invested in the purchase of the materials that she needs to continue her work. Remember that your support is very valuable and important for Alicia and she thanks you in advance for your help.

Translated by Katie Sheaffer, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Alicia es una amorosa madre que se dedica laboriosamente a bordar todo tipo de trajes típicos, tiene seis hijos y aunque han pasado los años y ya han crecido ella no deja de observarlos con ternura; con el objetivo de tenerlos siempre a su cuidado ella decide hace 30 años dedicarse a realizar bordados por consejo de una de sus tías como alternativa para generar ingresos económicos adicionales y cuidar de sus hijos en su pequeña morada. Esta actividad le ha permitido incrementar el nivel de vida de su familia y hace muchos años se ha convertido en el sostén económico principal de su hogar; ahora viene desempeñándose en compañía de su esposo y espera su futuro familiar con grandes anhelos pues desea aperturar pronto una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera necesidad en casa y para conseguir su objetivo ella seguirá incrementando su esfuerzo para seguir elaborando hermosos y finos bordados. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares que serán sabiamente invertidos en la compra de los materiales que necesita para continuar con su labor; recuerda que tu aporte es muy valioso e importante para Alicia y te agradece por anticipado tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to continue embroidering.

loans.name: Jaloma

texts.es:
Jaloma V. is a mother a six children who has struggled to help them get ahead. She has succeeded, as they are now married. Regardless, Jaloma ended up alone since, as her children grew, their father abandoned them and left her with sole responsibility for taking care of them. Thanks to her desire to improve their lives, she did not need a man to become what she is today: well-known in her community for her courage and her dedication to sales. Thirty-one years ago, she began selling beauty products from house to house, covering the surrounding area.

Despite this, being alone has created financial difficulties for her and she finds herself unable to invest in her business during this busy season, a time when customers have money and are looking to buy gifts for friends and family. For this reason, Jaloma is asking for a loan of $925USD to be repaid over a six-month period. With these funds, she will be able to buy more merchandise that her customers will like. With your help, Jaloma will be able to succeed despite her loneliness.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Jaloma V. madre de 6 hijos, a luchado por sacar a sus hijos adelante. Y lo logró, todos ya se encuentran casados. Sin embargo Jaloma, se quedó sola puesto que mientras sus hijos iban creciendo el papá de ellos la abandonó y le dejó la responsabilidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante. Gracias a sus ganas de superarse no necesitó de un hombre para poder ser lo que hoy es. Una mujer reconocida en su comunidad por su coraje y entrega a las ventas. Comenzó hace 31 años a vender productos de belleza casa por casa recorriendo todo lo que se encontrara a su alrededor. Sin embargo el quedarse sola, le a implicado muchos problemas económicos por lo tanto no tiene dinero suficiente para invertir en esta temporada que para ella es muy buena puesto que la mayoría de sus clientes tienen dinero y ganas de comprarle un regalo a sus familiares. Por lo tanto Jaloma está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía que le gustará a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Jaloma podrá salir adelante a pesar de la soledad.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena A. is a dealer of unsewn clothing material, shoes, bags and so on. She is a married woman with one child who is six years old. Her husband is a transport owner but his income is not sufficient to meet the family’s financial needs. Helena is working very hard to support her husband with the family’s finances. Demand for her goods has increased.

She is asking for $1,200 as  additional capital to buy more materials, shoes, bags, etc. to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more materials, shoes, bags, etc. to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uch S., 42, is married with three children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband have a lot of experience in producing mortars and pestles and reselling them for a profit, making collectively about $6 each day. They started this business in 1998.

Also, one of her children works with his parents producing mortars earning $3 per day. The other two children are students.

Mrs. Uch S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more rock and other tools to make her work easier and more effective.

loans.use: To purchase more rock and other tools to make her work easier and more effective.

loans.name: Rosa Piedad

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Piedad R. D. D. F.ández is a member of the community bank “Santa Rosa” (Saint Rose) which is located in the district of San José D. Sisa in the province of El Dorado in the San Martín region. She is dedicated to the preparation and sale of food from her own home. She provides daily service to workers in the fields of education, health, agriculture, and other fields.

Her need to give her children a better education motivated her to start her own business. At first, she borrowed cooking utensils and other materials, but later she began acquiring implements with the earnings from her sales.

With a loan of 2500 Peruvian Nuevo sol ($875 US), which she will repay in six months, she will invest in creating her own restaurant, purchasing chairs and tables as well as non-perishables that will be used in the preparation of meals.

Rosa is 38 years old and has three children. Her goal is to have a restaurant where she will be able to sell a variety of dishes from a menu.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Bevington, Alyssa Sanow, and Debra Fraszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

La señora Rosa Piedad R. D. D. F.ández, es socia del Banco Comunal ”Santa Rosa” ubicado en el distrito D. San José D. Sisa, provincia D. El Dorado, departamento D. San Martín, se dedica a la preparación y venta D. comida, dentro D. su propia casa, atendiendo con atención diaria a trabajadores del sector educación, salud, ministerio D. agricultura y otros. La necesidad D. dar una mejor educación a sus hijos la impulsaron a iniciarse en el negocio, al principio pedía prestado utensilios D. cocina y otros materiales, luego los fue adquiriendo con las ganancias que le brindo sus ventas. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en el arreglo D. su propio local, implementando con sillas y mesas y en la compra D. insumos no perecibles, para la elaboración D. los platos D. comida. Tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, su meta es tener un restaurante donD. pueda vender variedad D. platos a la carta.

loans.use: To create her own restaurant

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Ms. Maria de Jesús D. is a self-sacrificing woman that must travel over 40 kilometers every day to set up her fruit salad stall in the capital. She specializes in fruit salads as they are very popular for dessert in Paraguay. The high temperatures in this country make a refreshing fruit salad a most appetizing option after a meal.

María begins her day in the early hours of the day, traveling to the municipal market to purchase the fruits necessary to prepare her fruit salads. She also purchases the necessary plastic spoons and cups to serve her product. Then she travels to the city center, where she sets up her stall daily in a street corner. Her clientele is made up primarily of office workers from the vicinity. She is well known and loved.

Her sales day ends at 6 p.m., and after taking down her stall and traveling home she begins her role as wife and mother. María is a mother of six, her children study and also take care of a fruit salad salad stand at home. Her children love their mother and to help increase the family income they also prepare and sell the fruit salad at home.

María is one of the many Paraguayan women that sacrifice her days from sunrise to sunset to feed her children and provide an education for them. She is requesting a micro loan to invest in a greater variaty of fruit. With more variety, she will be able to sell fruit juices as well as her fruit salads. Her clients have allready expressed an interest in being able to buy fruit juices from her.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Fruit purchase

loans.name: Irma Cecilia

texts.es:
The young Irma Cesilia works for the ministry of education, a vocation she undertook at the age of seventeen while living in Piedra Pintada during the week and returning to her home for the weekends. She started to work with credit from AFODENIC in the year 2000, using her first loan to purchase land where she has built her home. With this ninth loan she wants to add “repello” (an extra coating of cement that is thrown onto the side of a wall) to her house before winter starts, to give it more strength and protection. She will also tile and, lastly, add paint, as she wants to give her five year old daughter and her mother a dignified and presentable dwelling. She has 10 years in the education sector and with much sacrifice she is working toward a degree in computers at the university. A year ago, she was transferred to the San Patricio School where she acts as director due to her responsibility, honesty and dedication to providing an education for the boys and girls of her community. She expressed gratefulness to AFODENIC because, thanks to this organization which is characterized for giving assistance to the most vulnerable, she has been able to reach goals that she’s had since childhood.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La Joven Irma Cesilia es trabajadora del MINEd, inició sus labores de educadora joven a la edad de 17 años en la Piedra Pintada, donde permanecia toda la semana, viajando a su casa los fines de semana. Inició a trabajar con credito en AFODENIC en el año 2000 utilizando su primer credito para comprar el terreno donde actualmente tiene construida su vivienda, con este noveno credito realizar el repello de su casa antes que inicie el invierno, para darle mas resitencia y proteccion, hara el embaldozado y finalmente le pintara, pues quiere dar a su hija de 5 años y a su mamá una vivienda digna y presentable de acuerdo a sus posibilidades, tiene 10 años de trabajar para el sector educativo y con sacrificio esta estudiando en la UNAN la Lic. en Informatica, hace 1 año fue trasladada a la Escuela San Patricio donde se desempeña como directora por su responsabilidad, honestidad y dedicacion al brindar el pan de la enseñanza a niños y niñas de su comunidad; manifestó estar agradecida con AFODENIC porque gracias a esta institucion que se caracteirza por dar atencion a los mas desprotegidos ha podido cumplir con la meta que se planteo desde muy joven.

loans.use: Improve her dwelling.

loans.name: Grupo Belén - Domitila, Aurelia, Juana Group

texts.es:
Juana, Domitila and Aurelia are members of the Belén Communal Bank (first loan: www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28900&_tpos=1&_tpg=1).

Juana is 39 years old, has six children and lives with her common-law husband. She sells snacks at an outdoor stand in front of a school and also works evenings time to time at a local business.

Domitila is a 37-year-old single mother of two. She sells food at an outdoor stand on one of the city's main streets. She also sells a corn dish called cancha and gelatin, which she makes herself.

Aurelia is married, 50 years old, and has seven children. She sells fruits outdoors with a wheelbarrow. She also dedicates herself to raising goats and selling food at festivals.

Juana, Domitila and Aurelia need loans of 1000, 600 and 600 soles, respectively, which they will use to purchase cookies, caramels, juices, oils, potatoes, gelatin and fruit. The dreams of these three women are to have their own homes and for their children to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Primer Préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=28900&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Juana, Domitila y Aurelia son socias del Banco Comunal Belén

Juana es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 6 hijos, Juana venD. golosinas D. manera ambulatoria en la puerta D. un colegio. Además Juana por las noches trabaja eventualmente en una empresa.

Por otro lado Domitila es madre soltera, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Domitila venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica D. la ciudad. Además venD. canchas y gelatinas que ella prepara.

Mientras que Aurelia es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Aurelia venD. frutas D. manera ambulatoria en una carretilla. Además Aurelia se dedica a la crianza D. ganado caprino y también venD. comida en las ferias.

Juana, Domitila y Aurelia necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. galletas, caramelos, jugos, aceite, papa, gelatina, frutas.

Los sueños D. Juana, Domitila y Aurelia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase cookies, caramels, juices, oil, potatoes, gelatin and fruit / Juana, Domitila y Aurelia necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, jugos, aceite, papa, gelatina, frutas.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan N. is 30 years old. He’s married and the father of two children. His wife is a housekeeper, and thus Hasan’s business as a farmer is the main source of income for the family. Hasan is working hard on the farm in order to make his children happy and to give them a good education. As well as his children and his wife, Hasan also takes care of his parents.

Hasan's business includes growing and selling of crops such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cucumbers and carrots. He has worked in agriculture for 10 years and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. At the same time Hasan is raising the small cattle and selling them in the market.

Due to the beginning of the sowing season, Hasan is planning to sow onions, potatoes and carrots. That is why he wants to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds and why he needs a loan of $US600 for the term of 10 months. Also with part of the loan he is planning to improve his shed. Hasan is promising to be accurate with paying the loan and he expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of leather material for making leather jackets

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji lives in Shah Rukn-e-Alam, a part of the city of Multan. Multan is famous for its historical places and handicrafts. Nasreen baji owns a two-room brick house where she has lived for the last 6 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son works in a factory. Her younger son reads in 3rd standard and her daughter reads in 7th standard. Her husband, Mr. T., is a painter who paints houses, windows, and doors.

Nasreen baji is a housewife and has a business of selling clothes. She buys clothes from different cities and sells them in Multan. She has been in this profession for the last 15 years. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to resell. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy bicycle spare parts for her spare parts shop. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy scrap (plastic bottles and paper) for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Ana Teresa

texts.pt:
Ana nasceu em namaacha uma vila que faz fronteira com a swazilândia, tem 42 anos estudou ate a 7 classe, teve que interroper os estudos devido a  gravidez precóce,é viuva e mãe de 4 filhas com idades compriendidas entre os 25 aos 18 anos de idade, a mais velha já esta empregada e as outras 3 estao no ensino secundario. 

Ana perde o seu esposo  num acidente de viacao em 1990 quando estava prestes a se casar. Apois essa tregédia, a vida fica dificil pois o falecido deixa-lhe com 4 filhas por criar e sem casa própria,pois viviam numa casacedido pelos serviços do marido e apois a sua morte tiveram que entregar a casa. Os pais acolheram lhe durante 3 anos  mas como o seu esposo era funcionario do estado ela recebe uma indimnização e uma casa. Em 1993 faz um curso de criacao de aves no centro social da namaacha durante 6 meses, entao com o valor ganho na indimnizacao e a pensao mensal de 2.700.00MT, inicia com a criacao de pintos actividade essa que exersse ate hoje. Tem metido 300 frangos e gasta 18.000.00MT  tem um lucro de 7.500.00MT e consegue poupar 2.000.00MT e 500.00mtn aluga capoeira, pois não se responsabiliza por mas niguem alem das filhas.

Este e o terceiro emprestimo da ana e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro de 15,000.00mt e o segundo de 25,000.00mtn foram usados na compra de pintos e raçào e este terceiro de 15,000.00mtn tambem seram usados para mesmo fim, pretende futuramente pedir novos emprestimos para construir a sua propria capoiera e tornar se uma grande criadora de frangos.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and was born in Namaacha, a village on the border of Swaziland. She studied up to 7th grade, then had to interrupt her studies because of an early pregnancy. She is a widow and mother of 4 daughters, between the ages of 18 and 25 years old. The oldest is employed, and the other three are in secondary school.

Ana lost her partner in a car accident in 1990 when they were prepared to get married. After this tragedy, life was difficult. He had left her with four children to raise and without a house of their own. They had been living in a house granted through his job, and after his death they had to vacate the house. Her parents took her in for three years, and because she was the wife of a state employee she received an indemnity benefit and a house. In 1993 she took a poultry-raising course for six months at the community center in Namaacha. Then with the money she had received from the indemnity benefit and monthly pension of 2,700 meticais (MZN), she started raising chickens, which she has continued until today. She has an average of 300 chickens; spends 18,000MZN; profits 7,500MZN; is able to save 2,000MZN; and rents a chicken coop for 500MZN. Now she is responsible for no one else besides her daughters.

This is Ana’s third loan and first one with Kiva. She used the first loan of 15,000MZN and the second of 25,000MZN to buy chickens and feed, and this third loan of 15,000MZN also will be used for the same purpose. In the future she intends to request more loans to build her own chicken coop and become a great chicken farmer.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and feed for her poultry business

loans.name: Casta María

texts.es: Ha logrado fortalecer su negocio con financiamientos otorgados por ADIM y a tener un mejor control de su negocio gracias a las capacitaciones. Inicio su negocio vendiendo ropa interior y chinelas. Esta ubicada en un buen punto en el mercado donde  actualmente ofrece variedad de ropa para niños, adulto y calzado  en general. Doña Casta  es madre soltera, a ella le corresponde llevar el sustento diario a su casa, tiene un hijo a quien ella lo esta motivando en los estudios para darle mejores condiciones de vida  y una carrera universitaria. Aspira ofrecer mercadería de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Ms. E. has managed to strengthen her business through funding from ADIM, and also has better control of her business thanks to their training sessions. She started out selling underwear and flip-flops. Her business is well-situated in a market in which she sells clothing for children and adults, as well as footwear. Ms. Casta E. is a single mother who must provide for her household daily. She has one son whom she is motivating in his studies so that she can give him better living conditions and provide him with higher education. She aspires to offer better quality merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Hach

texts.en: Mrs. Hach L. is a villager in Ang Thnout Koeut village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school while the youngest is two years old. Mrs. Hach L. cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Dos Sovan, is a barber. Even though they have different businesses, they still do not have enough money to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Hach L. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding cow business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a breeding cow.

loans.name: Cham

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Châm 34 tuổi hiện  đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại huyện Mê Linh- Hà Nội. Chị Châm tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Vòng vốn đầu chị sử dụng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Sau một thời gian sử dụng vốn hiệu quả gia đình chị đã có thêm nguồn vốn để đầu tư vào xưởng mộc của gia đình. Hiện tại cùng với chăn nuôi đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị 
Với số vốn 10.000.000 đ mong muốn được vay trong vòng vốn tới chị Châm có kế hoạch sẽ sử dụng để đầu tư thêm vốn mua gỗ phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất, kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. V. Thi Cham is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 small children in the district of Me Linh - Ha Noi. She has been a member of TYM fund since 1995. Her first loan was used to invest in raising farm animals. The loan program was so effective that after a period of time, her family was able to save enough to invest in a carpentry/lumber business. Presently, this business and raising farm animals are their main sources of income. With the next loan, she wishes to borrow 600 USD to purchase additional lumber for her carpentry business

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in carpentry

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida O. is 34 years old, married and a mother with four children. Currently three of them are in school while the last born is still breastfeeding. She has been a food vendor for two years now in the Agogo community school where she lives with her family. She sells rice with stew; this food is mostly purchased by the schoolchildren during their break time. Vida says the demand for her food has extended to the people in the community, so when she closes in the morning she prepares more for the afternoon and sells it in the community market. Vida wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, meat, charcoal and others. She is convinced that the loan would help her increase her stock, so in the event of a price hike she still would have resources to cook food. Vida wants to use the proceeds to supports her kids in their educations. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs like rice, cooking oil, charcoal, spices and meats, etc.

loans.name: Jacqueline Georgina

texts.es:
Jacqueline Georgina M. vive en Soyapango, con su esposo e hijas. A sus 45 años, nunca recibió educación, pues  sus padres no contaban con las posibilidades económicas necesarias y tuvo que trabajar desde joven.  Desde hace ya 10 años reside en Ilopango, donde junto a su esposo montaron un humilde bazar en su propia casa.  Como el bazar se encuentra dentro de la residencia, los productos que venden en este, son comprados en su mayoría por los vecinos de su colonia. El sueño de Jacqueline y su familia es extender su negocio para poder llegar a más clientes y vender más.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y empezar expandir paso a paso su negocio más allá de su colonia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Georgia M. lives in Soyapango with her husband and daughters. She is 45 years old and has never had a formal education because her parents did not have the money to send her to school. She has been working since she was young. For the last 10 years she has lived in Ilopanga, where she and her husband started a humble little store that they operate out of their home. Since the store is located inside of their house, the majority of the products that they sell are purchased by people from their neighborhood. Jacqueline and her family's dream is to grow their business and to have more customers. She's asking for a loan to purchase new merchandise and begin expanding, step by step, outside of her neighborhood. (Translated by Nikki and Ryan of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma  A. T. owns a small shop in the Melinne neighborhood on the island of Zanzibar, Tanzania for the last 2 years. She belongs to Mombasa Two group loan (Group code 2052).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more items for her business and food for her family. She is hoping through this loan her profits will increase and she can expand her business

Mwajuma is 28 years old, married with two children, ages 5 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business and food for her family.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Having her hopes and dreams in life, Vilma was very determined to do everything for her family. She is now 41 years old and married to Roberto, who is 44 years old and works as a tricycle driver and at the same time manages their farm lot. They have three children: Rubelyn - 22 years old, Vinalyn - 21 years old and Roberto - 18 years old. None of their children have earned a college degree due to lack of money. Their children are working as house helpers and sales workers.

The couple's tricycle transport business is providing them at least PHP300.00 a day, which they are using for their daily expenses. Vilma wants to engage in another business for an alternative source of income. She is now is asking for financial assistance amounting to PHP 9,000.00. This amount will be of great help to pursue her plan of selling vegetables, while some of the amount will be used for the maintenance of their motorcycle. Vilma also dreams to have a big business in which she can help other people by means of employment.

loans.use: To start a business selling vegetables and to maintain a motorcycle

loans.name: Feyisara

texts.en: Feyisara A. is 53 years old and married with 4 children. She sells drinks. She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia M., from the Misamis Occidental province of the Philippines, is 45 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a private driver.

She has been a bona fide member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) micro-finance program since November 2005 and has maintained excellent loan repayment performance. She is requesting a loan of $225 (10,000 PHP) to purchase additional stock for her “Sari-sari” store, in order to support and retain her neighborhood customers.

She is planning ahead so that her children can finish college and have a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Banineh Group

texts.en:
These are Safie K., Zainab D., Isatu Fonah, Adamsay K., Kosnatu B., and Aminata Conteh. They named their group Bannineh. They are requesting a loan of Le 1,200,000 for each to help them expand their businesses.

Safie K. (second from right) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-five and married to a police officer. They have three children, all of whom are attending schools – two in secondary schools and one in primary school. She sells clothes and dishes. She has been a businesswoman for over ten years now. Safie will invest this loan in her business. This will enable her to generate more profit so that she can pay her children’s school fees and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Neljean

texts.en: Mrs. Neljean Q. is 38 years-old and lives in Sinacaban in the Misamis Occidental province of the Philippines. She is married to an auto mechanic and they have 8 children studying in elementary and secondary level.  She is a new member of Paglaum MPC under the microfinance program. She requests a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 which she will use to purchase additional stock for her "sari-sari," or mini grocery store, were she sells assorted goods. She hopes to improve her business and be able to give a decent life to her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon A. sells wivons, cream and other hair products at Ekuase. Sharon has received primary education. She is married and has one child. She is responsible for paying school fees and housekeeping expenses. Her husband is a trader.

Sharon has been selling wivons and cream since 2006. Her loan will be used to buy more wivons and cream for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business to increase her capital and profits.

loans.use: To buy more wivons and cream for resale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. started her business in 2007 and it serves her well as one of their source of livelihood. Her husband, Alfredo, is a carpenter and a "lapida" (tombstone) maker. They only have one child who is already married and currently operates a small welding machine in their house.

Lydia started her membership in PMPC in July 2008 and established a good record in the cooperative. She is now obtaining her third loan with the objective of having additional capital for her business. She is very optimistic that her loan will help her business in purchasing more stock, hence earning more profits and uplifting their standard of living.

loans.use: To use as additonal capital for her fruit and vegetable vending

location.town: Sindangan-Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga De

loans.name: Motunrayo

texts.en: Motunrayo is 36 years old and married with 4 children; she sells palm kernel oil, rechargeable phone cards and provisions. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm kernel oil, rechargeable phone cards and provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel oil, rechargeable phone cards and provisions to sell

loans.name: 26 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Lý N. Thị is a 57-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Lý is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 26 Nam Ngạn (17.09.26).

Lý is married and has three adult children.  To making a living, Lý works in a family member's business running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling assorted food and snacks in the local community. Lý has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lý has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.963.500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business further. The loan will be the thirrd loan taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lý plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  H. Thị H. Hương is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her  tailoring business.

2.  T. Thị B. Liên is a 52-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of running a food stall.

3.  Đỗ Thị Luận is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock.

4.  N. Thị K. Yến is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.

5.  N. Thị Dung is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a food sales business

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: El Señor José Ernesto Núñez Juárez tiene 33 años de edad. La actividad económica de José  es la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de tres años que se dedica a este negocio, expresa que la misma necesidad lo ha impulsado a buscar una nueva fuente de ingresos además el quiere proporcionarle a su hijo la oportunidad  de estudia y salir adelante. Los propósitos de José son de mantener su actividad económica ya que es el único medio que posee para seguir manteniendo a su familia. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que se comprara ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y cosméticos, con esto podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz B. is already 61 years-old yet she seems to be untiring. She lives with her husband, Enrico, 60, a fellow vendor, in Caloocan City. Their only child is now married.

Paz has been selling fresh hog meat for fifteen years. She gets her supply from butchers who have been family friends over the years. She earns a net monthly income of P 10,000.00. From her profits which she religiously saved, she was able to have their house renovated. Her business has also grown bigger than ever from the profits which she has added to her capital in order to keep her business growing and going.

Paz became a member of Kiva partner the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006 and has since been testifying to the many good benefits her membership has brought to her business and personal life. On her 10th loan cycle, she seeks a loan in the amount of P16,000.00 as additional capital for further business expansion.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for meat selling business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan E. is from Barangay 3 in Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Susan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan sells tobacco in the market. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2003, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from HSPFI. Susan is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP that she will use to expand her business. This will be Susan's 38th loan taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is still single and, with four family members, lives with his parents at Culing Centro, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is located at National Highway, a rural and plain area.

Alfredo manages a motorcycle transport business, earning a daily net income of from PHP 200 to 300. He applied for a loan of PHP 9,000 to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.

Alfredo wants to increase his income to support his family needs and to help his nephew's education. He believes that, no matter what happens, he will work hard for his family, even though he has a small business.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To use for house renovation

loans.name: Rahmatsho

texts.en:
Rahmatsho is 42 years old, married and has two children. He owns a small grocery store, which he first opened four years ago. His store is well known in the neighborhood due to the fact that Rahmatsho has been able to keep it well stocked because of loans received through the Kiva field partner, IMON International. He has plans to expand the store this winter, as he isn't currently able to display all his stock because of limited space. Rahmatsho tells us he's a fighter and that this line of work requires much sacrifice, as he must work everyday, including weekends, starting at 6 am and going well into the evening. In spite of this, he feels very fortunate to have his own business, to be able to support his family and to provide his children with a good education. Rahmatsho is requesting this loan to purchase meats, sugar, milk, flour, beer, wine, etc. Thank you! 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling of cola

loans.name: Saturday

texts.en: Saturday is 49 years old, married and has six children.  He sells crates of drinks, wholesale and retail. He lives in Delta state, Nigeria.  His greatest joy in his business is having one-on-one interaction with his customers.  He hopes for a loan of N100,000, purchase more drinks to sell.  This is the high season for his business and he hopes to make more profits.  He says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Adelayda Beatriz

texts.es: Adelayda tiene 57 años, es madre soltera.  Tiene 1 hijo mayor de edad y trabaja de manera independiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de leña. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Ella tenía muchas dificultades, pero ella no se dio por vencida ya que en su comarca es un negocio muy rentable ya que la mayoría de las personas solicitan este producto que  es necesario para cocinar todos los días. Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así comprar materia prima que es necesaria para su actividad económica. Ella tiene el sueño de ella es mejorar su humilde vivienda porque tiene ciertos problemas cuando llueve por lo que le gustaría componerla.
texts.en:
Adelayda is 57 years old, she is a single mother. She has a grown child who works independently. She works selling firewood. For more than 4 years she has worked in this humble activity. She had many hardships, but she did not give up because in her region this is a profitable business because most people request this product which is necessary to cook every day. This is the reason she requests this financing for working capital so that she can buy the raw material necessary for her economic activity. She dreams of improving her humble home because she has some problems when it rains and she would like to fix that.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mercidia

texts.es: Mercidia tiene 58 años, es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos ya mayores de edad. La señora tiene 25 años de dedicarse de tener de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general, las cuales vende por encargos de forma ambulante. Ella empezó hace 7 años con este negocio, sin embargo en ese tiempo solamente vendía cosméticos porque no tenía el capital suficiente, después se fue haciendo su propio negocio con capital propia y hace 4 años logro trabajar por cuenta propia. Su negocio nace debido a la necesidad de empleo que actualmente acoge a nuestro país. Ahora cuenta con una gran variedad de clientes. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías, ya que actualmente tiene bastantes pedidos que le permitirán incrementar sus ganancias. Su sueño siempre ha sido mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mercidia is 58 years old and a single mother of six adult children. She has 25 years of experience selling general merchandise as a traveling merchant. She started this business seven years ago, but at the time, she was only selling cosmetics because she did not have sufficient capital. After establishing her business and raising enough capital over a period of four years, Mercidia was able to start working for herself. Her business emerged as a result of a lack of jobs throughout the country. She now encounters a wide variety of customers.

The loan she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of merchandise. She currently has enough orders to help increase earnings. Her dream is to always keep improving her living standards.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey S. is 57 years old. She was married many years ago to Mr. Choun Sour, age 60, and they both earn their daily income by growing rice. This old couple is blessed to five single children, all of whom work at different occupations. 

At the beginning of year, the rainy season for rice has recently passed and the dry season for rice is approaching. Srey S. lacks some essential supplies that she needs to grow a rice crop. Therefore, she has applied for a loan of $700 USD to buy fertilizers and crop seeds. In addition, she will use some of the loan to build a shop and begin selling groceries for extra profit.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and crop seeds.

loans.name: Nelma's Group

texts.en:
Nelma C. is from Pagadian City. She is 43 years old. Nelma is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nelma is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nelma owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nelma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Nelma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Nelma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Manet Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento MANET es un banco que trabaja con nuestra Institución hace varios años, el banco se caracteriza principalmente por tener socias que se dedican al comercio y servicios.

El Sr. RENÉ es presidente, es chofer asalariado y con el prestamo tiene pensado ahorrar para poder comprarse una movilidad y pasar a ser propietario, ya que en un futuro esta pensando tener una familia y brindarles estabilidad económica. 

La Sra. ROSSY  Es una joven participante esta a su cargo la secretaria, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, con el prestamo comprara perfumes, talcos y otros productos D. belleza D. promoción para despues poder vendrlos al precio original, lo que le a permitido ahorrar para continuar sus estudios D. farmacia y D. esta forma poder culminarlos. 

La Sra. MARIA Es una D. las socias fundadoras, es tesorera y se dedica a la atención D. su tienda, con el prestamo comprara varios productos para su tienda y D. esta manera diversificar sus productos, mejorando así sus ingresos.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamicas que en muchos casos tienen que sacar a sus familias solas, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Manet Communal Bank has been working with our Institution for a number of years. This Communal Bank is known primarily for having members who are engaged in the retail and service sectors.

Sr. René is the President and works as a salaried driver. With this loan, he plans to buy his own vehicle. For the future, he is thinking about having a family and providing them financial stability.

Sra. Rossy is a young member who holds the position of Secretary. She sells beauty products by catalog. With this loan, she will buy perfumes, talcum powders, and other products that are on sale which she will sell at regular price. This will allow her to save money so that she can continue her pharmacy studies and finish her degree.

Sra. Maria is the Treasurer and one of the founding members. She manages a store and will use her loan to buy various products so that she can diversify her inventory and improve her earnings.

All of the members are responsible and dynamic people who have to support their families, and in most cases, do it by themselves. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
La solicitante es de la ciudad de Yrybucua Quinta Linea Cerro Verde es soltera vive con sus padres, es propietaria de una despensa muy surtida con clientela bien formada.
Tiene buenos ingresos en su negocio, también tiene actividad agrícola con su padre, tiene plantación de mandioca, sésamo y maíz. 
     Solicita el préstamo para compra de mercaderías (fideos, harina, panificados, enlatados, embutidos, golosinas, azúcar) ya que se aproxima la época de la cosecha para poder aumentar sus ventas mensuales y para satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The applicant lives in the city of Yrybucua Quinta Linea Cerro Verde, is single and lives with her parents. She owns a grocery store which is well-stocked and has a steady clientele. The business brings in good income, but she also works at farming with her father, where they plant cassava, sesame and maize. Now the applicant is requesting this loan to purchase goods for the grocery store (noodles, flour, bakery products, canned food, sausages, candy, sugar) as it nears harvest time in order to increase her monthly sales and to meet the needs of each customer.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fideos, harina, panificados, enlatados, embutidos, golosinas, azúcar (to purchase noodles, flour, bakery goods, canned goods, beverages, candy and sugar)

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles C. C. de 49 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, capital del país. Vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar y su hija la cual al igual que su padre es empleada de una empresa privada y junto a ellos viven también tres nietos, todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa de habitación, el cual es una zona muy buena para su negocio, ya que es la única tienda que hay en los alrededores, así también cuenta con la ventaja de que haya un mercado de donde las vendedoras llegan a su tienda a comprar productos de primera necesidad. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, de manera que pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles C. C. is 49 years old. She lives in the township of Ilopango, which is located in the district of San Salvador, the capital of the country. She lives with her husband, who works, and her daughter, who, like her father, is an employee of a private business. Three grandchildren also live with them. They are all minors and are in school. Maria has a store that is located in her own house, which is in a very good location for her business, since it is the only store in the outskirts. She also has the advantage that there is a market, from which the vendors come to her store to buy basic products. Maria is applying for a loan so that she will have the money necessary to buy larger quantities of products, so that she can offer better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store

loans.name: Sriyani

texts.en:
Sriyani is a 38-year-old married woman living with her husband, one son and one daughter, in the southern Sri Lankan town of Telijjawilla. Her husband is a building contractor. They are very close and work well together. 

Sriyani manages a business of coir making, which consists of weaving coconut fibers into various household goods such as floor mats. Four months ago she started this business. She has a very positive mood and is enthusiastic about her business. 

She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy materials for the coir business

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz y Esperanza lo integran tres mujeres  trabajadoras, esforzadas  y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Rosa Amanda C. R. quien comercializa productos lácteos desde hace ocho años quien recuerda como si fuera ayer como del poco dinero que le quedaba de su salario empezó este negocio el cual con los prestamos ha ido aumentando y mejorando  su negocio.
Esta señora de 38 años madre de dos jóvenes de 20 y 18 y dos adolecentes  16 y 12 años respectivamente  los cuales estudian  tiene el sueño de agrandar su negocio y darle oportunidad a otras mujeres de superarse como ella lo ha hecho.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Martha Francisca M. F. quien en un inicio vendía frutas y verduras pero por medio de los préstamos actualmente distribuye cosméticos y perfumes y Ángela M.  la cual vende granos básicos y realiza reposterías.
texts.en:
The Light and Hope group is made up of three hard-working, enterprising women one of whom is Rosa Amanda C. R.. Rosa has sold dairy products for the past 8 years but remembers it as if it were yesterday; she started the business with the little money she had left over from her salary and with some loans she has grown and improved her business. She is 38 years old and the mother of 2 young adults (18 and 20 years old) and 2 teenagers (12 and 16 years old) who are all in school. She dreams of growing her business and giving other women the opportunity to overcome just as she has. The other women in the group are Martha Francisco M. F. who started selling fruits and vegetables but through loans now works as a distributor of cosmetics and perfumes, and Angela M. who sells basic grains and makes pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese, milk, curd, curdled milk, and cream

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
George W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Able. He is 67 years old, married and has 17 children who range from 6 to 38 years. He also cares for two siblings. He was only able to attend school through 7th grade due to financial difficulties.

For four years, he has been selling soap, candles, radio batteries, toothbrushes, toothpaste and powder in the Paynesville Community, Liberia. He sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan amount to purchase more radio batteries, soap, candles, toothpaste and toothbrushes. His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Rong

texts.en:
Rong N., 53, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. She is a housewife while her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day.

N. is requesting a loan of USD 350 to repair her house. In the future, she would like to raise some pigs at home. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married with six children: two have finished school and four are still going to school. She has been operating her firewood and charcoal business for three years and sells from her home to her neighbors.
