With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to buy a bundle of firewood and two sacks of charcoal. Mejumaa's other source of income is her husband's earnings.


The major challenges in her business are the high cost of transportation and theft. In the future, she hopes to run a wholesale shop and to increase her profits.


She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business.  Mejumaa owns a home with electricity but no piped water. Her major challenge is food.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of charcoal and a bundle of firewood.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: G. Charlotte est née le 01 Novembre 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Charlotte vit depuis sa naissance à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à SOHOU Dieudonné, un menuisier, Charlotte est mère d'un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé. Charlotte vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Charlotte n'est jamais allée à l'école, mais a appris la coiffure. Parallèlement, Charlotte vend dans son salon de coiffure, des mèches, des papiers d'emballage et divers autres produits cosmétiques. Charlotte exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Charlotte achète ses produits. En vue d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle, Charlotte sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit.
texts.en:
Ms. G. Charlotte was born on November 1, 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Since birth, she has lived in Agblangandan, in the community of Sèmè-Podji.  Married to Mr. SOHOU Dieudonné, a carpenter, she is the mother of one child who is not yet in school.  Charlotte lives together with her husband and child.  The couple jointly provide for their family. Charlotte never went to school but has learned how to style hair.  Concurrently, she sells hair extensions, wrapping paper, and a variety of cosmetics in her hair salon.  She has been in this business for five years.  She purchases her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  To expand her business and increase her customer base, Charlotte is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: To make a living, Teofila P. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 57 years old, married and has six school-age children. They are from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. Teofila has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Teofila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Teofila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Teofila is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Helene is 39 years old and a mother of 5 children, aged 6, 10, 11, 12, and 14 years.  All of her children are in school.  She is recently divorced, and is proud that she is still able to afford health insurance for the entire family.

Helene runs a business buying crops from farmers and sells the produce locally. Each day she sells in a different market.She has been conducting this business for over 6 years and has become well known in each market where she works. With the loan, she hopes to increase the amount of crops she can buy and invest the profits into developing her business.  

Helene eventually wants to become a wholesaler and sell to the local retailers in each of the markets. She also plans to start selling to government workers in the area.  She also wants to increase the variety of crops she buys and sells.  If business goes well, she plans to pay off her loan as quickly as possible to be able to qualify for a larger loan.  Eventually she hopes to buy a truck to transport her goods.

loans.use: Buying food crops for resale

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: E. Jeanne est née en 1979 à Houngomè au Bénin et est mariée à DEGAN Jespère, un boucher. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Depuis une dizaine d'année, la famille s'est installée à PK11, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Jeanne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Jeanne  vend des boissons par le système de distribution. Jeanne s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est depuis huit ans que Jeanne exerce cette activité. La clientèle de Jeanne s'agrandit de plus en plus, et Jeanne voudrait renforcer plus son activité pour mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle et se faire plus de profits ; raison pour laquelle Jeanne sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé. Son premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Jeanne E. was born in 1979 in Houngomé, Benin and is married to Jespère Degan, a butcher. They have five children, all of whom are in school. For about 10 years, the family has lived in PK11, in the Sèmè-Podji commune in Benin. Jeanne never went to school. In order to meet her needs, as well as those of her family, Jeanne sells beverages through the distribution system. Jeanne gets her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Jeanne has been doing this for 8 years. Jeanne's customer base has been growing more and more, and she would like to improve her business so she can meet her customers' demands better and make more money. This is why she is requesting her second loan through ALIDé. Her first loan was repaid in full.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages

loans.name: Johana Del Socorro

texts.es: Johanna tiene 40 años su actividad es una pulpería y también la venta de recargas telefónica. Ella es una persona muy responsable lo ha demostrado pagando sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues han sido muy importantes.  El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y ampliar su negocio para ofréceles a sus clientes sus diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Johanna, 40, has a grocery store and also sells cards loaded with phone call minutes. She is a person who has demonstrated responsibility by making her payments on time and in full. This is not the first time that she has taken a loan, and these loans have been very important to her. This loan is to buy merchandise such as snacks, soft drinks, juices, detergents and staple grains. She dreams of improving her income and expanding her business so that she can offer her customers a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy snacks, soft drinks, detergents and staple grains for her store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. After the death of her husband, she decided to take on the operation of his land by herself and continue her husband’s agriculturA. business. She used to help him, and that’s why she had the experience to do it. Two of her children help her with the family expenses and she has one child who is still attending school. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow US$ 1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase agriculture supplies such as fertilizer and seeds for the coming harvest. In the future, she hopes to continue her business properly and continue earning a good income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase agriculture supplies such as fertilizer and seeds for the coming harvest

loans.name: Ko'eju Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio kennedy de la ciudad de Caacupé. 
Son Señoras muy unidas, ya hace aproximadamente 6 a7 años que están dentro del programa, realizan constantes actividades juntas, de ese modo ahorran y también cuentan con una caja chica que les sirve como garantía para cualquier inconveniente que se presente.
Ellas están muy agradecidas con la Fundación y Kiva, por la oportunidad y por las contantes capacitaciones que reciben. 
Gracias al programa, aprendieron a ahorrar, trabajar en equipo, y crear fuentes de ingresos, que les ayudan al sustento de sus hogares, ya que algunas son cabezas de familia.
Una de las integrantes quien es muy trabajadora y activa para las actividades que realiza el comité es la señora Gloria.
Ella es comerciante desde hace varios años, y es la abastecedora de los productos de primera necesidad del barrio. 
La señora  Gloria tiene una familia muy unida, y se ayudan mutuamente en todas las actividades que realizan y de esta manera la familia sale adelante de la mejor manera posible. 
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su negocio ya que en ocasiones también tiene clientes que solicitan las mercaderías a crédito y los pagan de manera mensual o quincenal, y necesita para comprar, arroz, aceite, fideos, enlatados, lácteos, panificados, embutidos, yerba mate, productos de limpieza.
texts.en:
The women in this group are from the Kennedy neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. These united women have already been in this program for about 6 to 7 years. They regularly pursue activities together. They not only save their money, but they also have a savings account, which they use as a guarantee against any unforeseen obstacles that arise. They are very thankful for Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for this opportunity and for the constant training they receive. Thanks to the program, they learn to save, work in teams, and create sources of income that help their support their families since some of these women are heads of households. 

Gloria is a very hard-working and active member of the group. She has been a businesswoman for many years, and she supplies necessary goods for her neighborhood. Mrs. Gloria has a very close family, and they help to support each other. In this way, her family goes forward in the best way possible. At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business because sometimes her clients buy goods on credit. They repay her monthly or twice monthly. With this loan, she will buy rice, oil, noodles, canned goods, dairy products, baked goods, cured meat, mate leaves (used as a substitute for tea), and cleaning products.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, noodles, canned goods, dairy products, baked goods, mate leaves, and cleaning products

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl P. is 32 years old, married, and supports her family by operating two business ventures:  Buying and Selling (pigs) and Pig-Fattening businesses. She lives in Brgy. La Paz, Bogo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Buying and Selling (pigs) and Pig-Fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Cheryl is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to  fund the operations of her piggery.  This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Cheryl aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

 About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operation of her piggery

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
The four members of this group loan located in Preaek Ta Ong Ti Muoy village in Kandal province, have been selected Mrs. Kong C. T., 40 years old, to be the group leader. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Kong C. T. is a mat weaver who earns some money to support her family while her husband, Mr. Thoeun Men, is a construction worker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand.  To improve this business, Mrs. Kong C. T. is applying for a loan to buy raw material to make mats. 

She is a mother of six children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, one is living in Japan, and the others are attending in public school.

loans.use: To buy raw material to make mat

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
62 year old Doris hails from Kisii Town in Western Kenya. She has been doing mixed farming for 30 years, selling her produce of milk, beans, potatoes, vegetables and tea to the local market and government.

She has requested this loan of 45,000 KES to purchase and feed a dairy cow.She hopes the income generated will enable her put up a business premise.The added milk she will be a source of family food too. She is planning to have five dairy cows of good quality and purchase land for farming.

Her challenges remain price fluctuation and animal diseases.

loans.use: Purchase and maintain a dairy cow

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For over ten years, she has been selling clothes from home. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanasha faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to sell wholesale in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
En la zona Nororiental de Medellín-Colombia, situado en terrenos de moderadas y altas pendientes, se encuentra ubicado el barrio “Manrique La Cruz”, conformado por familias campesinas que llegaron a la ciudad, a causa del desplazamiento al que se vieron sometidas. Y es allí donde se encuentra la microempresa de Luz Mery P. D. quien desde hace dos años decidió hacer de la tradicional arepa su sustento familiar. 

Las arepas de Luz Mery son hechas al carbón lo que le da mejor sabor y hace que sus clientes las prefieran. Estar en pie desde las 5:00 a.m. para iniciar las ventas y soportar el calor que genera el asador y que le produce dolor en sus manos no ha sido impedimento para salir adelante y continuar con su negocio.  

Como emprendedora y gran visionaria, Luz Mery, sueña con ampliar su negocio hasta tener un restaurante reconocido en el barrio y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The Manrique La Cruz neighborhood is located in the northeast area of Medellin-Colombia.  It is situated among even fields and high slopes.  The neighborhood is comprised of country people who came to the city because of the forced displacement they were subjected to.

This is where the small businesswoman, Luz Mery P. D., can be found.    Two years ago she decided to make the traditional “arepa” (flat bread served with various fillings or toppings) to support her family.

Luz Mery cooks the arepas over charcoal.  This gives them better flavor and her customers prefer her arepas.  She is on her feet starting at 5:00 a.m. in order to begin the sales and to bear the heat generated from the roaster.  This causes pain in her hands, but it has not been an impediment to getting ahead and continuing with her business.

As an entrepreneur and a great visionary, Luz Mery dreams of expanding her business until she has a well-known neighborhood restaurant.  That way she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: Adaptation of the business and to buy ingredients

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
M. Habib is a diligent and tenacious farmer, who strives to meet his family’s needs. His wife does not work and thus, he carries the financial burden alone, through his farming income, to meet his family’s needs. Habib works on a 1-hectare farm owned by his parents. His harvests are sometimes not maximized because his cultivation method and seeds are not the best. Better farming supplies, seeds and fertilizer require a larger capital, which he lacks. 

Habib is now relieved that IMON International is helping him to get the loan that he needs to improve his farming. This loan will be used to buy superior seeds, organic fertilizers and pesticides. Habib is waiting for his next harvest, which he hopes will yield better results than his previous harvests. He will use his farming income to support his children’s educational needs. If there is still some money left, he really hopes to fix his unfinished house.      
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand  her business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 29 year-old single man from Bint Jbeil.  He has worked in furniture painting for 11 years. He opened his own business in 2001.  Hassan is still young and energetic, he can do more than he's doing now, but his financial situation stops him from buying necessary tools for his business. Hassan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a generator and new tools for his business. This isn't Hassan's first time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua.  His previous loan was helpful and he was a borrower in good standing.  He hopes to expand his business to start manufacturing and painting furniture.

loans.use: To buy a generator and new tools

loans.name: Sean's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members, all residents of Kbal Kaoh Touch village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Sean S., a married woman born in 1982, is the group leader selected by the other members. Her husband, Mr. Chhorm Vorn, is a construction worker who is able to earn a small salary to help support his family. The couple has two children, both yet too young to attend school.

Sean earns her living by selling fish and vegetables in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand and is therefore requesting a loan to buy more fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 46 años, es viuda y vive con sus  3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 17 años realiza las tareas agrícolas con ayuda de sus hijos que en ese entonces eran unos niños. Hoy posee varias cabezas de reses y ovejas. Además cuenta con algunos terrenos donde cultiva hortalizas, papa y quinua, y que son vendidos a sus vecinos y en el centro de la ciudad. Para ella es indispensable ambas actividades y casi todo su tiempo se dedica a ello, cuidando que sus animales estén bien alimentados, así como evitar que los insectos no perjudiquen sus cultivos. Ella anhela seguir intensificándose en estas actividades y  mejorar la raza de sus vacas. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita,  comprará sacos  de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra y también  comprará verduras al por mayor.
texts.en: Flor is 46 years old.  She is a widow and lives in her own house with her 3 children.  For the last 17 years, she has done agricultural work with the help of her children, who were young children when they started.  Now she has several heads of cattle and sheep.  She also has some land where she grows vegetables, potatoes, and quinoa, which are sold to her neighbors and in the city center.  For her, both activities are indispensable, and she spends almost all her time on them, making sure the animals are well-fed and ensuring insects do not damage her crops.  She longs to continue becoming stronger in these activities and to improve the breed of her cows.  This is her third credit with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments.  She is also happy to be part of her communal bank because all of its members are responsible and very supportive people.  She thanks the people who will arrange the loan she is asking for.  It will be very useful to her in the progress of her business.  With the loan, she will buy bags of fertilizer for her next sowing season, and she will also buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en: Vy C., 24, resides in Battambong province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. C. operates a beauty salon, earning an income of 6 USD per day. Each month, her family has to spend 45 USD on food and 25 USD on other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more products to expand the offerings at her beauty salon. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 25 year old single woman, living and working in Tayouneh. She owns a cosmetics sales shop, and is willing to add new products such as for babies and infants. She opened her business 2 years ago, and is working hard on improving it. Faten is a woman with a good reputation of being honest and a hard worker.

She is requesting a loan for the first time from A. Majmoua, in order to add Disney cosmetics that attract children while visiting her shop with their moms. Faten hopes to expand her business through adding new products, and wants to succeed in this new small step in order to make a wider step soon in the future. Most of her customers are friends and neighbors, and she dreams of opening a bigger shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy children's and infants' cosmetics.

loans.name: Grupo Brisas 3, 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
PauL. belongs to the “Grupo Brisas 3, 4, 5 & 6” (Breezes Group). The group is comprised of 20 members. Each one of them works day to day at their business activities. They do this in an area with scant resources in the city of Santo Domingo. The group is located to the north of the city. They mostly sell clothes, footwear, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products.

PauL.’s family is maD. up of her five children and their parents. This young mother has been very dedicated to her work - it is one of her most favorite things to do - and to attending church. She does this to help her children be able to get ahead, become professionals, get an education, and to proviD. for their family's needs, by helping to bring extra incoming to home. Her most difficult challenge is to have their own home.

PauL.’s business is selling bacon, beef, chicken and pork. She prepares the meat in order to sell for a better price. Also, she makes local sausages with these different meats. She has been in this business for four years. She tells us that she started thanks to motivation from her aunt, who was doing the same, and she introduced PauL. to her meat supplier and recommended her for a credit client. Then, PauL. was able to apply for loans from Esperanza, and she was able to invest almost two years ago. PauL. has now had three loans with Esperanza Internacional. She is very grateful because she has been able to move forward, and she has been able to invest in her business. She will use this new loan to buy several pounds of different meats.

This group has two photos because there were too many to be in just one, and we try to have the most visible faces by having two photos

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef and pork

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora María Graciela P. F. vive en la ciudad de Ibarra, tiene 49 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos. Graciela tiene un puesto de venta de comida en el mercado de la localidad desde hace 20 años y una de sus hijas le ayuda a trabajar. 
Al principio su local era arrendado y vendía solo desayunos, luego empezó a servir almuerzos y ahora también vende meriendas. Luego de muchos años de trabajo y esfuerzo pudo comprar el local y ahora es de su propiedad, por lo que esta vez solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio y con las ganancias poder comprar el local que está junto al suyo para que su hija trabaje en éste. Los planes a futuro de Graciela es terminar de construir su casa y poder brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. María Graciela P. F. lives in the city of Ibarra. She is 49 years old and a single mother with three children. Graciela has a food stand at the local market, where she has worked for 20 years. One of her daughters helps with the business.

At first, she rented her space and only served breakfast. Later she started preparing lunches and now sells afternoon snacks as well. After many years of hard work and effort, she was able to buy her space and now it is her property. Graciela is requesting a loan to invest her business and use her earnings to buy the adjacent space so that her daughter can work there. Her plans for the future are to finish the construction of her house and provide her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in supplies for her food stand.

loans.name: Belquis

texts.es: Belquis  con 33 años de edad y desde el año 1995 vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 15 años; ella inició con una tienda en el barrio San Roque durante 8 años, que posteriormente trasladó al barrio Carrizal, donde ahora está ubicada con su familia,  y trabajó con su esposo allí durante 5 años, pero finalmente decidió dedicarse a la venta de mercancías, diferente al negocio de tienda, pues actualmente le genera mayor tiempo para atender su vida familiar. En la actualidad tiene planes de aumentar su capital de trabajo y esta es justamente la razón por la cual se acerca a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  e  iniciar su historial crediticio mediante su credikiva, con el cual comprará productos de tocador, de belleza, camisetas ropa para dormir e interior, todo esto ya encargado por sus clientes, lo cual augura  una rápida rotación de sus productos. Su meta más adelante  es tener un local y vender en este punto, sillas, mecedores diversificando su actividad y buscando hacer crecer su negocio para generar mejores ingresos que le permitan cumplir su principal sueño que es el ver a sus hijos en un futuro como profesionales de mucho éxito y mientras estructura este sueño, Belquis continua sosteniendo su negocio con una rentabilidad no menor de un 38% que muy seguramente incrementará mediante un trabajo disciplinado y persistente, como el que ella suele realizar día a día.
texts.en:
33-year old Belquis has lived with her husband and three children aged 1 to 15 in the town of Barranquilla since 1995. At first she had a store in the neighbourhood of San Roque for eight years, and then moved to the Carrizal neighbourhood where she and her family are now located. She worked there with her husband for five years.

Then finally she decided to sell goods that were different to those she sold in the store. This change also gives her more time to spend with her family. Currently Belquis has plans to expand her business so she has approached Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to begin 
the loan process. She will use the money to buy toiletries, beauty products, t-shirts, nightclothes, and underwear all of which have already been ordered by her customers. This augurs well for a quick turnover of merchandise.

Belquis’s goal in the future is to open a store and sell different kinds of chairs including rocking chairs in order to diversify and earn more money. This will enable her to fulfill her greatest dream: to see her children get good jobs and be successful. While she is working towards this dream, Belquis is continuing to tend her business and ensure a profit of at least 38%. She is sure to exceed this goal as she is disciplined and determined in all that she does.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, beauty products, t-shirts, nightclothes, and underwear

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una pequeña comerciante, tiene su propio negocio, una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos, también palmea tortilla, pues así es que ha venido creciendo y aumentando su capital, teniendo el apoyo económico de su esposo, el cual labora como cadete de taxi, y con el financiamiento ha logrado introducir más ventas, en productos de consumo, ya que es lo que demanda la clientela.
De sus tres hijos, uno es independiente, y los otros cursan el año escolar. Como madre está feliz por poder dar  a sus hijos una buena educación.
Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en compras de granos básicos: quintales de arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, bidón de aceite, cajas de jabón de lavar y de baño entre otros productos que satisfaga al cliente.
texts.en: Carmen is a small business woman who runs her own business, a pulpería [small grocery store] where she sells a variety of products. She also makes tortillas by hand. Her business has been growing and she has been increasing her capital. She has the economic support of her husband, who works as a taxi driver. With the help of previous loans, she has been able to increase sales of consumable goods, which is what her customers demand. Of her three children, one is independent and the others are enrolled in school. As a mother, she is happy to be able to give her children a good education. With this new loan, she will be able to buy staple items like rice, sugar, corn, beans, a drum of oil, boxes of soap for cleaning and bathing, and other products to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy staple items like rice, beans, corn, and sugar, in order to improve her sales

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Marites has a food shop that sells viands like afritada & caldereta. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking a variety of dishes.

Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking a variety of dishes

loans.name: Martha Magdalena

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Magdalena  ella es trabajadora activa del Ministerio de Salud desempeñándose como Técnico Quirúrgico tiene  treinta  años de trabajar para esta institución es soltera actualmente. Ha obtenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como,  Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha Magdalena is an employee of the Ministry of Health where she has worked as a surgical technician for 30 years. She is currently single. Martha has received two loans with CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, and other supplies to expand and improve her home.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit and have enabled her to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, stone, gravel, and other supplies for home improvements.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en: Prey Chor is a district in Kompong Cham Province. Most of the people who live there are able to make an income from farming. Mrs. Huy, age 49, is a widow and the mother of three children. Two of her children are single and depend on her and one of them is a sewing worker who is employed as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She inherited a piece of farmland from her grandparents years ago. In addition, she hopes to grow various crops on her own land. Due to the lack of money, Mrs. Huy decided to seek a loan to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizer and other supplies to begin a farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other supplies

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi, in the Gulu region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. All of her children are currently in school. Sarah has a business of selling produce, like maize flour and beans, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase maize and beans for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food for her family. In the future, Sarah hopes to expand her business. Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving in her capital.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Eduardo Giovanny

texts.es:
Eduardo Giovanny tiene 21 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con la hija, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE, se encuentra ubicada recinto EL ROSARIO, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol.

Eduardo Giovanny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Guzman en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol, para la compra de abonos y semillas para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es superarse y trabajar mas para poder comprar un carro y una finca. 

Le gusta salir a pasear con la familia y Se considera una persona emprendedora y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Eduardo Giovanny is 21 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughter in the Canton of Ventanas, located in the Province of Los Ríos.

The members of the San José Communal Bank are located in the El Rosario precinct belonging to the Canton of Ventanas. They work in short-cycle agriculture and grow corn, rice and beans.

Eduardo Giovanny works growing corn, rice and beans. He makes his purchases at the Guzmán shopping center in Ventanas and sells his products at the Ventanas wholesale market.

He is requesting the loan so that he can plant corn, rice and beans. He will purchase manure and seeds. The loan will help him financially to meet his needs. He faces difficulties such as pests and crop diseases. His dream is to get ahead and work more in order to be able to buy a car and a farm.

He likes to go out with his family and considers himself to be an enterprising and hardworking person.

loans.use: to plant corn, rice and beans with the purchase of manure and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Martha Johanna

texts.es: Martha Johanna tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. La señora se dedica al negocio de la a la venta de mercadería en general.  No es la primera vez que solicita crédito pues son destinados para su negocio.  Tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, pues siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de ropa, cosméticos, calzado, bolsos, prendas, billeteras entre otros.
texts.en: Martha Johanna is 39 years old, married, and has two underage children.  She sells general merchandise.  This is not the first time she has applied for loans for her business.  She has worked in this business for 5 years, and is always aware of what her customers want.  The loan will be invested in buying clothes, cosmetics, shoes, handbags, jewelry, wallets and more.

loans.use: buy clothes, cosmetics, shoes, handbags, jewelry, wallets and more.

loans.name: Saidjafar

texts.ru: Саиджафар проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его дети не работают. Сам Саиджафар занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется магазин, где он продает музыкальные диски. Этим видом деятельности он занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки DVD и MP3 дисков.
texts.en: Saidjafar lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 43 years old, married and has four children.  His children do not work.  Saidjafar is involved in sales at the market.  He has a store, where he sells music disks.  He has been involved in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of DVD and MP3 disks.

loans.use: to purchase DVD and MP3 disks

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Rogelia es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generacion 2000” del distrito Ilave, en el departamento Puno y tiene 26 años. Ella y su pareja tienen una hija de 5 años.
Tiene un pequeño puesto en un mercado de la zona donde vende pollos. Fue idea de la familia de establecer este negocio, esto ya desde hace un año. 
Inició con un capital de S./ 1,500.00.  Con este nuevo préstamo de S./ 500.00 comprará pollos al por mayor.

Su sueño es que su negocio sea cada vez más grande.  Lo que le gusta de su banco comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Rogelia is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Generacion 2000” in the district of Llave in the department of Puno. She is 26 years old and has a 5 year old daughter with her partner.

She has a small stall in the market where she sells chickens. It was her family's idea to start this business a year ago.

She started the business with a capital of S./1,500.00 (PEN). With this new loan of S./500.00 (PEN) she is going to buy chickens in bulk.

Her dream is for her business to get bigger. What she likes about her communal bank is the savings.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en: Adelfa is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Adelfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa tiene 49 años, ella sabe que cada día tiene brindarle a su familia el alimento diario. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, a pesar de que se ha enfermado ha salido a vender sus productos pues lo hace de manera ambulante y en su vivienda en donde ciertos vecinos saben que ella ofrece estos productos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de lápiz labial, perfumes, polvos, pintura de uñas, ropa interior, shampoo, cremas entre otros.
texts.en: Ana Rosa is 49 years old and knows that every day she must put food on the table for her family.  Her business is selling cosmetics.  In spite of the fact that she has been ill, she has still gone out to sell her products.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor and also sells from her home where certain neighbors know that she offers these products.  Her goal with this loan is to buy lipsticks, perfumes, powders, nail polish, underwear, shampoo, creams and other products.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, perfumes, powders, nail polish, underwear, shampoo, creams, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is 55 years old and lives in the village of Guba Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her husband and 10 children. She and her husband earn a living by growing corn, and generate about PHP 5,900 in income per crop. She has been in this line of work for more than 12 years and is applying for a PHP 3,000 loan from GDMPC to buy two sacks of fertilizer for her next crop. Her goal for the future is to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to use on her farm.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 48-year-old business lady. She is married to Joseph, who is a businessman. They are blessed with five children ages 20, 16, 13 and 9 years respectively. Jennifer has been in the farming business for the past 5 years with a monthly income of 30,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her fourth loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Jennifer will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Jennifer's hope and dream is to venture into keeping livestock which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nieves; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia también se dedica a la venta de artesanía ella lleva a lugares como Machupicchu y también vende maíz en el mercado de Urubamba, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de comida, venta de maíz y venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor y también para comprar artesanía y productos para cocinar como arroz, carne y pollo.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA”, located in the district and province of Urubamba, in the department of Cuzco. 

The borrower is Señora Nieves. She is 52 years old and is married with 5 children. Her work varies from day to day, between her business selling food, selling handicrafts at tourist sites such as Machu Picchua, and selling maize in the market in Urubamba. She has brought up her children on what she earns from these businesses, and wishes to expand all three. She is seeking the loan to buy maize, in bulk, and also to buy handicrafts and ingredients for cooking, such as rice, meat and chicken. 

She is happy at being granted a loan and vows to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk, and also to buy crafts and ingredients for cooking such as rice, meat and chicken.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca’s family is her motivational guide, and she works hard to give them a better quality of life. She supports her family by doing something that brings additional income and allows her to support her children. She has had a retail store based in their home for ten years. The daily net profit of 300 PHP is just enough to cover the cost of the family's daily meals. 

To improve her income in the store, Rebecca is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional stock of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients. Rebecca says the loan will be very helpful in the success of her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.en:
Basilo’s priority in life is to make his family more economically stable. He is 53 years old and married to Candilaria. The couple was blessed with six children who are grown, wherein they are already helping him in their source of income.

He has planted and harvested rice for more than 20 years. He usually earns about PHP 10,000 every six months and he wishes to earn higher than his past profits. With his low profits, his family still feels financial constraints due to the high cost of daily necessities.

He needs to improve his crop production to grant his priority, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, pesticides and insecticides to ensure good crop production. He wants to increase the sales of his crops in order to provide a good and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and insecticides to ensure good crop production.

loans.name: José Manfredo

texts.es:
José es un joven padre de familia de 23 años de edad, vive junto a su conviviente y su menor hijo en el caserío Paccha del distrito de Chulucanas, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la región Piura, a más de tre horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. 

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza de ganado ovino y porcino, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Adicionalmente es albañil, trabajando en las obras del caserío y ganando por día de trabajo. Con estos ingresos el trata de solventar la economía de su familia.

José se encuentra solicitando 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento y medicinas para sus animales, de modo que pueda asegurar la estabilidad de su negocio.

José es un cliente nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
José is a young head of the family, 23 years old, who lives with his common-law wife and his young son in the village of Paccha in the district of Chulucanas, in an agricultural area located in the Piura region, about 3-1/2 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

His work is breeding sheep and pigs, which he successfully fattens to the ideal size and weight to sell them in the local market. In addition, he is a bricklayer, working on jobs in the village and being paid each day he works. With this income he tries to meet the family expenses.

José is asking for 1000 soles as he wants to invest in the purchase of feed and medicine for his animals, so that he can be certain of the stability of his business.

José is a new client for Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for his animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise and expand her business.

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru: Махфират проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Она замужем. Ей 27 лет. У нее трое детей. Ее муж занимается торговлей фруктов. Сама Махфират занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области она три года. Кредит берет для закуп телят.
texts.en: Makhfirat lives in the Tursun-zoda.  She is 27 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband is involved in selling fruits.  Makhfirat is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds livestock for future sale.  She has been in this field for three years.  Makhfirat is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock.

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Aged approximately 40 years old, Mr. Komi A. is maried and a father of seven children. Abandoning his studies, he quickly became an apprentice in bricklaying. He also raises local chickens in order to provide for his family's needs.

Very active, he is planning to multiply and strengthen his revenue sources by a loan of $750 which would allow him to buy a better breed of local chicken as well as products to treat these chicken when they become sick. With the profits he is already envisioning, he is hoping to contribute more to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 40 ans environs, Monsieur A. Komi est marié et père de sept (07) enfants. Abandonnant ses études, il s’est vite lancé dans l’apprentissage de la maçonnerie. Il associé à son métier l’agriculture et l’éleveur traditionnel des poules locales pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Très actif, dans ses affaires, il compte multiplier et renforcer ses sources de revenus par un crédit de $750 qui servira à l’achat des poules locales et de race améliorée ainsi que les produits de traitement d’éventuelle maladie. Par ces revenus qui pointent déjà à l’horizon, il espère contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy a better breed of local chickens and improve their care

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu fled to Baku in 1993 from the occupied Zangilan district of Azerbaijan. She is married with two children. She and her husband (in the photo) started their business in 2000, and borrowed two Normicro loans from the Baku branch totaling $900. Now they would like to borrow $1000 to expand the store inventory.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods in the store

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov Khum is 53 years old and lives with her husband and 6 children in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband make their living by purchasing mango from someone’s plantation and reselling them to the wholesalers and retailers at a market--together, they earn an average of $3 each day. This kind of income is barely enough to support her entire family, but she has a client base. Nov Khum needs a loan to to invest in her market stall by purchasing as many mango as she can afford to meet her clients’ needs. In the future, if she makes enough, she would like to purchase a car to help in her business.

loans.use: To purchase many mango for her market stall

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
MARIA is 25 years old; she’s single and lives with her parents. She helps her parents by making clothes, table clothes and napkins; she then embroiders them and sells them to the tourists on the streets of San Cristobal, Chiapas. She belongs to the group Escuela 4 along with Mrs. Maria Jimenez L. (artisan), they will both use the loan to invest in their business by buying fabric and embroidery floss to make a larger number of embroidery items and therefore gain more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA , tiene 25 años , es soltera y vive con sus papas y los ayuda confeccionando prendas de vestir , manteles , servilletas y luego las borda y sale a vender por las calles de la ciudad de San Cristóbal a los turistas que frecuentan el lugar .. Pertenece al grupo Escuela 4 junto con doña Maria Jiménez López (artesana), ambas invertirán el préstamo comprando telas , hilos de bordar para confeccionar mayor cantidad de prendas artesanales y así obtener mas ganancias

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Alina

texts.en: Alina, 68 years old, is living with her five children and her husband’s two sons. She has been selling shoes, tennis shoes, boots and pants for more than 20 years. Her husband works as a watchman at a golf camp. In spite of her age, she continues selling her products. She can no longer walk into the streets to sell the goods; however, she operates business in her house.  Alina had already taken a loan from our organization. She used it wisely and repaid it.  Now, Alina is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes and jeans in order to satisfy her customers’ needs. That way, Alina will help her husband attend to the needs of their very large and needy family.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy shoes, tennis shoes, and pants, in order to supply the entrepreneur's business. Currently, those goods are running out in the business.

loans.name: Oygul

texts.en: Oygul is married. She is selling small goods in the Spitamen central market. You can always purchase necessary goods from Oygul. Business is from her family income. Now she plans to increase the turnover of business and is asking for a new loan.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Manuela De Jesús

texts.es:
For the past 10 years, in the city of Managua in the Israel Lewites market, Mrs. Manuela Martinez has worked at the sale of costume jewelry such as cufflinks, chains and accessories. These are sold from very early in the morning until the late afternoon.

It is necessary to point out that Mrs. Manuela is a single mother with the responsibility of supporting her three children, give them an education and feed them every day. In spite of this situation she has acted very wisely in acquiring credits with Ceprodel for the past two years, which have caused an impact on her sales by increasing them and she has acquired more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 10 años en la ciudad de Managua en el mercado Israel Lewites la señora Manuela Martinez se dedica a la venta de bisuterías tales como collares, colas y prendas. Estas son vendidas desde muy temprano por la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Manuela es madre soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos dándoles educación y el pan de cada día. A pesar de esta situación ella ha actuado muy sabiamente al adquirir créditos con Ceprodel desde hace 2 años los cuales le han causado un impacto en sus ventas al haberlas incrementado y adquirido mas mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise - Compra de mercaderia

loans.name: Orosta

texts.ru:
Orosat is 46 years old, she is married and has 6 children. She owns a family bakery that makes Tajik bread. All members of her family work there and help to earn money for family needs. Orosta with her two daughters prepares dough for baking. One of her sons makes a fire in the tanur (oven). You can see Orosat's son Olim and the tanur in the photo. Her sons Olim and Tohir are responsible for baking bread in the tanur and her husband sells the bread in the food market in Dushanbe,Tajikistan.

Today Orosta's bread is in demand among customers and every day she gets a lot of orders from canteens and cafes. We can say that she is one of the successful clients of MicroInvest. Orosat would like to borrow $600 which she will pay back over 6 months via KIVA. She will spend this money to purchase the next batch of flour for her bakery.

Edited by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Orosat is women of 46,married and has 6 children.She has family bakery of national bread.All members of her family work here and help to earn money for family needs.Orosta with her two daughter prepare from flour bread for bake.One of her son makes fire in the tanur(where bread is processing to ready porduct,You can see tanur in the picture and Orosta's son Olim)Her sons Olim and Tohir are responsible for baking bread in tanur.And her husband sells bread in the food market,Dushanbe,Tajikistan. Today Orosta's bread is in good demand among popultion and every day she gets a lot of orders from many canteens and cafes.We can say that she is one of the success client of our organization. In KIVA she wishes to take part with request of 2000TJS for 6 months,which she wants to spend for buying next batch of flour and goal for bakery.

loans.use: Purchase flour

loans.name: Jovita Elena

texts.es:
Jovita Elena es socia del banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. A la par que labora como profesora en un Centro Educativo comparte su tiempo junto a su esposo en las labores de fabricación y venta de ladrillos, de variados tipos y de muy buena calidad por lo que son muy pedidos en la zona. El negocio se ubica  en el sector El Bombonaje parte alta de la ciudad de Juanjui.

El préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará leña en grandes cantidades, construirá mas galpones para el secado de los ladrillos, además gasolina para la maquina mezcladora de los insumos y parte del pago del personal porque la elaboración es manual.

Jovita tiene 34 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos varones que aún están estudiando. Ella es una mujer muy perseverante, segura de si misma y con muchas ganas de superación, actualmente también está estudiando una segunda carrera de Idiomas, siendo un ejemplo para su familia y amistades.

loans.use: Compra de lenña, gasolina para mezcladora, pago de personal, ampliación de local

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.es:
Raimundo and his beloved wife have immersed themselves in agriculture since they were very young. When they got married and first wanted to start a family they decided that agriculture would be the family's main source of sustenance. Every day they work together with the dream of realizing their children's dreams. They also dream of becoming the best farm workers in the area and have decided to improve their work with better seeds and fertilizers that will help them reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

RAIMUNDO y su querida esposa desde muy pequeños han estado inmersos en las labores agrícolas, cuando decidieron unirse para conformar su propia familia decidieron hacer de esta actividad la principal fuente de su sustento familia. Juntos día a día se desempeñan con el deseo de ayudar a concretar los deseos de sus queridos hijos, también sueñan en convertirse en los mejores agricultores de su zona y han deseado iniciar su labor con la compra de mejores semillas, abonos y fertlizantes que contribuirán a alcanzar la meta que se han trazado.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sopheak Say Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheak S. is a tailor in Prey Khmer Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 27 and the group leader of a group of five members. She is a single mother with two children who are too young to work or study. Her household relies on her business. At present she does not have enough money to buy fabric to make clothes for her customers. She has never obtained a loan before; she now asked for a loan to buy fabric in order to be able to improve the service she can offer to her customers.

loans.use: These women would like to buy fabric to make clothes.

loans.name: Rosa Ilda

texts.es:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30341&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Rosa is a member of the Community Bank Nobleza.

Rosa cohabits with her partner: she is aged 36 and has three children. Rosa sells construction materials such as sand, bricks and she also produces artesanal bricks in the district of Pacaycasa, undertaking the firing of the bricks in a hired oven: her products are delivered to homes according to order.

Rosa needs a loan of 1600 sols, money which will be invested in the purchase of firewood which will be used to fire the bricks.

Her savings will be used to make home improvements.

Rosa’s dream is to purchase a car to transport her products in, expand her business and see her children become professionals.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30341&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.

Rosa es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Rosa vende materiales de construcción como arena, ladrillos y también se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en el distrito de Pacaycasa y el quemado lo realiza en un horno alquilado, sus productos son repartidos a domicilio según pedido.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña para quemar los ladrillos.

Sus Ahorros los utilizara para mejorar su casa.

Los sueños de Rosa son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1600 sols, money which will be invested in the purchase of firewood which will be used to fire the bricks.

loans.name: Pea

texts.en:
Pea T., age 60, is a widow and lives in Phnom Penh with three of her children. She owns a plot of land and grows a variety of vegetables, earning around $1.50 each day. Her sons also are farmers, and  typically make $2 per day. One of her children is married and lives away from home.	

To make more money this family needs to have a loan from Kiva to purchase good seed to grow for the next season.

loans.use: To purchase good seed.

loans.name: Rutagengwa

texts.en:
Mr. Rutagengwa is an orphan. His parents were killed during the genocide in 1994. He now has four children in his charge. Rutagengwa joined Vision Finance in 2005.

With his first loan of 20,000 RWF, he continued selling clothes in Nyabugogo Market. He is now able to pay school fees for his young brothers. He is now requesting 500,890 RWF. It is his seventh loan.

loans.use: To increase his business capital

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun C. is 37 years old and works on a plot of land growing rice to earn a living to support her family. She also raises pigs to earn an extra income as well.

Planting rice has been a difficult job, as there is high inflation and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. In most of the provinces there are no irrigation systems yet, so farmers have to farm by depending on the sky. They all are very happy when they see the clouds are dark but if there is no rain they will face crop damage.

On average, Bun C. is able to earn around $7 each day. She has three children and all of them are students. She told a loan officer that she wants all her children to take a higher class. She does not want her children to grow rice like her because this work is so difficult and you earn less to support the family.

Bun C. is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 to invest in her existing business. She would like to both invest US$ 500 in her farm, and also put US$ 700 into raising animals, increasing her livestock. She sees these investments as opportunities that will be able to increase her daily income.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: invest US$ 500 in her farm and US$ 700 into her livestock

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia O., married with five children, has manufactured palm oil for sale at Braman in Cape Coast since 2007. Her husband is a commercial driver. Felicia uses her income to help her husband in the payment of the children's school fees as well as utility bills.

Felicia is requesting a loan to purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil, and she plans to reinvest any additional profits into the business in order to increase sales, thereby eventually increasing her income.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Doña Elena es casada, tiene 66 años D. edad, estudio sólo el primer año D. primaria, es madre D. 4 hijos ya mayores (tienen familia), vive en el Jr. Apurimac N: 328, distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao- Puno, y es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave. 

En un inicio con el préstamo D. S/. 300, compró una arroba D. coca que vendía en el mercado D. Ilave, al mismo tiempo se dedicaba a la crianza D. animales menores como porcinos. No pudo continuar sus estudios porque sus padres no la apoyaban.

Actualmente tiene una tienda D. abarrotes dedicándose también, conjuntamente con su esposo, a la elaboración D. pan. Viaja a diferentes lugares como López y Chipana para vender coca y reparte pan por las tardes en el mercado. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará más insumos para su panadería como 05 sacos D. harina, 05 sacos D. arroz, etc.

Su mayor sueño es aumentar su negocio y que su panadería crezca.
texts.en:
Elena is married, she is 66 years old, and she went to school only until graD. 1. She is mother of 4 children, all are now adults and have families. She lives in Jr. Apurimac No. 328, in the district of Ilave within the province of El Collao - Puno.

In the beginning with a loan amounting to S/.300, she purchased a load of cocoa that she later resold in the markets of Ilave. At the same time she also raised small animals, like piglets. She couldn't keep going to school because her parents did not support her.

Currently she runs a convenience store but she also bakes bread with the help of her husband. She travels to different places such as Lopez and Chipana where she can sell her cocoa and she also distributes her breads in the afternoons at the market.

With this loan, amounting to S/.2000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase more ingredients for her bakery, including, 5 sacks of flour, 5 sacks of rice, etc.

Her greatest dream is to increase her business and to see her bakery grow.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the bakery, such as flour and rice etc.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mrs. Sao K. lives in Pour Preas Sang village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Keo Soeng, work as hen breeders. Mrs. Sao K. is 52 years old and the mother of two, both of whom are working. Because their work place is too far from their house and they usually pay a premium for transportation, they want to buy a motorbike to commute to work. Thus, Mrs. Sao K. is seeking a loan to contribute to her fund to buy a motorbike for her children. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children

loans.name: Thao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thảo năm nay 49 tuổi, chị đang sống tại xã Cao Minh - Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh phúc. Năm 1996 chị Thảo tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nồi đất. Nhờ chăm chỉ làm ăn  nên công việc chăn nuôi, buôn bán  ngày càng phát triển giúp cho kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định hơn. Hiện tại chị Thảo đang đầu tư vốn để chăn nuôi lợn. Bên cạnh đó hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thên nguồn thu nhập từ lương làm bảo vệ của chồng  nên kinh tế gia đình rất ổn định với mức thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Thảo xin vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và  thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Thao Thi N., 49 years old, livest in the town of Cao Minh - Phuc Yen, province of Vinh Phuc. She joined the Fund in 1996 and borrowed money to invest in raising livestock and selling clay pots. Thanks to her hardwork, the livestock and clay pot sales expanded and increased day by day, helping her family's finances become more stable. Currently Mrs. N. is investing in raising pigs. Besides that, her family also has a monthly income from her husband's salary as a security guard, so her family's finances are very secure with an income of 6,000,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in buying more pigs and feed for the livestock business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy pigs, feed

loans.name: Anita Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Anita Isabel H. H. tiene 38 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco H., provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 4to de secundaria, tiene 04 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Anita, inicio su negocio vendiendo comida los días domingos en la puerta de su casa, luego cocinando menú todos los días, actualmente  reparte menú a diario a pensionistas, a la vez que cocina para algunos eventos de empresas, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal, lo invirtió en la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad.
Con el crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad para su negocio.
Anita tiene el gran sueño de lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Anita Isabel H. H. is 38 years old and she finished 4th year in secondary school. She has 4 dependent children. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco H., province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Anita started her business selling food on Sundays at her front door. After a while, she began to cook a daily menu. Currently, she delivers a daily menu to regular clients and at the same time, she cooks for company events, and she provides a delivery service. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to purchase basic food products. With this $475 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will purchase more basic food products for her business. Anita’s dream is to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic food products for her business

loans.name: Sarvarbi

texts.ru:
Назарова Сарварби 1970 года рождения, разведена, имеет 4 детей. Занимается продажей женскими одеждами на рынке «Панджшер» города Душанбе. Предпринимательскую деятельность начала в 2004 году с продажи нижнего белья. С каждым годом она увеличивала наименование товара. В данный момент у нее имеются женские вязаные джемперы, шерстяные и полушерстяные пуловеры, безрукавки, а также разнообразные нижние белья. Товары для продажи привозит с рынка «Корвон» города Душанбе. 
Ассортимент продаваемых ею товаров она хочет пополнить разновидностями халатов. В разгар сезона хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев для закупа сезонных товаров.
texts.en:
Born in 1970, Sarvarbi N. is divorced and has 4 children. She sells women’s clothes at the Pandjsher market in Dushanbe. She began her entrepreneurial activity in 2004 with lingerie sales and increased her goods assortment every year. She currently sells women’s sweaters, wool pullovers, vests and a variety of lingerie. Sarvarbi delivers the goods from the Korvon market in Dushanbe. She now wants to add a variety of robes to her goods assortment. Sarvarbi would like to participate in the Kiva program and obtain this $1100 loan to purchase seasonal goods. She will repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's robes

loans.name: Ederlyn

texts.en:
Canitoan,Cagayan de Oro City is one of the barangay (villages) hit by the calamity last January and most of the agricultural plants washed out. But despite the calamity, Mrs. Ederlyn R. stands firm and continues her plans without any discouragement.

Ederlyn has had a sari-sari (variety) store for quite a number of years. She was able to send her daughter and son to school, and she's very happy because she still survives in the midst of crises. She has 3 college students and 1 in the elementary grades. Ederlyn wants all of her children to finish college and land a decent job afterward. At this time, she needs to have additional capital for her variety store, amounting to PHP 11,000 to purchase a bulk quantity of basic commodities.

loans.use: to purchase a bulk quantity of basic commodities

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Leima

texts.en:
“Success is difficult to achieve for those who fail to try, but it is attainable for those who have the courage to try,” is Leima B.’s quotation in life.  She is an industrious mother from the village of Sta. Lucia in the municipality of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Stalin B. and they are blessed with three children: Lance Allen, 8; Leign Krestel, 6; and Leinard, 1. They live happily with a simple standard of living.

Leima is a dealer of fish and a prepaid phonecall credit retailer in their village.  This way, Leima helps her husband earn income for their family life satisfaction. She is borrowing her additional working capital of PHP7, 000 for her business maintenance. Learning to manage a simple vending business is of great help to her and her family, for her, it was of great achievement. Furthermore, she wants more to strengthen her business in order to increase her income thus working hard and patiently maintain her fish vending and prepaid phonecall credit retailing businesses. Somehow, she will expand the business with her income gains. Leima is hoping to enjoy the lending program she entered because it will be of great contribution towards the success of her business and in their life especially in terms of financial, social and spiritual.

loans.use: Business Maintenance

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all still in school. Some of them are currently in the senior-high school while others are in the junior-high and basic schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Beatrice works hard to make some income to help her husband to provide for the family. Beatrice is a trader. She trades in provisions such as milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. She procures the products from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and sells in her community. Beatrice says she owns a shop in which she sells. She has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to buy more goods to stock her shop.

loans.use: To buy more goods to stock her shop

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida C., a 54-year-old widow with two married children, is a pioneering and very good member of Paglaum MPC under its micro finance program, and has the title of MIGS or ‘member in good standing.’  This very hard-working mother, who has a gardening and  sari-sari store business, is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 for fertilizers, seedlings and some chemicals for her garden. She is thankful to Paglaum for the assistance and trust given to her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings for her gardenning.

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr:
A. Anne Marie est née le 20/06/1962 à Cotonou. Anne Marie est mariée à QUENUM David, un économiste de formation. Anne Marie est mère de deux (2) enfants, tous scolarisés. Anne Marie est Comptable de formation. Anne Marie fut agent de recouvrement d'un établissement financier de la place. Après son mariage, Anne Marie abandonna sa profession sur la demande de son mari qui la voulait indépendante. C'est ainsi que Anne Marie s'est mise dans le commerce. Anne Marie avait vendu des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). Mais depuis quatre ans Anne Marie a laissé les divers au profit de la vente de tissus. Anne Marie distribue ses tissus à crédit; c'est après le délais convenu avec le client, que Anne Marie passe récupérer son argent. Anne Marie a pu hisser son activité à un niveau supérieur grâce aux deux crédits qu'elle a eu de ALIDé. Aujourd'hui, Anne Marie sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé afin de continuer à développer son activité et d'y associer le vente d'huile végétal. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Anne Marie was born on June 20, 1962 in Cotonou. Anne Marie is married to Quenum David, a trained economist. She is the mother of 2 children, both enrolled in school. She is a trained accountent.

Anne Marie was a recovery agent for a financial establishment here. After her marriage, Anne Marie abandoned her profession at the request of her husband who wanted her to be independent. Thus, Anne Marie set herself up in business selling various items (candy, cookies; tins of milk, sardines, tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergent, dish soap, bath soap, etc.)

For the last four years, Anne Marie gave that up to sell cloth. She distributes the cloth on credit and after the interval agreed on with the customer, Anne Marie returns to recuperate her money. She has been able to raise the level of her business thanks to two loans that she received from ALIDé. Today, Anne Marie is requesting a third loan from ALIDé so as to continue to develop her business and add on the sale of vegetable oil.

The meaning of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria. Its average per capita income is US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 4 jerrycans of 50 liters of vegetable oil and 6 lengths of damask cloth

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita A. is a fish vendor. She sells fish to earn enough money to buy their needs. She is a 45 year old mother of four children. She has been selling fish for eight years already. Her husband is a fisherman. Both of them work very hard to support their children educational needs. In addition to selling fish, they have a small sari-sari store to supplement their income.
