She would like to ask a loan of PHP 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fish to sell. Aside from that, the loan will help a lot in repairing their boat.

CEVI is providing financial services to rural communities. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell and to repair their boat.

loans.name: Arlete Ana

texts.pt:
Arlete Ana C., natural de Namaacha, de 40 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 3 filhos de idades entre 18 e 25 anos dentre os quais dois são estudantes.
Estudou ate 11 classe e desistiu quando teve que ir ao lar.
Saiu de Namaacha a Maputo a fim de continuar com os estudos, depois que se separou do seu primeiro marido com o qual teve uma filha quando estava a fazer o segundo ano.
Do Instituto de Línguas de Maputo. Tempo depois, casou se com outro marido com o qual teve duas filhas. O segundo casamento durou cerca de 10 anos.
Neste momento vive na casa própria em boane a fazer negócios. Trabalha 10 horas por dia e sozinha. Tem 20 anos de experiência nesta actividade e o actual negocio mais forte é de venda de batata Reno e cebola, a grosso e retalho. Rende 7.000,00MT, mensalmente, que aplica na alimentação da família e manda algum dinheiro para sustentar a sua mãe.
Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo no valor dos 10.000,00MT com qual pretende dar continuidade a sua obra. Primeiramente levantou 10.000,00 e 15.000,00MT que foram para reforçar o negocio. Nunca teve empréstimo com outros bancos e soube da existência da hluvuku através de amigas.
Propõe se a reembolsar o empréstimo regularmente para poder aceder a mais créditos com o objectivo de terminar a sua obra, assim como ampliar o negocio.
texts.en:
Arlete Ana C., 40, is a native of Namaacha, Mozambique. She is the divorced mother of three children between the ages of 18 and 25 who are students. Arlete studied until the 11th grade, when she dropped out to stay at home. She left Namaacha for Maputo with the intention of continuing her studies, but she separated from her first husband when their child was younger than two. After some time, she married again and had two daughters. This second marriage lasted for about 10 years. Currently, Arlete lives in her own home in Boane and has her own wholesale and retail business selling potatoes and onions. With 20 years of experience, Arlete works 10 hours per day on her own. She makes 7,000 MZM monthly, which she uses to support her family, in addition to sending money to support her mother. Arlete learned about Hluvuku from friends, and she has not had loans through other banks. This is her third loan, a request for 10,000 MZM, which Arlete intends to use to continue construction on her home. The first and second loans raised 10,000 and 15,000 MZM, and were also used to build her business. Arlete plans to make regular payments so that she can borrow again in order to finish her home and continue to build her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene H. hopes that her "sari- sari" (mini-variety) store will grow into a grocery store /merchandising store, which would provide complete commodities for customers. She hopes that the volume of products she sells will increase and she could be a wholesaler for people in their community who want to start their own "sari-sari" store businesses. This way, she can generate employment in her community and she can also earn more money. Arlene will not only be helping other people in the community but foremost herself and family. These aspirations are rooted from her dream of sending all of her children to school and to have them be college graduates.

Arlene believes that all of her hopes can happen through the support of ASHI and KIVA. Through a loan she received, she had the opportunity to explore her potential in running a business and achieving success. 

Arlene started from scratch but now has a  business she is proud of. The loan she received from ASHI the first time improved her growing business. The first loan was small since she only needed a little capital. Now she requests Php45,000. Arlene plans to increase the volume of the grocery items and wants to have more variety to sell. With the support of her husband,  she is confident in taking a bigger risk for her business this time. Being a woman, she believes that she will be fulfilled if she has her own business and she can help her husband earn money for the needs of her children.

loans.use: purchasing necessary commodities to sell in her retail store.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy A. is 56 years old and she is married with six children. She sells ice cream in retail and wholesale to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more ice cream to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more beer and soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Rosa, ella es natural de Urubamba, vive en el barrio de los pisonay,   en pisonayniyoc, estos son árboles típicos y oriundos de la zona del valle de Urubamba, son unos árboles viejos, enormes y muy resistentes, es toda una alameda de ellos y amados por los residentes.

La socia tiene 65 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, la socia paralelamente al cuidado de su hogar se dedica al comercio minorista, ella vende chicha en la puerta de sus casa, tiene un negocio pequeño de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz fermentado, bebida típica en los andes de Perú), la socia requiere el préstamo en razón de que desea invertir en su negocio un poco precario y hacer de este un local bonito a la vista de propios y extraños.

La socia se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas, quedando muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a native of Urubamba. She lives in the Pisonay neighborhood in Pisonayniyoc. The Pisonay are native trees in the Urubamba Valley zone. The trees are old, large, and very hardy. The neighborhood has a large grove of Pisonay that are loved by the residents. Sra. Rosa is 65 years old, married, and has two children. She simultaneously takes care of her house and runs a small retail business, selling chicha out of her house (chicha is a corn liquor, typical of the Andes of Peru). She has requested a loan so that she can enhance the atmosphere of her storefront for locals and visitors. Sra. Rosa is dedicated to making her payments on time and is very grateful for the opportunity the loan will afford her.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sleiman

texts.en:
Sleiman is a 38-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2008 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of the family.

Today, Sleiman is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy tools to better satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: To buy tools for his business

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria D., age 50, lives in Surallah, South Cotabato. She runs a rice-farming business. She has 2 children. She earns Php 5,000 weekly from her 1-hectare (~2.5-acre) rice field and duck farm. Through her farm, she is able to make money that she uses to buy food and clothes and to meet the other needs of her family.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is requesting a loan of Php 6,000. The loan will help her to expand her business and become sustainable in the future.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa B. is a 44-year-old woman from Tala, Caloocan City. Her family lives among the poor communities in a village named Malaria. She has eight children with her husband, Fernando, who is a carpenter. Teresa never seems to get tired in managing her businesses. She has a sari-sari (general) store and a play station where large video-karaoke machines and game consoles are for hire. With these businesses, Teresa makes a net monthly income of P14,000. She uses her profits to support the basic daily needs of the family, especially her children’s education. Upon her friend’s invitation, and out of curiosity, Teresa attended an orientation conducted for women entrepreneurs, sometime in 2008, by staff from the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She is now applying for a new loan in the amount of P10,000. which she will use to purchase more items to sell at her store. A portion of the loan proceeds will be used for her daughter’s college education. She dreams of seeing her store someday grow as big as the city’s supermarkets. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell at her store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora D. is from the village of Dullan. She is 57 years old, is married and has four school-aged children.

Leonora owns and operates a business planting and harvesting coconuts. She also sells viands (tasty dishes). She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Leonora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is a 33-year-old married woman with four children aged between 9 and 17 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with six people. She also takes care of additional family members. The Family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication.

Zaituni works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to and from shopping and incurs transport costs to and from buying fruits and vegetables from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of twenty-five customers a day and sells to all categories of people but retail only. Her major business challenges include the ever increasing prices of fruits and vegetables and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her because she works in a open place.

Zaituni has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for seven years and is servicing her twentieth loan. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with it. She wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of fruits and vegetables like mangoes, oranges, tomatoes and cabbages. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Luis Antonio Gómez  es Soltero tiene a su cargo sus dos Hijos, el ha trabajado con Ceprodel durante seis años y en ese lapso ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 7 créditos que ha trabajado con Ceprodel.

El crédito solicitado es para  Mejoramiento de vivienda cambio del sistema eléctrico, con el fin de darle una mejor seguridad  a la viviendo.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Antonio Gómez is single and cares for his two children. He has worked with Ceprodel for six years and in this time he has managed to improve his living conditions with the seven credits he has had. The requested credit will go towards making improvements to his home by replacing his electricity system with the goal of making his home more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

loans.name: Melania Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Melania desde hace varios años tiene un cafetín el cual logro poner con ahorros y dinero que prestaba en otros bancos, como madre soltera era mas difícil por que no tenia el apoyo moral ni económico lo cual fue una meta poder esforzarse cada día para apoyar  a sus hijos. Están ya mayores el cual uno de ellos trabaja y es casado y el otro es discapacitado por el cual aun cuida. Con sus crédito ha venido mejorando su casa como su negocio, con este quiere invertir en la compra de lácteos, jugos, gaseosas, diferentes bebidas ya que es lo que mas vende por gracias a Dios ha venido comprando diferentes productos para su negocio y desea surtirlo para dar un mejor servicio en gusto y preferencia de sus clientes. También comprara golosinas, repostería y otros. Contenta por el apoyo del financiamiento ya que ha logrado la inversión a corto plazo gracias al apoyo de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Melania has had a cafeteria for several years that she was able to establish with savings and money loaned from other banks. As a single mother, it was very difficult since she had neither moral nor economic support. Her goal was to strive every day to support her children. They are grown now, and one works and is married. The other is disabled and still in her care. With loans, she has improved her home as well as her business. With this loan, she wants to invest in the purchase of milk, juice, sodas, and different beverages because that is what she has sold the most, thanks to God. She has bought different products for her store and she wants to stock it to cater to the tastes and preferences of her customers. Also, she will buy candies, pastries, etc… She is content with the financial support that has allowed her to make short-term investments thanks to the support of Afrodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk, juices, sodas, candies and sweets

loans.name: Sonia Monica

texts.es:
Sonia T. de 38 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento su esposo es pescador, con el tiene 4 hijos uno de 23 años, 16 años, 11 años y 9 años.

Sonia empezó vendiendo cortinas hace 8 años atrás, de hay hace un año atrás implemento en el negocio la venta de productos Yanbal y sabanas, ahora el horario de trabajo es en la mañana, uno de los problemas mas comunes que tiene es cuando se le inflaman los pies por las caminatas que tiene que hacer cuando va a entregar los productos.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sabanas, perfumes, cremas, maquillajes para incrementar el negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar una computadora para poder llevar un mejor control de sus clientes y rutas.
texts.en:
Sonia T. is 38 years old, and lives near an urban area located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her home is made of cement and her husband is a fisherman, and with him, she has 4 children, of 23, 16, 11 and 9 years old.

Sonia began selling curtains 8 years ago, and a year before she began selling Yanbal products and sheets. Now her work hours are in the morning, and one of the more common problems that she has is that her feet get swollen because of the long walks that she has to do when she goes to deliver the products.

With the loan she wants to buy sheets, perfumes, creams, and makeup to increase her business. In the future she wants to buy a computer to be able to have better control of her customers and routes.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets, perfumes and curtains.

loans.name: Qamet

texts.en:
Qamet S. is a 39-year-old farmer who grows apples, pears and pomegranates in the small village of Agsu. He has been engaged in this business since 1986 as an additional source of income for his family.

Qamet is married and has two children who are the meaning of his life. Qamet is a veterinarian but during the last five years, raising fruit has become the main source of income for Qamet and his family. 

Qamet applied for 1,600 AZN to purchase fertilizer which he is going to order from Turkey. He counts on your help.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his fruit trees

loans.name: Genesis

texts.en:
Genesis C. is from the village of Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 46 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Genesis owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as snack food, candies, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Genesis is just starting this business.
In 2010, Genesis joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Makrina

texts.en: Makrina E. is a small business woman who is married with two school children.  She runs a food shop at Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of food products at her shop. She purchases the items directly from wholesale suppliers and shops at the city market shopping center. Business goods sold include; rice, beans, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She has been in this business for four years and she meets the family daily needs through her business income. She is seeking a loan of T.shs 500,000 in order to increase business capital.

loans.use: To increase business capital.

loans.name: Everardo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Everardo Antonio R. B., tiene 34 años vive en el Barrio de Palestina es acompañado y su mujer se dedicxa a los quehaceres domésticos ello tienen 3 hijos que actualmente estudian la escuela primaria, ellos se dedican desde hace 20 años a al agricultura.

Dentro de los principales probelmas que han enfrentado, ha sido la afectacion de las plagas, sze iniciaron en los trabajos de la cosecha de piña gracias a la reforma agraria y dentro de los planes a futuro esta la diversificacion en la simebra de tomate en una manzana de tierra, ella solicita de u prestamo para la ompra de fertilizantes que ataquen de inmediato el problema de las plagas que esta amanezando con la producción, espera se le apoye economicamente y de esta manera ayudarla a evolucionar y desarrollar nuevos proyectos que le permitan mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Everardo Antonio R. B., age 34, lives in the Palestina neighborhood with his wife. She devotes herself to the household chores. They have three children who are currently in elementary school. They have been farming for 20 years. Pests are one of the main problems they have encountered. They started cultivating pineapples thanks to the agrarian reform. Among their future plans is diversification by planting tomatoes on one block of land. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, which will immediately attack the problem of the pests that are threatening the production. He hopes that he receives economic help, which will help him evolve and develop new projects. These will allow him to have better economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and farming supplies

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es:
Marjorie R. H.  es un señora de 38 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo  y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Caño Negro localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.


Desde hace 1 año  Doña Marjorie se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos. Ella dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de sus hijos le  facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como desde el inicio su negocio le ha generado ganancia y poco a poco va creciendo por que  la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.

 Actualmente doña Marjorie está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢657.000 (seiscientos cincuenta y siete mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.


Doña Marjorie forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo. Pero doña Marina destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito se puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Marjorie R. H. is 38 year old woman who lives with her husband and three children in the community of Caño Negro located in Los Chiles, in the province of Alajuela. This community is known for its mountainous terrain and for its proximity to country's northern border. The area's principal economic activities are livestock farming and agriculture, growing specifically basic grains, sugar, and orange. Marjorie has been raising and feeding laying hens to produce meat and eggs. She sells her products to her neighbors, who are very satisfied. She has the support and help of her children which makes it easier to continue with her business. Additionally, she believes this endeavor is very interesting as she has seen how her business generates earnings and grows little by little as demand increases. Currently, Marjorie is asking for a microloan of ¢657,000 (six hundrend fifty seven thousand colones) for the purchase of more chickens and hens, concentrate, and supplies for the treatment of diseases. With it, she expects to grow her business and improve her quality of life. Her business is doing well but because of lack of capital, she has been unable to grow it even more. With the loan she's asking for she expects to increase sales, thereby improving the economic conditions of her family. Marjorie belongs to the "Empresa de Crédito Comunal Emcrecoba," one of the 100 partner organizations for EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan. She mentions that because of organizations like those and others that facilitate credit she is able to devote more time to productivie activities.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens, construction of shop to sell chickens

loans.name: Henrik

texts.en: Henrik A. was born in 1955. He is married and lives with his family in Kirants village, Ijevan area. Henrik has three children: two daughters and a son. His elder daughter is married and lives separately from her parents. The two other children are school age. For 33 years, Henrik has worked in the electric power station as an electrical technician. At the same time, he has been engaged in farming. On his farm he has cows, pigs and chickens. He also is engaged in land cultivation. Henrik's wife helps him a lot in farming. With the income from farming, Henrik solved his family needs, organized his daughter's wedding and enlarged his farm. Henrik asks for an 850,000-AMD loan to buy some calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy some calves and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Pathma

texts.en:
Pathma is a 55-year-old woman who lives in Telijjawila in the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She has three sons and three daughters. 

Pathma has managed a spice business for one year with the help of her daughters and sons. She is very enthusiastic about her business.

Pathma has requested a 25,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy spices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Né vers 1966 à San, Fatoumata B. s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère puisse qu’elle n’ a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Mariée et mère de 7  enfants, Fatoumata vit chez son époux et leurs enfants  au quartier  Bagadadji  de la ville de San préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali) 
Elle est très sollicitée par ses nombreux clients pour la qualité de ses marchandises.   
Dans le souci de  mieux satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle  décida de faire recours à l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois  ans. Après  4 cycles de prêt solidaire elle est venue au prêt individuel. 
Elle est à son premier individuel et compte l’utiliser pour acheter journellement, 50kg de poissons  qui seront vendus sa clientèle composé  de femmes et d’hommes, en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 26 000 FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt et utiliser  le reste pour payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, acheter la nourriture et investir le reste dans d’autres activités de revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1966 in San, Ms. Fatoumata B. did not have the chance to go to school. So she quickly became interested in revenue-generating businesses from her mother. Married and the mother of seven children, she lives with her husband and children in the Bagadadji district in San City, San Prefecture (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She is in high demand by her numerous customers for the quality of her merchandise. Concerned about better satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to turn toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After four solidarity loan cycles, she came to individual loans. She is on her first individual loan and plans on using it to buy on a daily basis 50 kg of fish that will be sold to her customers, who are composed of women and men. She accepts cash and often credit for these retail sales. Fatoumata hopes to make a monthly profit of 26,000 francs CFA that she envisions using to make loan payments, to cover the schooling costs for her children, to buy food, and to reinvest the rest in other revenue activities.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fresh fish

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say P., 55, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She grows rice for an income of about $1 per day. Her husband is a traditional musician, earning an income of around $2 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work at the factory. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ndeye Diouma

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Ndeye Diouma N. est une habitante de Baye Laye. Elle est âgée  de 35 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse depuis octobre 2008. Elle s’adonne  depuis longtemps  à la vente de petit déjeuner  devant son domicile. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi par passion  et aussi dans le but de s’occuper. Ses moments les plus favorables pour son activité  sont l’année  scolaire et les dimanches. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  car elle souhaite démarrer  une activité  de vente de thioup  afin de diversifier son commerce. Les  gains réalisés  seront consacres a soutenir sa famille et a constituer une épargne.
texts.en:
Miss Ndeye Diouma N. lives in Baye Laye. She is 35 years old. She is a member of the credit institution since October 2008. She has been selling breakfast in front of her home for a long time, a business she chose by taste and to keep busy. The best times for her business are during the school year and on Sundays. She asks for a 100,000 francs loan because she wishes to start up a thioup selling business so as to diversify her trade. She will use the profits to sustain her family and build up savings.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build capital

loans.name: Noëlie

texts.fr: Née le 22 Décembre 1966 à Cotonou, H. Noëlie est mariée à MITO Basile et est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. La famille réside depuis cinq ans, au quartier Agbalilamè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Noëlie vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales, grâce au revenu de son activité. Noëlie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Depuis sept ans, Noëlie mène cette activité. De façon secondaire, Noëlie vend des mèches, des produits de coiffure et aussi des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son salon de coiffure. Noëlie  achète ses produits à Cotonou. C'est la première fois que Noëlie sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on December 22, 1966 in Cotonou, Noëlie H. is married to Basile Mito and has four children, some of whom are in school. The couple has one other child in their care. For the last five years the family has lived in the Agbalilamè neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Noëlie helps her husband to pay the family expenses, thanks to income from her business. She left secondary school and learned hairdressing, and she has now been in the business for seven years. In addition, she sells hair extensions, hairstyling products, and telephone cards in her beauty salon. Noëlie buys her products in Cotonou. This is the first time that she is requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to increase her stock of products and better satisfy her clients.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and hairstyling products.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard S. is a 42 year old man who is married to Rael Kipyegon, a housewife and small scale farmer. Leonard resides in Chepsigot, Keiyo South District, and he supports an extended family of five and his four children.

Leonard as been farming commercially for the last three years. The farming business has been giving Leonard an everage income of Kshs.3,000 per month from his mango and banana farm. He has borrowed a loan of Kshs 40,000, his second loan from Kadet Ltd., and he intends to use Kshs 10,000 to purchase pesticides & fungicides, Kshs 10,000 to prepare the land and fence it, and the remaining Kshs. 20,000 to purchase maize and bean seeds to expand his farming business.
 
Leonard anticipates he will use the profits from the business to expand the farming business, educate his children, and also support his family. His dreams and hopes are to became a famous businessman and own a plot, to construct rental houses in Iten town, another major town in the country.

loans.use: To purchase maize and beans seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Koudavi

texts.en: Mrs. Koudavi A. has a general store in Lomé, Togo. She sells different sorts of groceries like canned goods, fresh vegetables, rice, and other items. She is 33 years old and has 2 children. Her husband is a pastor. Mrs. A. has requested a loan of 200,000 CFA in order to purchase more merchandise to sell in her store. Normally, she purchases her goods from the Grand Marché in Lomé.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni L. is currently in the business of selling dresses, trousers, bedsheets, and saddles at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock pairs of shoes to sell.  

Poni is 51 years old and widowed. She has 7 children, and 4 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build two house to rent.

loans.use: To stock pairs of shoes to sell

loans.name: Melissa Lisseth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Familiar se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Colorado a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes negocios como la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

Melissa es socia del banco hace dos ciclos y está muy contenta y agradecida con la Fundación Espoir ya que gracias a su primer préstamo puso su negocio.
 
Tiene 18 años y está soltera, dice que ella vivía en el campo pero que por sus estudios se vino a Colorado, vive en la casa de su tía, estudia en la Universidad de Manta.

Ella vende productos de AVON (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios para damas) recorre con sus productos todas las tardes y en las noches  aprovecha en su Universidad para vender a sus amigas de clase, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente o por quincena, dice que siempre pide lo que sus clientes le solicitan y que hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien ya que le da para vivir y para sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar mas productos ya que tiene muchos pedidos y todavía no ha cobrado la mercadería que ha entregado.
 
Sus metas son terminar su carrera y luego ejercer su profesión como licenciada.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Familiar" meets every 15 days in a place called Colorado, a few minutes from Montecristi. Here the majority of the residents have different business such as making tagua buttons, handicrafts and business in general. Melissa has been a member of the bank for two cycles. She is very happy and grateful to Fundación Espoir since with her first loan she started her business. She is 18 years old and single. She says that she would live in the country, but her studies brought her to Colorado. She lives with her aunt and studies at the University of Manta. She travels every afternoon and evening selling Avon products (beauty products, perfumes and women's accessories) taking advantage of her university connections to sell to her classmates. She sells her products on credit and collects payments weekly or every 2 weeks. She says that she always orders what her customers request and, until now, it has gone very well since she has earned what she needs to live and for her studies. She will use this loan to buy more products since she has many orders and still has not collected on the merchandise that has been delivered. Her goals are to finish school and practice her profession as a graduate.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase Avon beauty products and perfumes

loans.name: Myagmardolgor

texts.en:
Myagmardolgor T. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her two daughters both attend a local middle school. Her husband works as the head of a department in the Bureau of Standards.

Myagmardolgor operates a training center for traditional bootmaking in the local community. She teaches how to make Mongolian traditional boots and felt products to her customers. She also produces a variety of traditional boots and felt products herself to sell for profit. She has been engaged in this training service since 1995 and has gained significant experience with her sustainable business.

Myagmardolgor is a very polite and gentle woman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a sewing machine and materials for her bootmaking training center. She hopes to continue expanding her business and establish her own big training center.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Miguel Estuardo

texts.es:
Miguel Estuardo L. C. tiene 47 anos. Vive en union libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos: Robinson de 12 anos y Robert de 2 anos. 

Miguel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, frejol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total. 

Miguel se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace unos 20 anos que realiza labores agrícolas. Compra los insumos aquí en Ventanas y vende sus productos en la Parroquia de San Carlos. Solicita el credito para arrendar tierra para sembrar mas maíz, incrementando poco a poco sus cultivos. Su sueno es construir una casa. 

Le gusta jugar deportes, especialmente el volley.
texts.en: Miguel is 47 years old and lives with his common-law wife in Cantón de Ventanas, province of Los Rios. He has two children: Robinson, 12; and Robert, 2. Miguel is a member of the Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) community bank, which is located 25 kilometers from Cantón de Ventanas. The group makes a living working on short-cycle crops (corn, rice, soy, beans and cocoa), and there are 14 members overall. Miguel makes a living harvesting corn and rice, and has worked in agriculture for the past 20. He buys supplies in Ventanas and sells his products in the parish of San Carlos. He is requesting the loan so he can rent land to plant more corn, increasing his crops little by little. His dream is to build a home. He enjoys playing sports, especially volleyball.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Đồng Thôn 3 Nhóm 16 (Nhóm 16) Group

texts.en:
Mơ Trương Thị is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Mơ is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 3 Nhóm 16 (Nhóm 16).


Mơ is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Mơ operates a family member's business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Mơ has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Mơ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Mơ plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand the business.


About the other borrowers in the group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. is a 21-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị P. is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Nguyễn Thị N. is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector providing recycling services.


4.  Kiều Thị L. is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Mơ Trương Thị (20203040111) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Mơ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 3 nhóm 16 (Nhóm 16).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Mơ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Mơ kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Mơ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị P. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị N. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


4.  Kiều Thị L. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: School dues for his children

loans.name: Adriana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Adriana Del Pilar S. R. tiene 39 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Adriana se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 15 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que todos los hijos estudian y tengan un titulo profesional.
Le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Adriana is 39 years old. She lives with her common-law husband and their children in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Rios province. She has 3 children.
The members of the community bank V.R.C. El LA UNION can be found in the Aguas Frías precinct which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. This group works in agrictulture, growing crops such as maize, rice, and beans. They have been doing this work for a long time. 
Cruz is a farmer and mostly grows maize, rice, and beans, and has been doing this for 15 years. She buys her supplies in Ventanas and sells them in the marketplace in Ventanas in the same precinct. 
She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for the crops. The loan will help her to meet her financial needs. She faces challenges such as agricultural pests and diseases and climatic variability. Her dream is that all her children will study in school and take-up professions. 
She likes to clean the house.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Reveca

texts.es: Reveca, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los arduos días de trabajo que Reveca tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, junto a la mayor de sus hijas trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como sus cultivos van creciendo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos que utiliza para eliminar a las plaga de insectos, pueden afectar su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, siente que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que quiere acceder a otros créditos en el futuro. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Reveca is 34 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her 3 beloved children who are her motivation to work hard.  Reveca works hard on her farm which has enabled her to improve her crops and make her land more productive.  Together with her eldest daughter, she works from very early in the morning, growing cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  These are products which she will later take to sell in the city of San Francisco.  What she most likes about her work is sowing her crops and watching them grow.  She has been in this business for 10 years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be spraying her crops since the chemicals that she uses to get rid of insects can affect her health.  Over time, she hopes to buy more land and thereby expand her production.

This is Reveca's first loan with MFP.  She knows that she has to make her loan repayments punctually and she is ready to do so since she would like to be able to access further loans in the future.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is a 30-year-old mother of three. She has been operating a salon for three years and has managed to employ two people in her business. She also relies on her husband for financial support. She hopes to open a big beauty parlor in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a hair dryer.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Nepthalie

texts.en:
Nepthalie S., a 43-year-old married mother of three school-aged children, is from the village of Bagacay, Sibutad. To make a living, Nepthalie runs a grocery store selling basic household items in the local community. Engaged in her business for four years, she earns a monthly net income of 3000.00.

In 2010, Nepthalie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional stocks to sell, she is requesting her third loan of 14,000 PHP to be used as additional working capital.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria D. sells maize and gari at Breman near Elmina. Victoria has received a senior high level of education. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a Bursar at a school. Victoria has been selling maize and gari for 15 years now. She assists in paying the school fees and other expenses for the children since her husband's income is too small to take care of all the expenses of the home. 

Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of maize and gari to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the food selling business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more sacks of maize and gari to sell.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Collabinas” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Estudió educación superior. 
Su primer préstamo solicitado que fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de celulares, cosméticos y manualidades. Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará cinco celulares, ella trabaja con sus ayudantes y su esposo trabaja en el municipio.
Su sueño a futuro es aumentar la mercadería y mejorar su tienda.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las capacitaciones que recibe
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Collabinas” which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 31 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Graciela studied for her higher education.

The first loan she requested was in the amount of 500 PEN and was invested in her business of selling mobile phones, cosmetics, and handicrafts. Graciela has been working with Manuela Ramos for one year. With this loan of 1500 PEN, she will buy five mobile phones. She works with her assistants while her husband works in the city.

Her dream for the future is to increase her inventory of merchandise and improve her store. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings and the training she receives.

loans.use: Purchase five mobile phones

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen members located in Kandal Kaoh Touch village in Kandal province. Mrs. Nga N., who was born in 1955, is the village bank president selected by the other members.

She and her husband, Mr. Bung Chea, are farmers who own a 1.6-hectare plot of land on which they grow rice and taro to support their family. Mrs. Nga N. would like to ask for a loan to buy taro seeds and rice seeds to maintain her crops. 

This couple works hard with their farming to support their four children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory, one is a farmer, and one attends a local school.

loans.use: to buy taro seeds and rice seeds

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 34 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rene de 34 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Dania de 13 y Etno de 7 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los cultivos de Nilda, son de los mejores cuidados del poblado de Patay (Provincia del distrito de Tarma), es así que los productos que tiene, que son papa, arvejas y lechuga, son de muy buena calidad, ya que ella se ha encargado de fertilizarlos constantemente. En el mercado de Tarma, que es donde vende sus productos, los clientes solicitan mucho sus cultivos, motivo por el cual siempre obtiene un buen precio por ellos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la época de la cosecha, ya que siente que los meses de arduo trabajo, son recompensados, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas. Con el tiempo, planea comprar un puesto en el mercado mayorista, con el cual desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que siente que tiene un compromiso con la institución. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para sus chacras, también desea comprar semillas de arveja y papa.
texts.en:
Nilda is 34 years old and a very happy, hard-working mother.  She lives in her own home with her husband Rene, 34, and her two beloved children Dania, 13, and Etno, 7, who are the main reason she tries so hard to get ahead.  Nilda is said to provide the best care for her crops in the town of Patay (province of the Tarma District).  Her potato, pea and lettuce products are top quality because she is constantly fertilizing them.  In the Tarma market where she sells her products, customers ask for her products frequently and she is able to get good prices for them.  What she likes most about what she does is the harvest season because she feels compensated for all the months of hard-work.  She has been in agriculture for 11 years and feels that the hardest part is protecting against plagues.

In the future she plans to buy a stall in the wholesale market so she can improve income.  This is her ninth loan through MFP and she has always been punctual about making her payments as she is very committed to the institution.  Within the communal bank she is a member who is very committed to group development.  She plans to use the 1500 PEN loan to buy fertilizer for her land as well as pea and potato seeds.

loans.use: To buy pea and potato seeds, as well as sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor B.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is a 40-year-old single man from the village of Canabuan Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. Victor has been in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every four month harvest season. In 2011, Victor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Victor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Mbisbis

texts.en:
Mbisbis O. has been a farmer for the last three years. He is 34 years old married and supports four people.

He learned about KADET LTD from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area of habitat. Being this is his second loan, he has planned to spend it all in farming. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and to buy a bigger farm.

His dream is to be the best and well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to spend towards farming.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Eam M. is 43 years old and sells fruits in Takeo Province. Her business has been around for about four years, and she makes US$10 every day. Her husband has been working as a local Khmer teacher since 1990 and is able to make US$3 per day. Eam M. is now requesting a loan of US$1000 in order to increase her stock of fruits to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to expand the business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 43 años es soltero, tiene casa propia con servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en elpueblo joven Jesús Nazareno Cautivo a 10 minutos del distrito de Monsefú y 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.   La cual  se caracteriza por se una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Pedro  desde hace 10 años trabaja como ayudante de construcción, lo contratan  por temporadas y el ingreso que le dan es diario, lo que le permite solventar sus gastos.  Pero ultimamanete como se a incrementado el rubro de construcción, trabajo no le falta y como lo conocen lo recomiendan, lo que le permite mejorar más su calidad de vida.

A solicitado Pedro a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  500 nuevos soles para comprar herramientas nuevas y reponerlas que están bien deterioradas.  Esto le permitirá realizar mejor su trabajo y con más facilidad, el crédito lo ira pagando  de acuerdo a sus ingresos pero será puntual y responsable.

Pedro es un hombre  muy dedicado a su trabajado, alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir superandose.
texts.en:
Pedro is 43 years old and he is single. He owns his own house and it is installed with running water and with electricity. It is located in the new village of Jesus Nazareno Cautivo, at 10 minutes from the district of Monsefu, and at 15 minutes from the province of Chiclayo. It a region known for its agriculture, farming, and its crafts. 

Pedro has been a construction assistant for the past 10 years. He is a seasonal employee and the income that he earns is given to him daily, which helps him cover his expenses. But lately there has been an increase in construction and there is no want for work and as he is already known he is recommended. This helps him improve the quality of his life.

Pedro requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles to purchase new tools and to replace his tools that have worn out. This will help him improve his work and it will help him to complete it with ease. The loan will be paid in accordance with his income but he will be on time and responsible. 

Pedro is a very dedicated to his work. he is happy and he is very eager to keep improving.

loans.use: to purchase new construction tools.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio de 34 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad por medio de unos ahorros que tenia  fue con muy pocos productos que  inicio su pulpería, como fue con grano básicos, jugos, pan y galletas. El compra su mercadería cada semana ya que tiene ciertos productos que son bien solicitados por sus clientes. El crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, jugos, refrescos, pan, sopas, fósforos, cremas para cabello, leche en bolsa y detergentes.  Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería para que su negocio se incremente y también sus ganancias.
texts.en: Marco Antonio is 34 years old. He is a hardworking person who started out his business with some savings he had. He started out his grocery store with very few products, such as basic grains, juices, bread and cookies. He purchases his merchandise every week, especially because some products are in high demand by his clients. The loan will be used to purchase basic grains, juices, soft drinks, bread, soups, matches, hair treatments, milk, and detergents. With the help of his loan he wants to purchase more merchandise so that his business and his earnings will increase.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, juices, soft drinks, bread, soups, matches, milk, and detergents for his general store.
